story:
Picsnatch - is a stationary kiosk for printing photos out of Instagram with moment-selfie option, size 3*4 inches. 



After the end of Indiegogo company backers will get printed photos out of his account (you should send your account name to our e-mail after money transfer)..
We want to revive photoprinting fashion and mix new trend to store photos in social networks with best in our opinion format. Because we believe that prints that you can hold in your hands are much better, evoking more emotions, than photos on the screen of a gadget.  It is a extraordinary present for friends and relatives. If you cherish your memories, you'll get and support our idea. 

How it works. Picsnatch - is a kiosk with body made of wood and dye-sublimation printer plus special software inside. To start printing you just need to input your nickname into the search line, open your page and select the photo. If the profile is private, Picsnatch will demand to open the access. You can select and print some area of the photo and make a signature using built-in photoeditor. Then you put money into the bill acceptor and in 26 seconds get cherished photos.



Legendary format.  We have chosen 3*4 inches size because we consider it the most comfortable and beautiful at the same time. It looks cool even without frames and can be taken anywhere. 


What are we going to do with 50 000?

this amount of money is necessary for starting and setting the production line, because we don't have large flows of funding. Helping with funds you can enclose us to our dream to spread such kiosks all over the world for fun and pleasure. 

Why you should support us? we really believe that our product can revive photoprinting world. We constantly test our production and see it bringing joy and pleasure to users. 

 

Here are some reasons why you should fund us.

It gives us possibility to:

- create production line and start acception orders. 

- promote it globally.

- continue hardware development.

We want to make Picsnatch printing out of all social networks and add print on magnets option.




                                                                 

                                                   Команда Picsnatch
story_txt:
Picsnatch - is a stationary kiosk for printing photos out of Instagram with moment-selfie option, size 3*4 inches. 
After the end of Indiegogo company backers will get printed photos out of his account (you should send your account name to our e-mail after money transfer)..
We want to revive photoprinting fashion and mix new trend to store photos in social networks with best in our opinion format. Because we believe that prints that you can hold in your hands are much better, evoking more emotions, than photos on the screen of a gadget.  It is a extraordinary present for friends and relatives. If you cherish your memories, you'll get and support our idea. 

How it
works. Picsnatch - is a kiosk with body made of wood and dye-sublimation printer plus special software inside. To start printing you just need to input your nickname into the search line, open your page and select the photo. If the profile is private, Picsnatch will demand to open the access. You can select and print some area of the photo and make a signature using built-in photoeditor. Then you put money into the bill acceptor and in 26 seconds get cherished photos.



Legendary
format.  We have chosen 3*4 inches size because we consider it the most comfortable and beautiful at the same time. It looks cool even without frames and can be taken anywhere. 



What are we going to do with 50 000?
this amount of money is necessary for starting and setting the production line, because we don't have large flows of funding. Helping with funds you can enclose us to our dream to spread such kiosks all over the world for fun and pleasure. 
Why you should support us? we really believe that our product can revive photoprinting world. We constantly test our production and see it bringing joy and pleasure to users.  


Here are some reasons why you should fund us.
It gives us possibility to:
- create production line and start acception orders. 
- promote it globally.
- continue hardware development.
We want to make Picsnatch printing out of all social networks and add print on magnets option.





                                                                 
                                                   Команда Picsnatch

story:
Breve reseña

Estiven Josué Ramos de 17 años es un Joven Guatemalteco apasionado por su trabajo. Vende tortillas en la Plaza el Amate, uno de los centros comerciales populares más grandes de la ciudad. 

Ser sencillo no equivale a ser descuidado y Estiven Josué Ramos de 17 años lo sabe muy bien.

Los locatarios de El Amate lo conocen como “el Licenciado” porque todos los días llega de traje a trabajar. Vive junto con su mamá y cuatro hermanos en el Barrio San Antonio de la zona 6 y dice que uno de sus sueños más grandes es continuar sus estudios, porque sólo llegó a quinto primaria, para extender su empresa y sacar adelante a su familia.

Su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios de colegio, mismos que tuvo que abandonar para apoyar económicamente a su familia. 


Lo que necesitamos de ti. 

Queremos invitarte a que te unas a nuestra iniciativa y así ayudar a nuestro hermano Guatemalteco a realizar sus sueños. 
No importa la cantidad de tu aporte, cada dolar recolectado marcará la diferencia en la vida de nuestro amigo. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Tu aporte no tiene que ser económico, ayúdanos a compartir esta campaña con tus familiares y amigos a través de redes sociales, correo electrónico o cualquier medio digital. Mientras más personas logremos involucrar, mayor será el impacto. 


Imágenes por Santiago Billy - Diario Digital

Redacción Referencia: Ferdy Montepeque - Diario Digital

story:
The Challenge

As the list of issues facing our community increases, so does the need for positive outlets for youth development. That's where YouthServe comes in. 

YouthServe Inc. was born of a merger between two existing organizations: First Look and Birmingham Youth Service Corps in 2004. Focused on its mission of empowering youth leadership through community service, YouthServe is the largest and most diverse non-religious youth organization in Birmingham.

 Each year, our programs reach thousands of students from over 60 different schools across the region.  These students come together to not only serve the community but to become educated about issues facing teens and enhance their leadership skills in a safe and positive environment.

We believe in our programming and realize the need for it in our community and our staff works tirelessly to extend YouthServe's reach, but we need your help.

One of our very generous donors has pledged $10,000 to YouthServe if we are able to raise $10,000! That's where you come in. 


How Your Gift Helps

Service Education: 

$25 per student and $500 per class

Scholarship to Urban Service Camp:

$600 per camper

One Year of Leadership on Youth Action or Youth Philanthropy Council:

$2,000 per student

Work/Service Day Facilitation: 

$5,000 - $6,000


So far in 2015...



About YouthServe

 YouthServe has grown and evolved over the years and now has four main areas of programming: Community Action; Service Education - service-learning curriculum that is taught in area schools; Urban Service Camps - three week-long residential camps in which teens perform community service while living downtown and engaging in social justice and development workshops; and the Youth Philanthropy Council - a program in which participating teens learn about philanthropy and award $20,000 to local organizations via The Joseph S. Bruno Foundation. 

In 2014, YouthServe was named Non-Profit of the Year (with a budget of under $500,000) by the Birmingham Business Alliance and continues to gain momentum today.


Our Impact


Get Involved

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about YouthServe! 
If you would like to find out more about our programs, contact us! 
YouthServe, Inc.
2717 7th Avenue South
Birmingham, AL 3253
Phone: 205-521-6651
www.youthservebham.org

story:
Hi guys! 

We are in a situation and need for help. This story could be similar to many onters, but it has some big differences.

I have a friend in Russia, he’s a very nice guy and likes Europe very much. He also has 2 children and dreaming about take a tour in EU with them.

Not long ago he got a problem - his house burned out. So, he rents apartments or lives in his friends houses while saving up some money to build up new house for his family. Yesterday he called me and asked for help and I gave him some money. Then he talked me a story that felt me uneasy and I decided to help him. That’s why I’m asking you to help too.


Before he asked me for help he called some of his russian friends (let s call him Greedy Homophobe, very kind, to my mind):


(my translation from Russian)

Friend: Hi. Can you borrow me 200 Euros? I need to  make payments for apartments and documents recovery. I’ll sed it back to you in 2 months.

Greedy Homophobe: You know.. I ahve no cash now, just some money on my bank account and  I have no time for it.

Friend: Well, it’s clear.

Greedy Homophobe: Ha, your european friends doesnt’t help you? This is how it happens when they’re protecting gays rights instead, but nobody cares of you.

Friend: First of all, Gays are ordinary people too. And I havent’t asked any one of europeans for help, but I’m asking you. I think if you ask them you can get less talks but much more real doings. After all, it’s not their business.

Greedy Homophobe: So you  should ask your ordinary europeans, and then number of your friends will significantly decrease, ha-ha))

Friend: excuse me.


Then he caled me. I gave him some money and got an idea about how to help. So I asked to call “Homophobe” again and here is what we got:


Friend: Hi!

Greedy Homophobe: Hello.

Friend: You talked to me that europeans loves only gays and they don’t care of other’s problems? Whet if they help me scratching up money to buiild new home?

Greedy Homophobe: ))) You’re laughing me! You have some frends in EU but I see you thing very good about these man’s ass lovers. Very naive.

Friend: What if they do that? Will you change your opinion?

Greedy Homophobe: Do you realy understand how much money you need to build up even small house. If  your friends lend you enough money I’ll change  my mind, but it’s almost impossible.  Most likely I’ll think that you sold you own ass for few cents.

Friend: Not to loan, just help.

Greedy Homophobe: Just help? Stupid. Guess you damaged your head. Stop dreaming and go to work. Impossible. If you work hard your family will get small house in 15 years.

Friend: You haven’t answered me.

Greedy Homophobe: If your american-auropean asslovers will help you with your house I go to love parade in Berling to dance in pink strings and make movie with all my apologises to lesbians and gays!

Friend: Sure?

Greedy Homophobe: The only think I’m really sure is that they dont’t want to know anything but their asses, even your problems. Go to work, you, gay dreamer.. Idiot…

Friend: Deal!


This is how my plan realised. Homophobes are usually not very smart so he cached himself. It’s our turn now.

Friend asked not to make his name public because Russia is not a toretance country so he’s afraid losing his job and getting other problems because of loyalty to LGBT-community. But he asked me to publish this short letter:


"Hello friends!
I’m very tired and I have only 2 hours to sleep before I go to work again but I’ll try to write some to all of you.
As Andy saied to you I’m in serious problems right now. At first I was desperate, but now I work a lot and I have little time even to despair. It’f often happens when you got in trouble someone is waiting while your problems will bury you. Others sees how to make world better. Andy make me and my family hope I found new friends in EU after all my troubles. Together we go forward to meet our dreams and hopes.
Sincerelly yours, your russian Friend.”


When I’ve talked to him about asking our community his eyes started to shine again. He really believes us.

Folks, I guess this is a perfect chance to help very good man and make bad guy cry.

story:
Short Summary

We are Mean Green Training (MGT) & Boot Camp. We started in 2008 and have never looked back! We help individuals become healthier with our unique training style and motivational concepts. 

MGT is not just a company that helps people live healthier lives, but also helps the needy in our community by:

  • ·Donating school supplies every year to kids and foundations that are underprivileged 
  • ·Giving clothing and women products to the Houston Area Women shelter 
  • ·Collecting and donate Christmas gifts to family or foundations in need 
  • ·Speaking at schools to speak out against "bullying"
We have built a strong foundation with the amount of lives we have changed but all of our training sessions are currently held at outdoor locations which prohibit many people from training with us due to certain conditions such as allergies while others simply are not conditioned to handle Houston's intense heat. 
With an indoor facility we now can help thousands more that suffer from obesity, depression and other chronic diseases. With this training center Mean Green Training will be able to provide a variety of exercise classes for individuals on every fitness level. Also, the new location will be located in the inner city, where we can leverage this space as a hub to help the community in need.
Everyone that has the heart to help our movement will not only help lives, but save lives. Countless people have joined because of their condition due to the lack of exercise and proper nutrition. With the help of our supporters, our vision for the Mean Green Training Center will be phenomenal addition for the city of Houston.
What We Need & What You Get
 To get the training center in the condition to be able to start training and hosting community events, we are looking at a minimum of $35,000. We need to get the flooring completed, paint the internal and external walls, add showers, include air conditioning and furnish basic training equipment.
We feel that our vision to fight obesity is exciting. How many people do you know are affected by obesity, depression or other chronic diseases? 
Your support will enable us to reach those same people. We could never repay you, but we do have some special gifts for your generosity. We are offering our Mean Green Training wrist bands, Mean Green Training tank, and the Mean Green workout DVD set. Let's work together to make our community healthier!

The Impact

By fighting obesity we not only improve the quality of people lives but we can help prevent and fight chronic diseases. Houston is recognized as one of America's fattest cities. Obesity is also heavily tied to depression, poor sleep and low self-esteem for countless people. Last year Mean Green Training was able to help over a 120 people loose over 1,500 pounds and mentored over a 100 children with our Results program by showing them how to eat healthier and exercise. Our new goal is to increase that number next year to 1,000 people and over 10,000 pounds. So in order to help more we have to get an indoor facility that is larger and able to hold the equipment our community needs. We invite you to partner with us and help us fight disease by fighting obesity.

Risks & Challenges

Our challenge in reaching our goal is being limited to the people we know. We hope and pray that we find favor with everyone that comes across our passion. We understand this a challenge, however we feel that our community is counting on us. Therefore, we are up for the challenge, because we know that our community is worth it. 

We plan to work countless hours to spread our vision. We are going to different community projects to spread the vision. We will utilize social media to let people outside of our community know about our passion.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot donate to the movement. However, you still can help us reach our goal. Please share the vision and movement. Tell your family and friends. Share on social medial. Send a email to your contacts. Every effort counts, and we appreciate yours.

story:
Our names are Hilary and Danielle, we are both from Toronto, Canada and we both LOVE shopping online! Because we constantly shop online, we know how expensive it can be to buy the perfect outfit. We also know that the majority of the time we shop online quality and price very rarely match up. We had the brilliant idea one day to become entrepreneurs! Original right? 

This is our plan in a nutshell: 

Contemporary clothing, gorgeous material and constantly updated trends at an incredibly affordable price! 

Besides the fact that our parents are happy we are doing something with online shopping that doesn't involve their credit cards we genuinely believe in not only this idea being successful, but we believe this could change the rest of the e-commerce world! 

Buy more, save more and create that gorgeous wardrobe you've always wanted but could never afford. 

Ask yourself these questions: As an online shopper.. 

Have I ordered something online from a different country? 

Have I ordered something online from a different country and have had to pay duties? 

Have I ordered something online and had to pay a ridiculous amount on shipping fees and taxes? 

If you've answered yes to any of the questions above and are interested in keeping up with constant, never ending, always changing trends then please continue reading! 

HD SIX Studios is hoping to become the next best online fashion retailer, at an affordable price! We will offer a wide variety of clothing in North America, but regulated towards the Canadian Dollar so that you, the customer, are getting the best quality, without breaking the bank and worrying about ridiculous exchange fees. 

We are a start up, but have done extensive market research and we know this will react well with our chosen demographic for one simple reason. We are, our demographic. Entrust in us, our plan and our hope to change the fashion e-commerce world not only for our parent's credit cards sake but for your credit card's sake! 

Keeping up with trends is tiring and expensive. HD SIX wants to bring you Superiority for less. So help us help you by donating to our idea and making shopping online more affordable, more fun and a better overall experience.

story:
Orlandam is a community connected in the digital and real worlds by close knit characters. We exist to combat isolation, have fun and bring amazing like minded people together from all over the world. We cherish you, like we cherish our families! We believe the experiences & memories we create together are what define us.

READ THE STORY OF THE 'Orlandam Origins' HERE:


Our mission is to have fun, build a great culture and use beautiful jumpers to create a community connected in the digital and real world by spectacular characters. With your Magic Jumper your will have the ability to tag yourself and your character on social media, come to our regular performances, gigs and parties and sign up to our members only portal on orlandam.com. A social hub of exclusive offers content from us and our community partners around the world. 

For example in an Orlandam partner bar you will always receive your first drink of the evening on the house.




So, how does the Orlandam Magic Jumper experience start? scroll down choose your character, order a jumper,  come to  our  launch event  and party like it's 1999! You are awesome and  as part of Orlandam you  are going to be DAZZLED!

RSVP TO OUR EXCLUSIVE LAUNCH PARTY HERE 

(Pick up your order here on 30.01.2016) (Otherwise we will ship it to you)


The Orlandam community is connected by 9 characters, (The Magisticals.)  Colourful guys that start conversations, connect people and identify you (amongst those in the know) as part of the Orlandam community.

Each 'Magistical', has a name, social media profile, key interests, a philanthropic cause and a story to tell.  Our Characters are represented in the form of nine Magic Jumpers made of the finest materials. 

Our Magic Jumpers are meticulously detailed, beautiful quality, hand crafted, Italian spun, British made, Australian grown 100% pure merino wool. Our cuts are designed by one of the  worlds top fashion houses. A jumper made of our pure super soft merino wool typically retails for £300+ (and those jumpers are not even magical!)

All of our R&D sourcing and manufacturing partners are in place. We are ready to place our order, this crowd funding campaign is your order platform.

The funds you pledge will be used to fulfil your orders, build the base infrastructure needed for our online community and to throw one amazing launch party for all  who make a contribution to our campaign.

To have a great party and build the base infrastructure for our members portal we need to raise a minimum of £12, 000.

N.B there are no refunds on gift boxes.

We are Jess & Jo the original creators of this project and founders of Orlandam. We both moved to London 5 years ago, and met when we began sharing an overpriced dilapidated London flat that eventually came to be known as 'The Lasagna'.

(Jess:) The first time I met Jo (at the time a potential flatmate) I was sitting in our kitchen. Jo walked in, introduced herself and asked me if I cooked. I said 'yes, I like to cook'. She said 'good - because I don’t'.

For the first few months of our tenancy I would cook for us and we started to become friends. One evening I suggested that we make something together….So we did. We had no recipe to follow and made a completely improvised  vegetarian lasagne out of whatever we could find. It was a great recipe that we still share and it was the first thing we ever made together as a team.

When I started to create Orlandam Jo started helping out in the same way we cook. I would come up with the designs (the recipes) and Jo would make sure that everything is well organised and that we had excellent  materials to produce brilliant things.

There are now 5 of us working on Orlandam all awesome and with complimentary skill sets. We are responsible for delivering everything we have outlined in this campaign and will do our utmost to keep on schedule  exceed your expectations and help you have fun and....

If you would like to help us trend click the above image and support our thunder clap. :)

If you have any further questions, feedback or ideas get in touch with us at:  orlanda.m@orlandam.com;
story_txt:
Orlandam is a community connected in the digital and real worlds by close knit characters. We exist to combat isolation, have fun and bring amazing like minded people together from all over the world. We cherish you, like we cherish our families! We believe the experiences & memories we create together are what define us.



READ THE STORY OF THE 'Orlandam Origins' HERE:










Our mission is to have fun, build a great culture and use beautiful jumpers to create a community connected in the digital and real world by spectacular characters. With your Magic Jumper your will have the ability to tag yourself and your character on social media, come to our regular performances, gigs and parties and sign up to our members only portal on orlandam.com. A social hub of exclusive offers content from us and our community partners around the world. For example in an Orlandam partner bar you will always receive your first drink of the evening on the house.

So, how does the Orlandam Magic Jumper experience start? scroll down choose your character, order a jumper,  come to  our  launch event  and party like it's 1999! You are awesome and  as part of Orlandam you  are going to be DAZZLED!

story:
Short Summary

We’re Team Fusion and as part of the leadership program at Medibank, we’re participating in The Australian Youth Mentoring Network’s Million Dollar Challenge, in partnership with The Smith Family.

The Million Dollar Challenge is a national competition, challenging teams of employees to turn $1,500 seed funding into a much profit as possible. Teams from organisations across Australia compete against each to raise the most amount of money and take the crown of the Million Dollar Champions with the ultimate goal of raising $1 million. 

The Australian Youth Mentoring Network, Australia's peak mentoring body, is a national hub for youth mentoring funding, research, tools and resources. They work with youth mentoring organisations and practitioners to foster the growth and development of high quality mentoring programs for young people in Australia by providing a national base of collaboration, support, guidance and expertise.

Our task is to raise over $10,000 for The Smith Family and we need your help.

The Smith Family foundation is Australia’s largest national education oriented charity that provides support to disadvantaged Australian children. The Smith Family provides learning support and mentoring programs to help children in need to fit in at school, keep up with their peers, and build aspirations for a better future for them.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise over $10,000 before the 31st of August, 2015. Please share our story with your friends, families, peers and networks and encourage them to donate.  

Whether we reach our goal or not, all the funds raised from this initiative will be donated to The Smith Family. The funds will be used to provide disadvantaged Australian children with access to support and tools they need to help them finish their education and build a foundation for a brighter future. 
The funds raised will be donated to The Smith Family's Learning for Life support program. 
Learning for Life Support for families program provides assistance in three ways;

  1. It connects students and their families to opportunities in their local community;
  2. Facilitates access to The Smith Family’s education and mentoring programs;
  3. And through sponsorship provides both financial assistance to help with the cost of essential education items, and emotional support that encourages students to stay motivated at school.
So, what's in it for you?

For every $5,000 dollars raised, Team Fusion will perform a challenge - whether it's jumping off a pier; eating bugs; or randomly performing a dance in Federation Square, we will do it. 

Every time you donate, use the comments section to tell us what you think we should do as our challenge. We will randomly pick a challenge for the team to perform and post the 'evidence' for all to enjoy.


The Impact

According to the ABS, one in ten Australian children are living in jobless families, where even life's basics are hard to come by. By not having the right support or access to the right tools, these children fall behind in their learning - leaving them more vulnerable to experiencing the same (or worse) hardships as their families.

The Impact of Disadvantage: 

(https://www.thesmithfamily.com.au/what-we-do/the-problem)

  • Disadvantaged students are on average 2-3 years behind in reading and maths by the time they are 15 years old
  • The reading gap between the lowest socio‑economic status (SES) students and the highest SES students is equivalent to almost three years of schooling
  • Year 12 completion rates are significantly lower (58%) for students from low SES backgrounds than for students from high SES backgrounds (77%)
  • University students from high SES backgrounds are three times more likely to attend, than students from low SES backgrounds.

It doesn’t matter where you are in the world, children are our future. Please open your hearts and give generously to help a child achieve their full potential.

Helping a child to have a better future tomorrow, starts today.

Please donate generously. 

.Other Ways You Can Help
  • Use your social networks to share our story with your friends and families

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who we are:

Angel Wings Bakery is a social enterprise. We are an online gourmet bakery that is customer-oriented, community-focused, and created with two major goals in mind:

  • On-The-Job Training and Employment Coaching – Our unique structure provides a paid internship experience with local aged-out foster youth. These interns learn a marketable skill as well as the soft skills necessary for a successful future. 
  • Sustainablility– 100% of our profits are used to help break the generational cycles of poverty, homelessness and dysfunctional families. 

Our operations are flourishing! But we need more funding to hire more interns and meet the needs of our continued growth. We believe that a cookie can change a life and here's how.

What we are looking for:

Our primary goal is to continue providing internship opportunities for those 18-24 year old aged-out foster youths in the Riverside, California community, and be able to meet the growing product demand using the appropriate equipment. Here's what it takes!  

  • $1,950 per month to fund the paid-internship program. This includes the resources to pay the intern, the trainers and keep the lights on! 
    • 6-month internship total cost with curriculum materials and salaries for employment coach and head baker is $11,925

What our program looks like:

Our unique internship opportunity for aged-out foster youth is broken up into 4 phases:

  • Phase 1: We spend 30 days really getting to know our new intern with on the job training. We then begin to prepare them with food safety training and a Food Handler's Certification.
  • Phase 2: The intern begins a 6-month program working closely with our professionally-trained pastry chefs and our employment coach. The intern receives one-to-one assessment, employment and educational plan, coaching, and bi-weekly evaluation to further develop the social and soft skills necessary to succeed in the marketplace.
  • Phase 3: We help the paid apprentice discover pathways to find permanent employment and advance in their educational goals.
  • Phase 4: We support them by monitoring their progress, challenges, accomplishments, and future goals for 2 years following completion of the program.

What you can do:

We need your support to help transform lives and strengthen our community:ou 

We have several very generous donors who will be matching donations of $25, $50, and $100.

Also, if you donate $10 and share that you did on Facebook, a matching $10 donation will be given.

  • Donate at any amount to help fund our internship program and invest in the bright-future of Angel Wings Bakery.
    • $10.00 - every little bit helps
    • $25.00 - help us reach our goal
    • $50.00 - help get a new paid apprentice off to a great start
    • $200.00 - will pay for the curriculum needed for a paid apprentice
    • $488.00 - will pay for one week of training for a paid apprentice
    • $1950.00 - will pay for one month of training for a paid apprentice
  • Share your support on social media! We have a generous donor who will add $10.00 to your donation when you share that you gave on social media.

story:
I have a passion for making great food and I love having friends and family over to enjoy it with me. A few years ago I started making bbq and meat rubs, and even started grilling foods with my rubs at a local deli where I lived in Washington State. My ribs, chicken and pulled pork was a hit and I had constant phone calls of people ordering my pork ribs and chicken in bulk instead of just the meals. Most of my customers did not want bbq sauce on their meats because it tasted so good with just my rubs on it...so the sauce went on the side of plate and not on the meat.

After I tested my rubs with the public I started doing bbq competitions and did very well up against the professional pit masters.

That's when I started making my rubs and selling them to people that loved my food.

To take my meat rubs and seasonings to the next level and have it produced in large quantities I need the funding to have a spice company make it for me.

This guarantees that everything is done by the FDA regulations and keeps everything legal and safe.

I already have my website www.carmensrubs.com and I  have my social networks ready to go.

So if you love great food and love cooking great food then my meat rubs is what you will want.

Thank you for your donations and please share this with your friends.

story:
In the summer of 2015, I visited and worked with youth organizations in all 50 states. I used a broad variety of social mediums to share their stories with a global audience, frequently introducing the staff and volunteers to applications like SnapChat, Meerkat and Periscope. (In fact, I'm the first person to live-stream in all 50 states!) I conducted a SnapChat interview with every org I visited (that link won't work on mobile; they're all on my FB page); we also took our share of selfies:

Together, we used social media to tell a compelling story at every organization I visited (my YouTube channel is loaded with them!).

The one big thing I learned? Every organization could use additional, individualized help in identifying, formulating and sharing those stories. Many organizations lack a true social media strategy altogether; having visited nonprofits in every U.S. state, I am uniquely qualified to help.

- - - - - - - - - - -

How can organizations best use SnapChat? That's a question I addressed individually around the country -- and now The #100CallsProject will let us continue to spread that message.


- - - - - - - - - -

I learned a lot during my trip about how to best communicate my own story -- this campaign will allow me to teach those skills directly to 100 MORE nonprofit organizations around the country.

Organizations can check out my calendar at TeamStrub.com and contact me via email to select a time-slot that works for them. (Between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. Eastern, please :D.) Having seen first-hand the financial crunch that these organizations are under, I am choosing to offer my time at no cost to them.

Instead, I'm asking the Internet for your support. To keep you in the loop, I'll maintain a Google Map (I tried to embed it on Indiegogo -- fail) with all of the organizations I've worked with, and you can follow my LinkedIn to read what each organization thinks of my help. I also encourage you to suggest organizations to contact by emailing or Tweeting me.

- - - - - - - - - -

At each stop of my trip, I hosted an "extended" interview, all of which are hosted on my YouTube channel. Below is my chat with the Executive Director of Wisconsin Youth Company, Kay Stevens. You can check out some more on the "gallery" link above, and I encourage you to find the interview from your state on my channel!

- - - - - - - - - -

This project will allow me to continue to offer direct support and actionable advice to 100 nonprofits around the country -- at ZERO cost to them. Your contributions will also allow me to gradually recoup the physical costs of traveling to all 50 states alone, with no corporate support.

ABOUT CHRIS STRUB
Age: 30
Hometown; Huntington Station, NY
Education: Binghamton University '07
Current: Greenville, S.C.

story:
Most of you know that our home is a haven, a safe place for those to come relax, inspiration for those that want to create , a warm cozy place to air your woes and joys.

We have always kept our doors open to all in need, whether it's our guest room or big open living room w/couches to crash on.  We have hosted hundreds of friends, family , musicians, and their friends and family.

In 2004, when we purchased this home, we wanted to start investing our money back into something we could be proud of.

We worked full time jobs and put almost all we had back into our space.  We remodeled our bathroom in 2007 and renovated our band space and garage.

We travelled the United States with our music, subleasing the space while gone.  

It has been an incredible journey that led us to quit our day jobs in 2008 and take the plunge as full time musicians.

In the last 7 years we've played 1000's of shows spreading our message of love, hope and compassion to the world.  We have been blessed to play with soo many incredible artists and have met even more along the way.

This Indiegogo is a plea to all those that have been honored or inspired by our home, who have felt the joy of a late night jam session or heart awakening while living there, who have tasted yummy meals and played games or danced into the wee hours of the am or hugged us with their big hearts.

There aren't many homes I can say that have made me feel the way our home has...  I know that others have felt this, as well as many friends or friends of friends passing through have expressed this to my sis and I.

It's hard to ask for help and being a natural nurturer it is even more difficult for me.  I feel most comfortable taking care of those around me.  I get soo much joy making those that are in need, feel safe that they always have a space with us.

Although we are in a time of financial woe, I know that we can pool together! A small contribution helps to keep this landmark in our possession.  My sis and I are asking you to help us raise the remaining funds required by our bank to modify our home loan.   We have been thru this process for the last two years and miraculously on September 3rd we got the final paperwork to lower our HUGE mtg. payment from $2500 a month to $1980!!  The one catch... the bank requires us to come up with a $7000 down payment.

We have pooled together our resources and are half way there!  Huge thank you to those that have helped us with encouragement or donating your time to our fundraiser last week, or just sharing our story.  Although we didn't make much $ at the fundraiser, we did have quite a few donations gifted to our cause.  These will be listed below and if an item stands out please consider donating to help us off set this crazy amount of money.  Also if you feel moved by our cause please feel free to donate. We thank you in advance for taking the time to read this and having such great hearts.

Much love to you,

Amanda & Jenni
story_txt: Most of you know that our home is a haven, a safe place for those to come relax, inspiration for those that want to create , a warm cozy place to air your woes and joys.We have always kept our doors open to all in need, whether it's our guest room or big open living room w/couches to crash on.  We have hosted hundreds of friends, family , musicians, and their friends and family.In 2004, when we purchased this home, we wanted to start investing our money back into something we could be proud of.We worked full time jobs and put almost all we had back into our space.  We remodeled our bathroom in 2007 and renovated our band space and garage.We travelled the United States with our music, subleasing the space while gone.  It has been an incredible journey that led us to quit our day jobs in 2008 and take the plunge as full time musicians.In the last 7 years we've played 1000's of shows spreading our message of love, hope and compassion to the world.  We have been blessed to play with soo many incredible artists and have met even more along the way.This Indiegogo is a plea to all those that have been honored or inspired by our home, who have felt the joy of a late night jam session or heart awakening while living there, who have tasted yummy meals and played games or danced into the wee hours of the am or hugged us with their big hearts.There aren't many homes I can say that have made me feel the way our home has...  I know that others have felt this, as well as many friends or friends of friends passing through have expressed this to my sis and I.It's hard to ask for help and being a natural nurturer it is even more difficult for me.  I feel most comfortable taking care of those around me.  I get soo much joy making those that are in need, feel safe that they always have a space with us.Although we are in a time of financial woe, I know that we can pool together! A small contribution helps to keep this landmark in our possession.  My sis and I are asking you to help us raise the remaining funds required by our bank to modify our home loan.   We have been thru this process for the last two years and miraculously on September 3rd we got the final paperwork to lower our HUGE mtg. payment from $2500 a month to $1980!!  The one catch... the bank requires us to come up with a $7000 down payment.We have pooled together our resources and are half way there!  Huge thank you to those that have helped us with encouragement or donating your time to our fundraiser last week, or just sharing our story.  Although we didn't make much $ at the fundraiser, we did have quite a few donations gifted to our cause.  These will be listed below and if an item stands out please consider donating to help us off set this crazy amount of money.  Also if you feel moved by our cause please feel free to donate. We thank you in advance for taking the time to read this and having such great hearts.Much love to you,Amanda & Jenni

story: Not only beautiful art, furnishings, textiles, fine tea, and superfood elixirs, Native Roots Gardens is a place to gather, a place to share ideas, a place to hold events and and a place to teach within the community. As a certified Permaculture design school and garden, people young and old can come together to help manifest creative solutions to the problems of the world. Students can get involved with internships, and work locally or abroad with one of our direct, fair trade, relationships with at-risk native communities around the world. Get involved today and help support this dream for Laguna Beach and for the world!

story:
AuTasty Restaurant is one of a kind, a social enterprise, offering the community great food at great prices with a menu that includes dairy, wheat and gluten free  AuTasty is a unique restaurant as it will be sensory adapted and will Offer offer a diverse menu and 'order in advance' service, 

We will also have a sensory room inbuilt. Many adaptions will be made to ensure a relaxed friendly environment that addresses the issues many parents and carers face when wishing to have quality family time with loved ones on the Autism Spectrum. Therefore creating a synergies between eating establishments and the Autism community. 

We aim to have a take away service during lunch hours to provide quality meals at great prices to colleges, schools, shoppers and  the local work force.

We will offer jobs and training to people on the Autistic Spectrum and offer flexible working hours to parents and carers. 

By working with associations such as the Scottish Autism Assiciation we will be able to offer ' life skill' sessions to local schools and groups with afternoons such as 'create your own pizza' sessions. Enable learning through fun and food. 

Committed to continued support of the local community and autism community our dream is to build more and more restaurants all over the world. 

A true community project to bring people together and helps to raise awareness of the Autistic Spectum.

story:
Actif dans le monde culturel et artistique depuis près de 20 ans, ma vie a basculé il y a près de deux ans, après un séjour à l’hôpital, …

Je ne pouvais continuer à vivre ma vie, sans un peu d’humanité, de respect, de dévouement.

J’ai choisi de partir avec Points-Cœur, une association créée en 1990 (www.france.pointscoeur.org), qui m’envoie à Chennai-Madras, Dans le sud-est de l’Inde.

Depuis sa fondation en 1990, Points-Cœur n’a cessé d’être présent auprès des plus souffrants grâce à la générosité d’hommes et de femmes qui décident de donner une part d’eux-mêmes

·  Des jeunes décident de donner un ou deux ans de leur vie pour partir en mission, et assurer une présence de compassion sur le terrain.

·  D’autres décident de parrainer un volontaire financièrement ou spirituellement pour soutenir sa mission.

Pour par­ti­ci­per à l’action Points-Cœur, accompagnez un volontaire et permettez-lui de vivre cette mission auprès des plus souffrants.

Coût moyen d’un bénévole :

1.  Pris en charge par les parrains/marraines : 450 € par mois (assurance, formation, nourriture, etc.)
Tous les parrainages sont reçus de façon centralisée puis redistribués dans les maisons selon les besoins.

2.  Pris en charge par les volontaires (visa, billets d’avion) : 1100 €

30 000 parrains ont déjà soutenu la mission depuis 1990.

Le volontaire que vous accompagnez s’engage à vous envoyer régu­liè­re­ment des nouvelles de sa mission et prie pour vous et à vos intentions. Avec lui, vous devenez proche des enfants et des familles que lui-même accompagne.

L'impact

Présente dans près de 25 pays, les jeunes de Points-Cœur sont de diverses nationalités, ils vivent en équipe de 4 ou 5 dans les bidonvilles ou les quartiers particulièrement défavorisés des grandes villes pour y être une présence d’amitié et de compassion.

L’objectif n’étant pas tant de « FAIRE » que d’ « ÊTRE » !

Depuis 2005, Points-Cœur est dotées, en tant qu’ONG, d’un statut consultatif spécial au sein du Conseil Économique et Social des Nations-Unies.

En s’appuyant sur l’expérience de ses volontaires ainsi que sur la vie des amis de nos quartiers, elle se joint aux débats relatifs aux droits de l’Homme dans les différents Conseils.

Missions

·  Accueil de tous ceux qui viennent frapper à notre porte, et rencontre des personnes isolées par des visites régulières.

  • Visites hebdomadaires auprès d’une école spécialisée pour enfants handicapés mentaux
  • Visites auprès de personnes âgées
  • Visites hebdomadaires aux enfants de Shishu Bahvan, orphelinat pour enfants handicapés tenu par les Sœurs de Mère Térésa
  • Visites  régulière aux enfants d’une prison pour mineurs.
  • Tuitions : soutien scolaire deux fois par semaine pour une dizaine d’enfants du quartier
  • Sorties avec les enfants ou les jeunes le plus souvent à Chennai même.
  • Camp annuel de 4-5 jours avec des enfants du quartier.

Parce que les personnes qui comptent sur nous, comptent aussi sur vous !

·  Votre bien servira au quotidien et pour longtemps.

Points-Cœur s’engage de façon durable auprès des personnes délaissées. Dans chacune de nos maisons, elles sont accueillies, soutenues et accompagnées, tous les jours, fidèlement.

·  Votre bien servira à apporter l’espérance.

Points-Cœur veut être une présence de compassion et de consolation. A travers notre présence, il s’agit de révéler aux plus pauvres leur dignité.

·  La totalité de votre don reviendra à Points-Cœur.

Vos donations et legs sont exonérés de tout droit de succession. Un commissaire aux comptes indépendant certifie chaque année que l’argent reçu est bien employé à l’usage prévu.

D'autres façons d'aider

·  Si vous ne pouvez contribuer financièrement à mon projet, vous pouvez aussi soutenir ma mission par votre prière (parrainage spirituel).

·  N’hésitez pas à passer le mot et à faire de la publicité autour de mon projet : FAITES DU BRUIT !

story:
Welcome to Our Market Match Campaign for 2015

Four years ago Post Oil Solutions’ initiated a program at our Winter Farmers’ Market to make local, nutritious food more available and affordable to those who need it. It’s called the Market Match Coupon Program, and the concept is simple: Folks who receive 3SquaresVT/EBT food benefits use their benefits at the market and have that money matched via market coupons up to $10 to help them purchase more healthy local food. 

This “double your money” offer can be repeated each week throughout the season as long as our funds last.  It has encouraged families to budget across the month and spend more of their EBT dollars locally.

In their own words, some of our customers can help you understand the impact that this program has had on their lives.

“This is a beautiful program! Community members eating healthy local food and increased business for our farmers – Everyone wins! "

“There is nothing more important to me than feeding my son homegrown healthy food and it is a huge blessing to be able to buy whole local food despite our low income. Thank you!”

"As a single 63 year old on Social Security, this helps keep me in good health ."

"Earlier this year, I was diagnosed with breast cancer. With the rising cost of my medical expenses, my food budget was struggling big time."

"It is of immeasurable help given food shelves sparseness of fresh produce, especially fruit.  Many thanks to all of you."

"With recent cutback in SNAP benefits, this coupon program helps to fill the nutrition gap."

"This is a HUGE help to us…my kids get fresh local food!"

"I really appreciate the match system.  It means that I don't have to choose between meat OR vegetables- it allows me to buy both and support farmers and the community while I do so!"

"Words can’t express how much this helps.  Thank you !!"

 Encouraging shoppers to shop at their local farmers market for fresh food rather than the convenience of packaged foods from the big box food stores is a challenge.  We can’t think of a better way to directly impact our neighbors and community as a whole.  Can you help us? Approximately 100,000 Vermonters qualify for food stamp benefits under 3SquaresVT, but those dollars can only go so far. That’s where our Market Match Coupons come in: to extend market purchasing power and enhance the health of our community through good local food. Market Match Coupons also provide increased income for our local farmers, bakers, cheese and jams makers, all of whom are part of the local economy, so it’s win-win-win all around!

Because of the success of the program over the past four years as well as the increased number of our neighbors who are food insecure, we want to start off the 2015/2016 season with a solid base for this program to stretch their benefit dollars in the local economy.   That’s why we are reaching out to the larger community to help us get a jump start on our 10th season.  Our goal is to raise $2500 to extend our existing fundraising efforts so our EBT customers can count on continued access to healthy fresh local food right through our last market of the season.  Any additional funds realized through this campaign will enable us to give our customers the confidence that this program will continue beyond the 2015/2016 season.

All donations are tax-deductible. Gifts of any size are most appreciated and will help to support healthy families, vibrant farm and food businesses, and the local economy.  All contributors will be acknowledged publicly at the market and in the local press, however we have a variety of special thank you gifts to share with our top level supporters.

For more information contact us at 802-869-2141 or via email at farmersmarket@postoilsolutions.org.   And be sure to use the tools from Indiegogo to share our campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Clinical Social Worker, friend of the family, and invaluable resource throughout our journey with autism, Peter Thach on Wiggle Room:


Mother of twin auties, dedicated advocate for her sons, and valued friend of our family, Ana Calderon on Wiggle Room:


BCBA, Social Skills Program Coordinator, long-time friend, and all-around good guy, Yagnesh Vadgama on Wiggle Room:


Nixon is our oldest son and was diagnosed with autism back in the summer of 2013 when he was 2 1/2 years old. While his progress since that time has been nothing short of amazing, the initial diagnosis did come with its fair share of challenges and obstacles including, but not limited to, sensory processing issues. For the past two years, we have searched and scoured Orange County for a space that was not only safe, intuitive, and engaging, but would also accommodate his sometimes specific sensory needs.  Surprisingly, there weren't many...and of those, none that suited our needs in a way that made sense.  So Wiggle Room was born. 

It would be an extension of our ambitions to create a sensory-rich environment for Nixon at home. An environment that not only met his basic sensory needs, but would also allow him to play freely and without the judgement, anxiety, and safety concerns that often come with other recreational options we've explored.  It would be a place where he would be watched over with caring, supportive, and knowledgeable eyes.  A space where he could not only play safely and positively with his little brother, but also interact and initiate play with peers on his own terms when he felt the most comfortable and regulated.  And that is what we want for all kids, not just ours. 

Wiggle Room will be a space where you and your child will be accepted and embraced regardless of age and ability.  It will be a space where the activities and equipment will be intuitive, fun, purposeful, and most importantly, safe both in intent and application. It will be the space we've always wanted and hopefully the one you've wanted too. 

Wiggle Room is a fully enclosed, multi-purpose, all-inclusive sensory studio designed with all the creature comforts you’ve come to expect in a children’s gym, but with the added benefit of having equipment and programs specifically tailored to meet the needs of children with autism, sensory processing disorders, and other developmental disabilities.  While it isn’t the first of its kind, Wiggle Room will be the first indoor play area of its kind in Orange County that specifically addresses sensory needs through an open-play model. Through the highest standards of quality and meticulous planning, we aim to provide not only a safe and supportive environment in which to navigate, but also one that is intuitively engaging, fun, and interactive for kids of ALL ages and abilities.  

In order to maintain the highest level of care, all of our staff will be First Aid/CPR certified as well as trained in positive behavioral strategies and proper use of gym equipment.  Our equipment will be of the highest quality and carefully selected with the help of an Occupational Therapy consultant.  And lastly, we fully intend on keeping our studio clean and sanitary by using only green products.



Our goal here at Wiggle Room is three-fold.  First, we aim to encourage both positive social/emotional and physical growth through parent facilitated and/or self-guided exploration of our studio.  Whether amongst peers in one of our specially designed social skills groups or on their own, you’ll find that Wiggle Room provides just the right amount of function and support for all children to benefit from sensory motor play. 

Secondly, we hope to be able to bridge the gap between the clinic and the home by providing  access to therapeutic play equipment and tools typically found in Occupational Therapy settings only.  At Wiggle Room, and as parents of an ASD child ourselves, we understand the importance as well as the costs involved in supplementing a child’s therapy with specialized sensory play and firmly believe that having access to sensory equipment should not be viewed as a luxury, but rather, as a necessity. 

Lastly, we want to provide an experience that is as comprehensive as it is unique.  Whether it's utilizing our therapeutic swings, trampolines, and zip-lines or exploring the activities in the fine motor corner, taking a break in the chill-out zone, or taking advantage of our parent resource center, we want you to leave feeling that you've gained the most out of your experience here. Each and every time. 

Because we believe in it!  Honest to goodness.  But beyond that, because the impact of a space like this affects not just a tiny swath of the general population, but rather, an overwhelmingly large number of children…children of all ages, needs, and abilities. 

It affects autistic kids. Kids who often have difficulty processing sensory information such as textures, sounds, smells, taste, brightness, and movement. These difficulties can often make ordinary situations seem incredibly overwhelming.  Wiggle Room aims to not only address those needs in a fun and intuitive way, but also to teach families and provide them with a solid foundation of sensory-based activities that will hopefully extend beyond the doors of our studio.

It affects children with sensory processing disorder (SPD), a common disorder that affects many kids, both neurotypical and on the spectrum.  One study has shown that at least 1 in 20 children is affected by SPD with some experiencing symptoms chronic and significant enough to disrupt everyday life.  We want to provide a space that is supportive and meets children at whatever level of sensory integration they may require, whether that's finding a calming area to re-calibrate or simply burning off that excess energy after school.

It affects, well...children.  Our children.  Your children.  All children! 

While a space like this obviously provides numerous benefits for children with special needs, studies have shown that sensory play can have a significant impact on normal child development as well.  Infants and toddlers naturally initiate discovery about the world around them, so providing a variety of interesting sensory experiences can only pique their curiosity and support positive, healthy brain development... everything from physical, social, and communication skills down to cognitive/emotional development and a sense of self.  Wiggle Room looks to address all of those by engaging children through a diverse array of sensory experiences that appeal to all kids, whether it be through fine motor play, strength and conditioning, art, music, or even dance. 

Help us open our doors in Orange County! Let’s face it, therapeutic equipment can be costly. Regular gym equipment can be costly. Building a studio to house all that wonderful equipment is expensive.  But creating a space that is nourishing, safe, and fun for all kids is, well, as the cliché goes, priceless. Our goal for this campaign is to raise $16,000.  Now, you’re probably thinking, “no way is $16,000 enough to open this gym.”  And you are absolutely right!  What you’ll be helping us with during this particular campaign is raising the funds necessary to purchase the actual sensory equipment and tools that will be the cornerstone of our business.  

The remaining funds needed to open our doors will come from our own savings along with the contributions of our wonderful investors.  Your specific contributions will be making a direct impact on the development of our children by providing the very equipment and tools needed to make our space fully functional.  From the bolster swings, crash pads, and floor mats to each individual ball in our giant ball pit, you'll be  instrumental in making our dream a reality.  Without your contributions, our vision will just be that, a vision and not the wonderful sensory playground we, and this community, so desperately needs.

Proudly partnering with the Center for Autism & Neurodevelopmental Disorders through our "Special Give Back" Perks!

Originally founded in 2001 (as For OC Kids), The Center for Autism is home to a team of experts in the field of autism and neurodevelopmental disorders. Since our opening, we’ve been a leader in assessment, diagnosis, care coordination, family support and education for children with autism spectrum and other neurodevelopmental disorders.


Proudly partnering with Geek Club Books through our Mighty Leaguers Perks! 

Geek Club Books, 501c3, with an autism education and empowerment mission, goes beyond the story to entertain and educate with a social mission. We use engaging technologies and the art of storytelling to tell the ‘real’ stories about autism for acceptance and understanding in the classroom, on the playground and in the community. Our goal is to profoundly change how the world views autism…one story at a time.



Share our link to your friends and family. The more support we can get behind this project, the closer we'll get to opening our doors!
http://igg.me/at/WiggleRoom
Like us on Facebook
Follow us on Twitter
Pin us on Pinterest
Follow us on Instagram

1.  When will I receive my perk?

We will begin shipping out all perks as soon as the campaign ends on June 5, 2015.  Please allow 6 – 8 weeks from the end of our campaign for delivery.

2.  Will the daily Wiggle Room pass or monthly Wigglers pass perk be transferrable to another child?

Yes, of course it is!  If you do not have or know children who may want to visit Wiggle Room or are simply just not local, we highly encourage you to gift your pass to another child who may enjoy it!

3.  How much of the “Give Back” perk is tax deductible and will I receive documentation for the tax deduction?

15% of your gross contribution will be donated to the Center for Autism and Neurodevelopmental Disorders which is a non-profit organization. (i.e. - $25 perk=$3.75 donated, $50 perk=$7.50 donated, $100 perk=$15 donated, etc.)  You will also receive a tax deduction receipt from the Center for the donation amount which we will ship to you for free.

4.  How will funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

We will send updates to all of our supporters through our Indiegogo page as well as through email to the email addresses that you provided when you signed up to the Indiegogo site.  We will also post updates on our Facebook page and website for the duration of the campaign as well as after the campaign.

5.  What happens if you don’t meet your funding goal?  Will I get my money back?

If we meet our funding goal at the end of our campaign, we will move on to the next phase of our project.  However, in the event that we do not meet our goal, we will continue to work with our investors and local banks to secure the necessary funding to cover the gap.  We also will not be able to refund your money back because we are running a flexible campaign which means that even if we don’t reach our goal, we will still receive all the funds raised (just at a higher Indiegogo fee rate). Regardless, we are committed to our project and will do everything in our power to open our doors for all of our kids in 2015.

6.  When will Wiggle Room open?

Our goal is open our doors by summer of 2015.

7.  If I have questions regarding this campaign or regarding Wiggle Room LLC itself, who do I contact?

You can email all of your questions or concerns to info@wiggleroomstudio.com.  We will do our very best to respond to you within the first 24 hours.
story_txt:
Clinical Social Worker, friend of the family, and invaluable resource throughout our journey with autism, Peter Thach on Wiggle Room:Mother of twin auties, dedicated advocate for her sons, and valued friend of our family, Ana Calderon on Wiggle Room:BCBA, Social Skills Program Coordinator, long-time friend, and all-around good guy, Yagnesh Vadgama on Wiggle Room:
Nixon is
our oldest son and was diagnosed with autism back in the summer of 2013 when he was 2 1/2 years old. While
his progress since that time has been nothing short of amazing, the initial
diagnosis did come with its fair share of challenges
and obstacles including, but not limited to, sensory processing issues. For the
past two years, we have searched and scoured Orange County for a space that was
not only safe, intuitive, and engaging, but would also accommodate his
sometimes specific sensory needs.  Surprisingly, there weren't many...and
of those, none that suited our needs in a way that made sense.  So Wiggle
Room was born. It would be an extension of our ambitions to create a sensory-rich environment for Nixon at home. An environment that not only met his basic sensory needs, but would also allow him to play freely and without the judgement, anxiety, and safety concerns that often come with other recreational options we've explored.  It would be a place where he would be watched over with caring, supportive, and knowledgeable eyes.  A space where he could not only play safely and positively with his little brother, but also interact and initiate play with peers on his own terms when he felt the most comfortable and regulated.  And that is what we want for all kids, not just ours. Wiggle Room will be a space where you and your child will be accepted and embraced regardless of age and ability.  It will be a space where the activities and equipment will be intuitive, fun, purposeful, and most importantly, safe both in intent and application. It will be the space we've always wanted and hopefully the one you've wanted too.  Wiggle Room is a fully enclosed, multi-purpose, all-inclusive sensory studio designed with all the creature comforts you’ve come to expect in a children’s gym, but with the added benefit of having equipment and programs specifically tailored to meet the needs of children with autism, sensory processing disorders, and other developmental disabilities.  While it isn’t the first of its kind, Wiggle Room will be the first indoor play area of its kind in Orange County that specifically addresses sensory needs through an open-play model. Through the highest standards of quality and meticulous planning, we aim to provide not only a safe and supportive environment in which to navigate, but also one that is intuitively engaging, fun, and interactive for kids of ALL ages and abilities.  In order to maintain the highest level of care, all of our staff will be First Aid/CPR certified as well as trained in positive behavioral strategies and proper use of gym equipment.  Our equipment will be of the highest quality and carefully selected with the help of an Occupational Therapy consultant.  And lastly, we fully intend on keeping our studio clean and sanitary by using only green products.
Our goal here at Wiggle Room is three-fold.  First, we aim to encourage both positive social/emotional and physical growth through parent facilitated and/or self-guided exploration of our studio.  Whether amongst peers in one of our specially designed social skills groups or on their own, you’ll find that Wiggle Room provides just the right amount of function and support for all children to benefit from sensory motor play. 
Secondly, we hope to be able to bridge the gap between the clinic and the home by providing  access to therapeutic play equipment and tools typically found in Occupational Therapy settings only.  At Wiggle Room, and as parents of an ASD child ourselves, we understand the importance as well as the costs involved in supplementing a child’s therapy with specialized sensory play and firmly believe that having access to sensory equipment should not be viewed as a luxury, but rather, as a necessity. Lastly, we want to provide an experience that is as comprehensive as it is unique.  Whether it's utilizing our therapeutic swings, trampolines, and zip-lines or exploring the activities in the fine motor corner, taking a break in the chill-out zone, or taking advantage of our parent resource center, we want you to leave feeling that you've gained the most out of your experience here. Each and every time. 
Because we believe in it!  Honest to goodness.  But beyond that, because the impact of a space like this affects not just a tiny swath of the general population, but rather, an overwhelmingly large number of children…children of all ages, needs, and abilities. 
It affects autistic kids. Kids who often have difficulty processing sensory information such as textures, sounds, smells, taste, brightness, and movement. These difficulties can often make ordinary situations seem incredibly overwhelming.  Wiggle Room aims to not only address those needs in a fun and intuitive way, but also to teach families and provide them with a solid foundation of sensory-based activities that will hopefully extend beyond the doors of our studio.It affects children with sensory processing disorder (SPD), a common disorder that affects many kids, both neurotypical and on the spectrum.  One study has shown that at least 1 in 20 children is affected by SPD with some experiencing symptoms chronic and significant enough to disrupt everyday life.  We want to provide a space that is supportive and meets children at whatever level of sensory integration they may require, whether that's finding a calming area to re-calibrate or simply burning off that excess energy after school.It affects, well...children.  Our children.  Your children.  All children! While a space like this obviously provides numerous benefits for children with special needs, studies have shown that sensory play can have a significant impact on normal child development as well.  Infants and toddlers naturally initiate discovery about the world around them, so providing a variety of interesting sensory experiences can only pique their curiosity and support positive, healthy brain development... everything from physical, social, and communication skills down to cognitive/emotional development and a sense of self.  Wiggle Room looks to address all of those by engaging children through a diverse array of sensory experiences that appeal to all kids, whether it be through fine motor play, strength and conditioning, art, music, or even dance. Help us open our doors in Orange County! Let’s face it, therapeutic equipment can be costly. Regular gym equipment can be costly. Building a studio to house all that wonderful equipment is expensive.  But creating a space that is nourishing, safe, and fun for all kids is, well, as the cliché goes, priceless. Our goal for this campaign is to raise $16,000.  Now, you’re probably thinking, “no way is $16,000 enough to open this gym.”  And you are absolutely right!  What you’ll be helping us with during this particular campaign is raising the funds necessary to purchase the actual sensory equipment and tools that will be the cornerstone of our business.  The remaining funds needed to open our doors will come from our own savings along with the contributions of our wonderful investors.  Your specific contributions will be making a direct impact on the development of our children by providing the very equipment and tools needed to make our space fully functional.  From the bolster swings, crash pads, and floor mats to each individual ball in our giant ball pit, you'll be  instrumental in making our dream a reality.  Without your contributions, our vision will just be that, a vision and not the wonderful sensory playground we, and this community, so desperately needs. 
Proudly partnering with the Center for Autism & Neurodevelopmental Disorders through our "Special Give Back" Perks!Originally founded in 2001 (as For OC Kids), The Center for Autism is home to a team of experts in the field of autism and neurodevelopmental disorders. Since our opening, we’ve been a leader in assessment, diagnosis, care coordination, family support and education for children with autism spectrum and other neurodevelopmental disorders.
Proudly partnering with Geek Club Books through our Mighty Leaguers Perks! 
Geek Club Books, 501c3, with an autism education and empowerment mission, goes beyond the story to entertain and educate with a social mission. We use engaging technologies and the art of storytelling to tell the ‘real’ stories about autism for acceptance and understanding in the classroom, on the playground and in the community. Our goal is to profoundly change how the world views autism…one story at a time.
Share our link to your friends and family. The more support we can get behind this project, the closer we'll get to opening our doors!
http://igg.me/at/WiggleRoom

Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter
Pin us on Pinterest
Follow us on Instagram

story:
Hello!

My name is Ashley, I'm a 27 year old person with disabilities looking to kick start my decade long dream of owning my own small business- A small new age retail store.

I suffer from a genetic disorder known as Marfan Syndrome, which compromises the connective tissues of the body, leaving them weak, and prone to injury and other complications, such as my heart condition, and the fact that injuries I have sustained (multiple soft tissue injuries), may take twice as long, or longer, to heal than they would with someone who did not have my condition. 

But regardless of the cards I was dealt, I always move forward with my life, so here I am, looking to take the next step towards my dreams, and hopefully get ahead in life doing something that I love.

On disability, I get just barely enough to live off of. so I decided to start this campaign because I have no other way to raise the funds I require to go through a government program called the Self Employment Program. This program offers training, and financial supports to persons with disabilities, to help them start up their small business. However, as with most government programs, there's a catch! (Who would have thought, hey?) They will only fund you AFTER you can prove that you have 25% of the over all start up cost. (Like we all randomly have a few grand laying around, right?) 

In short, I do not qualify for a line of credit, or a loan.... (I even tried applying anyway...) So here I am!

I believe that owning my own small business- working on my own schedule, and for myself- will not only work best with my limitations and restrictions, but it will also help enrich the quality of my life all around,  and in turn help enrich the lives of my many clients and customers. 

I cannot express just how happy I would be if I were to get this chance, it would truly be a dream come true. 

I appreciate you taking the time to read my campaign, and I emplore you, if you feel so inclined, please take a moment to donate, share, or even just wish me luck! Any which way, I am eternally grateful, and appreciate all you can do.


Love, Light, and Blessings,

Ashley.
