story:
Ascension

The accessibility to all your digital information anytime might become a problem. It’s a waste of time to be constantly synchronizing your PC, Tablet and cell phone; and it’s a problem to be a slave of the cloud and the data plans can be very expensive. These are issues we want to solve in Csited.


Features

Improving the standard of life

The name of our product is Ascension. It’s a wearable computing device you can wear on your wrist with the shape of a watch, and it gives you the chance to gather all your digital data, info and apps in a single device. Ascension is a full-operative PC with Windows 10 system, an Intel AtomX5 processor and a smartphone all-in-one.

Wherever you are, whenever you want, you’ll be able to make a non-delayed connection with an A-Screen in order to get access to your dashboard. You’ll be able to use any screen the same way, either from your PC or your HDMI TV, connect a mouse and a keyboard via Bluetooth and enjoy a PC-like experience. Every screen can become a PC thanks to Ascension.


Security and connectivity

The connection between the watch and the screens is completely automatic, and encrypted, so the only thing you’ll do is get close to the screen and enjoy! The encryption is a good way to avoid other devices from invading your watch

You don’t need a cloud, and you’ll be worried no more with the safety of your personal data and info. You, and you alone, are the owner of your data.

Battery

It makes no sense to use such a device as useful as Ascension is if it cannot be running constantly. That’s why we have included a 10Wh battery through our own patented technology. It provides 8 hours of constant use to Ascension.

You can recharge your Ascension through a Qi plate, completely wireless and included in every one of the versions we’ll develop. It contains an additional external 5Wh battery that can be plugged into the watch, so it can last 4 hours more of use.


Physical features

Ascension is fully made with metallic equipment and crystal to assure an IP56 certification of waterproof and dustproof resistance.

Either for men or women by design, Ascension will fit easily with any wrist such as a regular watch. It has an electromagnetic lock to avoid it from being robbed and to prevent any fall.


User Experience

Previous sight of the Cortana, time and date applications.

Specs

Operating System: Microsoft Windows® 10
Processor: Intel Atom® x5
RAM Memory: 2GB lp-ddr3
Nand Memory: 64GB/256GB eMMC
Ascension Battery: 10Wh
Ascension Screen: 1'54" 320x320px 16 million color
A-Screen 5: 5" Full HD IPS 16 million color
A-Screen 5 Battery: 15Wh
A-Screen 10: 12" Full HD IPS 16 million color
A-Screen 10 Battery: 30Wh


What we need, what we offer.

We need 150.000$ to develop Ascension. We already have all the schematics and the simulations gave positive results. You can be a part of this experience through a minimum amount of money. It’s for sure that not everybody will buy our device without a previous test. That’s why we’re offering another sort of experiences.

We trust you. You’re the key of our future, of a technological future, and that’s the reason why we’re sending discount vouchers in the shape of key rings with the code silk-screen printed on it. It’s the proof that you were one of those who made this dream become reality.

All the money earned will be used to develop Ascension, to hire the most qualificated engineers and to buy the machinery required. Through the social networks we will update constantly the development status and will send our backers monthly reports, so they can check their money is not being wasted.


We’ve been working for years in this project; we’re making a dream come to reality; we want to see our watches in your wrists; this is our goal, and we’ll only achieve it with your help!


Agreements and support.

Currently we have agreements with companies such as Intel and Microsoft through their accelerating programmes.


We’re part of the Youth Business Spain mentoring programme, which is a JPMorgan iniciative; and we’ve been part of Telefónica’s Talentum Startups programme. 

Other ways to help

We’re well-aware not everybody can afford our product, nor trust us to develop it, so we give you the chance to support us with your comments and suggests. We’ll raffle an Ascension package full-equipped among all our followers in the Social Media and those who send an email with their comments to the address info@csited.com.


Timeline


Future

The journey doesn’t end here. We have tons of ideas, projects and adventures to do.

Currently we’re focused in the development of the best product Ascension can be, so if we get enough funds, we’ll implement improvements on it beyond imagination. It certainly is the best way to say: thank you for your support!

Recommendations


Eduardo Inal

I've had the pleasure to mentor these guys when they joined Telefonica's Talentum project. I believe they have something big in their hands that deserves attention. I'll be following their progress while giving them the support they could need because I trust them and I wish them well. I recommend this project to you with absolute confidence. They made me proud, as his mentor and friend, and I am sure they will continue to do so as they grow in your program and beyond. Hopefully they will get the support they need. Sincerely, Eduardo Inal Founder & CEO theKeyTalent https://www.linkedin.com/in/eduardoinal

Eduardo Gonzalez

Csited was born at the Madrid International LAB, a Madrid City Concil incubator that I manage. One of the key things that stand out here is the ambition of the vision and value proposition. With the right support and muscle to make this vision a reality, this team could create something really big.I wish them great success!


Joaquín Muñoz

As one of the Madrid International LAB managers I have whitnesed the hard work this guys had done with the documentation and planning of the project which, added to their ambition and knowledge, will lead them to a secure success


Maria Elena Francia Guevara

From the Business incubator of Villaverde - Madrid, belonging to incubators’ network of Madrid City Council, we are providing advice to Sergio on the Csited Project financials, patents and trademarks. Sergio shows key entrepreneurial skills such as flexibility, creativity and innovation, teamwork, customer focus and leadership. With proper guidance and the required financial support, the project idea will become a reality. We wish the group a lot of success.

Goals

Perks

Get the 256GB edition at 64GB price!!!


Disclaimers.
Everything which is described  here is accorded with our previsions and with the simulation, we are working  hard  to fit the final product into our patterns, Although it is liable to be modify. In case of the final product differs sufficiently  from our patterns you would have the choice to refound back your money.
Intel, the Intel logo, the Intel Inside logo and Intel Atom are trademarks of Intel Corporation in the U.S. and/or other countries
Microsoft, the Windows logo and Windows 10 are trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the U.S. and/or other countries
Talentum, Telefonica and the Talentum logo and Telefonica logo are trademarks of Telefonica S.A. in Spain and/or other countries

With proper guidance and the required financial support, the project idea will become a reality. We wish the group a lot of success.


Goals





Perks




Get the 256GB edition at 64GB price!!!





Disclaimers.

Everything which is described  here is accorded with our previsions and with the simulation, we are working  hard  to fit the final product into our patterns, Although it is liable to be modify. In case of the final product differs sufficiently  from our patterns you would have the choice to refound back your money.

story:
Short Summary

PawPrint Inc. is a non-profit organization devoted to spurring the knowledge and practice of social impact investing at Yale University. We started this organization as an outlet for undergraduates to develop experience in this growing new field, and share new knowledge with the world. The PawPrint Fund provides an endowment for students to manage a portfolio based on socially responsible investments products, and distributes dividends to selected charities. PawPrint Inc. also operates the PawPrint Journal, a publication devoted to news and developments in social-oriented finance, and interviews with professionals involved in impact investing outside of Yale.

Our campaign began with a vision to prove that capitalism can be sustainable and socially responsible. We are all strongly committed to making a difference in the world through our interest in finance.

Your contributions to the PawPrint Fund will help us raise the capital that is needed to achieve social impact. Every donation is valuable to us because it gives us more financial flexibility and a more diverse portfolio. Your donations are tax deductible under the Yale University's non-profit status.

For more information please check us out our website for The PawPrint Fund, and read more about social finance through our publication The PawPrint Journal.

story:
Reclaimed Enterprises began in August of 2014 to solve multiple community problems--blight, demolition waste, and under/unemployment.

Omaha is home to more than 3,600 unfit/unsafe properties with close to 800 on the City's Demolition list. Habitat For Humanity of Omaha alone will take down 65 blighted properties in 2015, with an average age of around 100 years old . While these homes might be unfit to live in, they still have untapped value lying in the amazing resources inside each one. And for most of these homes, their final resting place will be a landfill. We wanted to change this by bringing a new industry to Omaha that will tackle the issue of waste while providing jobs to potentially hundreds of area workers.

In a few short months, we've fully deconstructed five properties and partially deconstructed a dozen others, saving more than 600 tons of waste from the landfill. We've partnered with local artists, makers and architects to turn old properties into restaurant tables, serving trays, wall paneling and more.
Now that we've proven our model can work, we're going to scale up our operation.

After the first 100 days of delivering our deconstruction, design, build and installation services, the pilot phase of Reclaimed Enterprises is over.  With clarity around the most effective execution of our business model in the Omaha market, we are ready for growth. Growth in blight reduction, growth in waste diversion, and growth in jobs.

During the course of this year, we will achieve this growth in community impact with our 50 in 15' campaign by:

We plan on growing our business no matter, but how much we can accomplish in 2015 depends on your support.



When you fund our 50 in 15' initiative your impact investment will be helping to reduce blight, divert waste, and create jobs. We also want to drive a general sense of appreciation for the beauty of reclaimed materials and for the history behind them. As a result, we want our impact investors to take something away with them that embodies that beauty and nostalgia. 



If for whatever reason the capital raised for our 50 in 15' campaign should fall short of our objective, Reclaimed Enterprises will still use whatever capital we earn in our crowdfunding campaign to grow our impact on blight reduction, waste diversion, and job creation in the Omaha community-it just may take a little longer. The key areas of investment for scale noted in the next section represent the drivers of our growth, and we will continue to invest our resources in those areas to grow our community impact.



With our initial successes behind us and our basic infrastructure in place, we are ready to scale our operation for greater impact and growth. We've identified the key areas we need to scale and the funds needed to do so.

  • Training & Program Development - Proven OJT training program from our national partner The Reuse People of America (TRP). Training for up to 36 deconstruction crew members including up to 7 crew chiefs and certification of two local trainers for ongoing program needs.
  • Deconstruction Capital & Capacity -  Deconstructing more properties not only requires more trained crew, it requires more tools, more vehicles, and more storage.  Additionally, the blighted urban and obsolete rural buildings we target cost us about $10,000 of working capital to deconstruct. With crew training noted above and our expected turnover, we can deconstruct about 5 buildings at a time. Once we have reclaimed the materials and processed them for sale or manufacturing, we can put this capital back to work for the next five projects.
  • Telling Our Story - Deconstruction is still very new to Omaha, and our products are just hitting the market. Our marketing helps to educate stakeholders, attract new partners, and sell reclaimed product built from the blighted homes and obsolete buildings we deconstruct. Because we are a social enterprise, we have found our best marketing comes from leveraging a very efficient approach to social media, press, and speaking with passion about our mission.
  • Wholesale Channel Development - The more product and material we distribute, the greater impact we can have to reduce blight and divert waste. Given the scale of these problems in Omaha, we need to sell a lot of product. We have just begun conversations with retailers of product and materials to help us scale our distribution, but will need to devote more resources to this undertaking as we increase volume of material and level of impact.
  • Processing & Maker Capacity -  To process more reclaimed material into interior/furniture grade materials and product, we need more equipment, temperature controlled space and a kiln to properly adjust moisture content in materials. To make beautiful design elements and products from reclaimed material we also need more makers. Our makers and partner makers are passionate about using reclaimed materials. Our customers fall in love with the quality and history of the pieces. By adding makers to our team and network we increase capacity for reuse, and drive demand for the reduction of blight, diversion of waste, and creation of deconstruction jobs.

While this campaign is designed to accelerate the growth of Reclaimed Enterprises' impact on the reduction of blight, diversion of waste and creation of jobs in Omaha, we may still run across a few reasons to slow down in 2015. 

  • First and foremost is the safety of our community and our crew. If at any time during the execution of our campaign, we see the need to increase controls to protect human life and property, we will pause to evaluate and implement a solution that makes us all feel safer.
  • Second, we won't sacrifice the sustainability of our business model by becoming overly aggressive in deconstruction or sacrificing healthy margin. We intend to be doing this for a long time (there are thousands of structures and customers that will benefit from our model well into the future), and to ensure we can keep doing this we intend to grow smart.
  • Thirdly, if we can't find more of the right people, we will keep looking. Our business relies on a passion for history, the community, and the environment. Our culture is based on the trust of our fellow employees, partners, customers, and community stakeholders. We won't sacrifice that for growth.
Our team has a tremendous amount of experience managing and executing large scale projects, deconstruction of rural and urban buildings, manufacturing handmade products and relying on the expertise of others when needed. We know we don't have all the answers and seek expert council in all areas of our business. The partners, advisors, and community leaders we work with, as well as a culture of learning and transparency will be our greatest assets in addressing challenges down the road.


  • Reclaimed Enterprises quickly recruited and trained a crew of hard working individuals in first 12 weeks of operation, many more individuals are available in our community to be trained and hired
  • Reclaimed Enterprises established its location in North Downtown at the former location of C.G. Johnson Boiler Service & Repair Company. The space is affordable and ideal for processing, warehousing and manufacturing. Additional affordable, adjacent space is also available for expansion.
  • Reclaimed Enterprises established relationships with two maker firms and neighbors a community workshop with at least five other makers-Barnwood Trays (onsite), MTRL Design (North Downtown), and The Bench (next door)
  • Omaha is rich in design and architecture talent and we have already had the privilege of working with visionaries at Tack Architects, Artistico Design, and JG Interiors
  • Customers like VooDoo Taco, Arkfeld Wealth Strategies, and private customers with anything from small product orders to large reclaimed materials orders have already begun to support the mission of Reclaimed Enterprises with their purchases, and have received valuable reclaimed products and materials with a rich history

With over 90% waste diversion (over 400 tons) on our first two blighted housing full deconstruction projects,  the successful recruitment and training of our deconstruction crew, strong makers and partners, and early success in sales of materials and products, we are confident our business model will sustainably drive the impact we seek to have on our community well into the future. 

With proven success in Omaha, we believe our model will provide an example for other small communities to reduce blight, divert waste, and create jobs.



One man's life savings, countless hours of commitment from our team and partners, and great customers have gotten us this far. More capital is required to scale the impact of our business on the community and no impact investment is too small. However, funding our "50 in 15' Campaign" is not the only way to help Reclaimed Enterprises achieve its mission. 

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and your social media platforms to spread the word about our "50 in 15' Campaign"
  • Contact us at 50in15@reclaimedenterprises.com to offer your specific services, talents and time to our mission
  • Visit www.reclaimedenterprises.com or email us at sales@reclaimedenterprises.com to inquire about purchasing Reclaimed Enterprises materials and products

story:
There is more to the story!

What you are looking at here is not what it appears to be.

Ok it is, but there is more to it.

What seems like an electrified piece of wood is actually a wooden housing around a slightly more complex structure. In order to accommodate things like insulation and deal with both polarity issues as well as load control.

The wood in THE QUEUE is actually just a housing for the inner working of the unit.

This inner structure is what needs to be researched and tooled for. When this part of the process is complete the design must be approved by the agencies appropriate to consumer electronics such as these. This is an expensive process and will take a great deal time and labour.

Your contribution can make this happen!



Here is the story

After moving into an old house, my wife and I found there was only a single electrical receptacle in each room. There was a need for more power, however traditional power bars are so unattractive. I set out to design a new way to bring power to our small home studio. Something that was clean, efficient, and beautiful.



This was the solution that I came up with. My initial prototype works as good as it looks and I'd love to start producing them.

I am looking for funding to meet the EC and CSA approval. I am also looking to fund the tooling portion of the design process.

Stay Tuned!

There will soon be a short video as well as more pictures.

story:
Intro 

Honouring Lola, a name shared by the owners’ beloved grandmother and great aunt, Fonda Lola is the lovechild of two Mexico City expats.

Designed  and built by hand by one of them with rustic materials, painted ceramics and treasures brought from Mexico, stepping into the funky little fonda (the Mexican word for casual bistro) feels like a trip to a beach-front cantina.

Based on the belief that quality food and drink can enhance the  well-being, Fonda Lola showcases Mexican food beyond fish tacos and enchiladas, in an authentic atmosphere Lola would be proud of. A new way of Mexican food , a lighter, locally sourced entity that cares for the souls and the palate. 

Fonda Lola's first location has been a huge success and now they're announcing the first-ever "Fonda Lola Membership" where Members get priority seating, free margaritas and custom-made tequila bottles. Fonda Lola is releasing 1,000 Memberships at $75 to build capital for a second location. 

Facts

Fonda Lola is a Mexican restaurant based in Toronto at 942 Queen Street West.

Praised by numerous media outlets including The Toronto Star and The Globe and Mail.

Started as a catering service and pop-up restaurant in 2012.

Opened its doors as a restaurant in November of 2013.

Huge media acclaim and industry leaders in social media .

Second place winner of NOW Toronto’s public choice awards for best Mexican restaurant.

Looking for expansion after one year of successful operations at its first formal location.

Membership

Fonda Lola’s first memberships will be available to the public

1,000 Memberships will be issued at $75 CAD

Within the first year, members can visit Fonda Lola to redeem 100% of their membership value in restaurant credit 

What we are looking for 

We are looking for members(s) who believe in Fonda Lola the way we believe in it, as the best Mexican restaurant in Canada.

We are preparing to make Fonda Lola the most prominent Mexican restaurant in Toronto. And be ready to show rest of Canada what a Mexican fiesta is.

Working capital to improve existing profitable operation (bulk purchases, produce futures, private tequila imports ). 

War Chest Capital for funding  the opening of second location(s)

Additional Benefits 

Members will receive special prices for catering at 20% off the regular price

Members will also receive priority seating and reservations at Fonda Lola

Members who buy 10 memberships will receive a free tequila tasting for up to 4 people

Members who buy 50 memberships will receive complimentary margaritas for up to 6 people

Member who buy 100 memberships will receive their own personalized tequila library with a custom-made premium tequila bottle, plus all the benefits mentioned above

Single member who buys the whole 1,000 memberships will receive their own custom made dish and drink on the menu and a trip to Mexico city and Acapulco for one week all inclusive.

Media 2014

http://www.torontolife.com/tag/fonda-lola/

story:
More than 58.7 million Pakistanis (approximately half the population) live below the poverty line in the rural slums with almost little or no access to the basic amenities of life such as shelter and education. 

Due to this high level of illiteracy and lack of vocational training even skilled middle-aged individuals remain unemployed and hence lead a life that is no less than a series of unfortunate events.

Given proper mentorship and guidance, these young and energetic individuals can prove to be a big asset.  

We a team of recent graduates working on a Blue-Collar Worker's Placement project, currently incubated as best social venture at LUMS Center for Entrepreneurship (www.lce.lums.edu.pk/). 

So far we have managed to place 19 workers on various skill based jobs by collecting donations from friends and family. Through our outreach program we aim to target the poorest workers from the slums and villages all across the nation. Our mission is to facilitate these workers in all necessary trainings starting off with the basic communication skills. We hope that in the long run we can bring about a paradigm shift in the not only the lives of the individuals we employ but also their families by providing them education and health facilities .  


What We Need & How We Spend

We need  $5000/month for at least 6 months to conduct registration drives in order to reach out to the workers all across the country. 

We require further funding to help the workers attain soft and hard skills training. 

Out of a total of $10,000 the break-up of the financials is as below: 

  • $4k on printing the material as displayed by examples below
  • $3k on registration drives' specific stationery material
  • $3k on providing soft skill training's and uniforms of workers
The details of every penny spent will be updated on our facebook page and website in order to maintain complete transparency and ensure that each donation is used for the cause it intended to support in the first place.
Incase we do not reach our set goal, we will try our best to get volunteers on board with us and advertise on social media. 
So Far ?
 We have conducted two registrations drives in nearby areas so far, whereas we received overwhelming response. We registered on average more than 130 workers in these two very small, limited budgeted drivers !

Whereas we've used this material to spread awareness. This is hard copy material and it needs to be displayed in slums to reach workers since workers don't have access to technology so no organic means of outreach is effective !

  The Impact

We've been working for the past 9 months and have seen overwhelming demand of trained workers in all urban cities. We've also seen masses looking for jobs but since they don't have necessary skills, so they don't get placed. Because of lack of funding we've not been able to reach both of them on a large scale and have only placed 19 workers so far. 

Your funding will solely be used to reach out both of them, whereas our team will be working on volunteer basis and will engage more privileged people to volunteer,  help conducting registrations drives & training sessions to make this project a success. 

We have been privileged and have been getting education from the most expensive institution of our country (www.lums.edu.pk). I myself am Electrical Engineer and have left my job to work on this project, whereas I believe one day we'll become self sustaining and will be able to fund our campaigns by ourselves. We'll charge employers to make the system self sustaining.

By working together, we'll be able to pull more individual out of this 60% poverty line and change their lives positively. 

At Entrepreneurship Center, we're being monitored by Director Khurram Zaffar (http://lce.lums.edu.pk/management/) who have been in Silicon Valley, graduated from McGill University and other graduates from MIT and Stanford. They have stake & interest in our project and we've credibility before them so your funds will be monitored closely by these individuals.

Risks & Challenges

Only risk is that if we don't get enough funding, we won't be able to start reaching workers and hence we will not be able to impact the society positively. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't fund, please spread the word in your society. You've been blessed and are living in advanced countries, whereas people in third world countries need your help and support to at least live normal lives. Please share !!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
More than 58.7 million Pakistanis (approximately half the population) live below the poverty line in the rural slums with almost little or no access to the basic amenities of life such as shelter and education. 
Due to this high level of illiteracy and lack of vocational training even skilled middle-aged individuals remain unemployed and hence lead a life that is no less than a series of unfortunate events.
Given proper mentorship and guidance, these young and energetic individuals can prove to be a big asset.  
We a team of recent graduates working on a Blue-Collar Worker's Placement project, currently incubated as best social venture at LUMS Center for Entrepreneurship (www.lce.lums.edu.pk/). 
So far we have managed to place 19 workers on various skill based jobs by collecting donations from friends and family. Through our outreach program we aim to target the poorest workers from the slums and villages all across the nation. Our mission is to facilitate these workers in all necessary trainings starting off with the basic communication skills. We hope that in the long run we can bring about a paradigm shift in the not only the lives of the individuals we employ but also their families by providing them education and health facilities .

story:
Short Summary

Non-profit literary website CitajMe.com (Read Me) was launched in November 2013 with the goal to become the central point for exchanging of literary information in Croatia and surrounding region.

In short time website was recognized as a place where readers can:

  • Read book reviews for domestic and foreign book releases
  • Read interviews with local and foreign authors
  • Be informed about literary events
  • Be informed about the domestic and foreign book charts
  • Be informed about book releases
  • Read trivia from world of literature
  • Participate in contests for new authors
  • Win book awards in contests and giveaways
  • Be informed about other exciting things from the world of books

Currently website CitajMe.com is enjoyed in more than 50 countries worldwide and last month it was visited more than 400 000 times.

For such amount of information daily maintenance imposed a need to expand team (currently 22 persons involved) who are all volunteers, paid by money received from generous supporters.

As a next step, based on the audience interest, the goal is to expand our mission from a virtual world to the physical as well, by opening CitajMe.com BookClub.

In CitajMe.com BookClub:

  • Readers will be able to read books for free
  • Readers will be able to socialize
  • Writers and other people from the literary world will be guests of our audience
  • Several book groups will be established depending on interest
  • Book launch events will be organized
  • Book signing events will be organized
  • Other literary events will be organized
  • Reading of children books will be organized
  • Books will be commented and other literary topics will be discussed

Property of www.coconutgrove.com


In general, CitajMe.com BookClub will open the possibilities for additional promotion of literature and increase public interest in reading, especially among young people.

Gradually with the increase in the number of visitors and general interest, this project could be expanded to providing of other amenities such as the acquisition of audio-visual technology for remote hosting of literary guests from all around the world, lending of books, access to e-books, access to books on different languages, offer of refreshments with popular prices, and others, depending on the interest of the audience and available financial means.


With your help CitajMe.com team will

  • Rent suitable location cca 100m2 in Zagreb, the capital of Croatia, for one year
  • Make necessary physical adaptation/adjustments of location
  • Conclude staffing requirements for one year
  • Purchase inventory
  • Cover the maintenance costs for one year

Property of www.charliequimby.com


Some highlights of CitajMe.com BookClub:

  • Space for 100 readers to socialize, discuss literature or simply enjoy in books
  • Free access to a collection of around 400 books (on opening), both on local language and English, privately donated by CitajMe.com team
  • Planned growth to at least 1000 books in the first business year
  • Free Internet access
  • Free attendance to literary events organized in CitajMe.com BookClub
  • Free access to children books for kids
  • Free membership in book groups


What We Need & What You Get

We need around $21,300 to cover the costs of rent, location adaption, staffing and maintenance for the period of one year:

  • Location rent per year - $6,700
  • Make necessary adaptation of location - $2,200
  • Resolve staffing requirements for period of one year - $6,200
  • Purchase inventory - $4,500
  • Cover the maintenance costs of one year - $1,700

For your donations you will get:

  • $20 - Our gratitude for helping us to get one step closer to opening CitajMe.com BookClub
  • $50 - Your name will be printed in our "I Helped Opening of CitajMe.com BookClub" e-book, a tribute to everyone who contributed to success of this project. The book will be able to download at CitajMe.com website
  • $100 - Denis Vukosav (founder of CitajMe.com will thank you by name in a video that will permanently be available to download on official CitajMe.com YouTube channel. There will be one video thanking everyone who donates at this level and we will also send you a copy of video
  • $300 - Your name will be displayed on CitajMe.com  homepage labeled as a gold donor
  • $500 – Your name will be written on platinum donators plaque and placed in CitajMe.com BookClub
  • $1,000 – The yearly award for best new author chosen by CitajMe.com will be named in supporter honor


The Impact

We see this campaign as continuation of our efforts to stay independent, in same time expanding the potential audience. As non-profit website our team and CitajMe.com BookClub will not be under anyone's control or influence.

With your support we will be able to:

  • Encourage readers to socialize in a space adapted for literary meetings
  • Allow readers free access to books 7 days a week
  • Allow reader access to English literature
  • Have location available for the promotion of books whose sale is not cost-effective
  • Have location in which new authors will have the opportunity to present their works to audience
  • Have location for promotion of self-published authors to larger audience
  • Provide information about less known book editions
  • Expand our impact on the social groups that are not using the Internet, at all or to such an extent (seniors, people with low income)

Property of www.oregonlive.com


Risks & Challenges

Given the relatively high investment required at the project beginning, in case that raised funds will not be sufficient, the project will be launched with funds that will be collected, provided that there would be enough funds for renting suitable premises.

The challenge is to find an economy model that will not undermine the non-profit principles and yet secure a steady source of income after first business year.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute with money donations, please support our efforts in any of the available ways:

  • Spread the word about our campaign and website CitajMe.com
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Send us your suggestions how you can support CitajMe.com BookClub
  • Book donations (in English or some other language)
  • Equipment or inventory donations
  • Send us model of cooperation or support for which you would be interested


Thank you.

CitajMe.com team

story:
Don't Make Your News Limited

Join the HUB CLUB today

The City Hub is Sydney’s last remaining independent community newspaper -- providing vital coverage for the inner city. In 1995 the first issue of the City Hub hit the streets vowing to “print the news and raise hell”. Over the last two decades we have promoted more than a half million performances, events and shows. We have broken news and offered alternative views to Sydney’s mainstream media outlets. We are not your everyday paper.

People who belong to the HUB CLUB are on the look-out for independent perspectives and alternative things to do. And we want you to join. When you contribute to our crowdfuding campaign for as little as $10 you automatically become a member of the HUB CLUB -- entitling you to a weekly news update and an exclusive invite to our 20th birthday bash later this year.

For $30 in addition to the weekly newsletter and birthday party invite, you also get a $30 lunch voucher to La Mint, East Sydney’s sumptuous Vietnamese restaurant OR a voucher to the Crown Street  Fish Shop, the BEST seafood restaurant in Sydney (as named by the City Hub), OR you will get two passes to the hottest new band comp at the World Bar in Kings Cross (worth $30).

There are a range of delicious meals on offer when you join the HUB CLUB by donating to our campaign. There are also a variety of theatre tickets available from cabaret to Shakespeare to musicals available. You can score a valuable flexipass, which will get you into a number of screenings during to the Sydney Film Festival. The Broadway Centre is offering passes to its deluxe screening room (the LUX).  And there are a number comedy passes to a variety of shows during the Sydney Comedy Festival, which will bring a smile to your face.

All of the items that are on offer when you join the HUB CLUB have been contributed by local businesses to support the City Hub. And when you buy them, not only are you getting something of value, you are also doing something valuable for the local community.

HELP US PRINT THE NEWS AND RAISE HELL

Australia is the most consolidated media market in the free world. One publisher, Rupert Murdoch controls 57% of all daily newspaper distribution in the country. No other western democracy has allowed so many media assets to be controlled by one corporation. For 20 years the City Hub has provided an independent alternative to the mainstream media. And we need your help.

Local newsrooms are struggling around the world. In recent years many local newspapers have disappeared from Sydney’s streets. In the face of diminishing advertising revenues, Australia’s media chain gangs have gutted their news staffs, substantially diminishing their ability to cover local news stories. Australia’s state owned broadcaster, the ABC has faced similar budget cuts, eliminating programs that once provided essential state and local news coverage. Across all media platforms, local news coverage in Sydney is becoming more and more scarce.

In the face of shrinking print advertising revenues and a shift to less lucrative local digital platforms, we are seeking new revenue streams in order to keep our doors open. We need to support of the local community that we serve to ensure that Sydney has a fearless, independent community news outlet. We are introducing the HUB CLUB and offering valuable perks to the local community as a way to bring in additional revenue so we can continue to print the news and raise hell.


HOW YOU CAN HELP

In order for us to go on serving the local community, we need your support.  By joining the HUB CLUB, not only will you get some great gifts from some great local businesses, you will do your bit to ensure that the City Hub can continue to print the news and raise hell, as we have for the last 20 years.

Please let your friends know about our campaign. Post details of our campaign on your Facebook page, email your friends, host a gathering at your house in support of our cause. Even if you can't contribute, you can help us get the word out.

Come along to launch of the HUB CLUB upstairs at the Beauchamp Hotel (Oxford Street at the corner of South Dowling, Darlinghurst) on Tuesday April 14th from 7pm onwards. All profits on the night go to our crowdfunding campaign. We hope to see you there.

story:
Short Summary

05/15/15 Update: Though we didn't meet our goal, everything gained from this campaign will go towards opening our store while we look into other funding options. Check out our website(www.convegance.com) for other ways to contribute to this campaign, or follow us on Facebook(facebook.com/convegance).

It's our dream to bring an all vegan 24 hour convenience store to the heart of Los Angeles (and one day to open additional locations in other cities/states)! While it's true we live in a city with many vegan options, where do you go at 2AM to get that frozen vegan pizza you've been craving, or the nutritional yeast you forgot you needed for the late-night mac & cheese recipe you're making? Or when you just need a jar of vegan mayo and don't want to go through the lines/aisle searching at a larger store? Wouldn't it be great to grab something off the shelves and not have to scan for animal ingredients or look up if that company is involved with animal testing? Don't you sometimes wish you could walk into one store and get nachos, a cup of coffee, a prepackaged sandwich and a bottle of soda in under ten minutes, like your pre-vegan days?

That's what we're here for! We want to make being vegan easy, convenient, and extra fun! We plan to offer the vegan essentials as a one stop shop, to take the headache out of a full blown shopping trip. While we'll offer the basics, we also plan on having a smaller featured/harder-to-find products section, and to listen to what you, the customer, would like us to regularly stock! We also have ideas for offering curbside pickup/delivery options!


We're shooting to get Convegance up and running in 6 months (or less!)


What We Need

While we've set our funding at $50,000 , we're really shooting to raise $85,000 , to make Convegance even greater! What this money is going towards is:

*Leasing out a location (we're planning on Hollywood/Silverlake area).
*Shelving/equipment.
*A self serve coffee/tea counter.
*Start up costs/licenses.
*Start up inventory.
*Producing and delivering (or shipping if outside of LA) the listed perks!

The additional money raised past $50k will go towards providing awesome additions such as:
+A soft serve machine!
+A nacho cheese pump/station.
+A microwave area for when you don't want to wait until you get home to heat up that frozen Tofurkey hotpocket you just purchased!
+A license to sell beer and wine.

The Impact

Not only is our mission to make life as a vegan more fun and simple, but it's also to show the general public that being vegan isn't as hard and complicated as they think. Once they step inside Convegance and see all the products that are available and that they never realized were vegan, we hope it'll cause a change in the way the vegan lifestyle is perceived in a positive way! And possibly convert them to the veg side ;D!

By helping fund Convegance, you're supporting a small, independently run vegan business!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can still help in other ways! Sharing our campaign page on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram/Tumblr/your social media of choice would be a great help for us! In addition to raising funds, we'd like to build a buzz to make Convegance bustling when we open! Indiegogo has convenient share tools to make it easy!

Also don't forget to like us on Facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/Convegance

While it's true we live in a city with many vegan options, where do you go at 2AM to get that frozen vegan pizza you've been craving, or the nutritional yeast you forgot you needed for the late-night mac & cheese recipe you're making? Or when you just need a jar of vegan mayo and don't want to go through the lines/aisle searching at a larger store? Wouldn't it be great to grab something off the shelves and not have to scan for animal ingredients or look up if that company is involved with animal testing? Don't you sometimes wish you could walk into one store and get nachos, a cup of coffee, a prepackaged sandwich and a bottle of soda in under ten minutes, like your pre-vegan days?


That's what we're here for! We want to make being vegan easy, convenient, and extra fun! We plan to offer the vegan essentials as a one stop shop, to take the headache out of a full blown shopping trip. While we'll offer the basics, we also plan on having a smaller featured/harder-to-find products section, and to listen to what you, the customer, would like us to regularly stock! We also have ideas for offering curbside pickup/delivery options!

We're shooting to get Convegance up and running in 6 months (or less!)
   What We Need 

While we've set our funding at $50,000 , we're really shooting to raise $85,000 , to make Convegance even greater! What this money is going towards is:*Leasing out a location (we're planning on Hollywood/Silverlake area).*Shelving/equipment.*A self serve coffee/tea counter.*Start up costs/licenses.*Start up inventory.*Producing and delivering (or shipping if outside of LA) the listed perks!
The additional money raised past $50k will go towards providing awesome additions such as:+A soft serve machine!+A nacho cheese pump/station.+A microwave area for when you don't want to wait until you get home to heat up that frozen Tofurkey hotpocket you just purchased!+A license to sell beer and wine.
    The Impact
Not only is our mission to make life as a vegan more fun and simple, but it's also to show the general public that being vegan isn't as hard and complicated as they think. Once they step inside Convegance and see all the products that are available and that they never realized were vegan, we hope it'll cause a change in the way the vegan lifestyle is perceived in a positive way! And possibly convert them to the veg side ;D!By helping fund Convegance, you're supporting a small, independently run vegan business!
    Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute? You can still help in other ways! Sharing our campaign page on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram/Tumblr/your social media of choice would be a great help for us! In addition to raising funds, we'd like to build a buzz to make Convegance bustling when we open! Indiegogo has convenient share tools to make it easy!Also don't forget to like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/Convegance

story:
About

The Intercollegiate Taiwanese American Student’s Association (ITASA) is a national 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that strives to connect, inspire, and empower the Taiwanese American community across the nation to become the next generation of our nation’s leaders. Through an intensive three-day conference with workshops, speaker sessions, and countless networking opportunities, this years Midwest Conference aims to help students expose themselves to self-discovery, grow as influential leaders, and emerge out of their comfort zones and become the protagonist of their own life story.

This years 2015 ITASA Midwest Conference will be held at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign from April 3-5th. “Plot Twist” is ITASA 2015 MWC’s theme. By the end of the conference, we want every attendee to leave with a reinvigorated mindset that our boundaries, every twist and turn of our lives, and unexpected events are not drawbacks but a catalyst in jumpstarting us toward a solidified future. This is the moment of profoundness, this is the plot twist.

Why Donate?

In order to make this conference possible, we need your support. The conference is estimated to cost around $30,000. We are trying a new thing this year! If we reach our goal of $8000, we will be able to bring a surprise special guest to our conference that will be sure to rock the house! The Indiegogo goal of $8,000 is only a milestone that we hope to exceed. If our goal is not reached, all proceeds will still be used to help run this conference.

Who Will Be There?

Sample of Attending Schools:

-Case Western Reserve University

-Carnegie Mellon University

-Northwestern University

-Ohio State University

-University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

-University of Michigan Ann Arbor

-University of Notre Dame

-University of Texas at Austin

-University of Chicago

-University of Illinois at Chicago

-Rice University

List of Speakers (more TBA)

Dawen Wang

Dawen is a Taiwanese American singer and songwriter. Winner of Kollaboration Acoustic 4, Dawen rose in fame for his Chinese translations of famous popular songs, such as Rebecca Black’s “Friday”, “Backstreet Boys”, “I Want It That Way,” and Carly Rae Jepsen’s “Call Me Maybe” on Youtube. Known for his socio-politically conscious music, Dawen’s songs are often used in Asian American Studies departments all over universities across the US. As a Taiwanese-American who has worked in both communities and rose to fame through non-traditional means online through YouTube, Dawen captures many of the values we hope to inspire in attendees.

Julia Kuo

Julia Kuo is a talented illustrator, urban planner, teacher, and individual who has turned her childhood love of drawing into a profitable career. For those who are passionate about a hobby but are not quite sure how to turn it into a sustainable lifestyle, come to this workshop to learn about the challenges and benefits of being paid to pursue your passions!

John Lin

With pressures coming from our parents to pursue degrees in financially stable careers such as engineering, medicine, and business, tension can build up when our parents oppose us following our dreams to be artists, writers, and dancers. For those that struggle to see eye to eye with their parents or guardians, this is the workshop for you.

Leo Chan

For the more adventurous attendees, come learn about the challenges in entrepreneurship. As CEO and Co-Founder of TofuKungfu T-Shirt, Leo Chan is no stranger to embracing his identity in his journey to pursuing his passions. Come to this workshop to hear first-hand from Leo about his journey in creating his own company and product label.

Ho Chie Tsai

Ho Chie is a founding Board Member who also wears many hats in the Taiwanese American community. As a frequent speaker on the collegiate conference circuit and youth summer camp programs, a past Program Director and current Board Member of the Taiwanese American Foundation, and a founder of the Taiwanese American Professionals chapter in San Francisco, he hopes to inspire a renewed sense of pride in personal identity and to increase activism and involvement within the greater Asian American community. Ho Chie holds an Electrical Engineering BS degree from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, a Bioengineering MS and an MD degree from the University of Illinois at Chicago. In his spare time, he works as a pediatrician.

story:
Hi everyone,

I know you get a lot of emails and requests for money every day. The reason I’m posting this is to help a friend of mine who is currently in a highly abusive situation and would like to get out. She can’t post this herself because if her abuser finds out, her life is in serious danger. So, as her friend, I knew the least I could do would be to share her story and her plea for money. The story below is somewhat sparse on specific details to protect her identity. That said, it IS a genuine story from a dear friend and someone who I would love to know has safely extricated herself from a harmful situation. So, I’m asking you to spare a few minutes of your day and a few (or more!) dollars from your wallet to help her out. She deserves the opportunity to restart her life away from this man.

~Jenny

Her story:

I'm a victim of domestic violence, and I’ve learned there’s nowhere to turn. With your help, I can avoid being a casualty.

Like most women, I never thought I would be here. Yet I am, living with physical, emotional and sexual abuse, worrying if each day will be my last.

It started slowly. The first time he hit me, I wrote it off as a mistake. The next time, I blamed myself. Then, I declared it would be the “last time.” It wasn’t. After a while, I stopped bothering to make excuses. The abuse started to feel normal. Recently, things have gotten worse, bad enough that I realize I need to run or I will die this way.

This campaign is to help me get the resources I need to leave quickly and safely, with a goal of raising funds by February 10, 2015.

Basic Facts:

1 in 3 women experiences domestic violence during her lifetime.

Each day, 4 women die as a result of abuse.

A woman is beaten every 15 seconds in the United States.

35% of all emergency room calls are a result of domestic violence (the leading cause of injury to women in the United States).

In the United States, a woman is more likely to be assaulted, raped, or killed by an intimate partner than by any other type of assailant.

What I need:

My safe exit requires $4,000:

$3,000 - security deposit, first, and last month’s rent for a room in a shared house or apartment.

$500 - moving expenses.

$500 - emergency miscellaneous costs

Other Ways To Help:

I understand that not everyone has financial resources to donate right now, or to donate much. Every bit really helps. You also all have social networks. Even if you cannot donate yourself, please do the favor of sharing this campaign with others who you know and raising awareness.

story:
Overview

Cleantech: environmental clean-up innovators

Cleantech has developed a unique process that can clean up waste from mining and other industrial activities – removing toxic chemicals and extracting leftover precious metals at the same time. Help us take this process around the world.

Our story

Industry and mining produce toxic waste. It’s ugly and damages the environment. Imagine if we could clean up these tailings and extract the existing metals (gold, silver, platinum and other base metals) that are left over from the mining process. While industrial clean ups may not have the same added bonus of precious metals, the process of clean up can still be affordable.

Cleantech has the process to make this happen – and we’re already making a start.

You have the chance to help us take this process around the world – you get the feel-good from doing your bit for the environment and you’ll receive the perks from the precious metals we extract in the process and from the turnover produced from sites not containing precious metals.

The toxic waste problem

Billions of tonnes of toxic soil and tailings litter the globe. These tailings are highly toxic, containing residues of the chemicals used in mining and industry, including:

  • cyanide – just a few milligrams is fatal to humans

  • mercury – causes neurological damage and birth defects

These chemicals leach into waterways and soil, killing plant and animal life. Sadly, in some countries people live close to these toxic sites, leading to many health problems.

The hidden value

Hidden in the waste produced by mining are precious metals like gold, silver and platinum – left over from traditional mining methods. It’s normal for a significant percentage of the mineral resource to be left behind in the waste products.

Extracting these precious metals at the same time as cleaning up the waste provides Cleantech with an additional source of revenue and allows us to reward our investors with our unique gold perks.

How Cleantech cleans up

Cleantech uses a process developed over more than a decade of painstaking research and testing:

  1. The process “washes” the waste to extract the toxins and the leftover metals

  2. This turns the remaining waste into clean dirt

  3. This clean dirt can be returned to the surrounding area for planting and habitat renewal

  4. Our process recycles as many resources as possible, including the water used, to ensure minimal impact on the environment

Constructing the processing plant provides employment opportunities in the community. When our job is done, the site is clean. It can be used for commercial or residential development, or left to regenerate as a habitat for plants and animals.

We dispose of the toxic waste according to the environmental management plan we set up for each contract and to comply with the regulations and laws of each country. We always follow industry best practice standards.

We’re already working on it

CleanTech has access to the project rights of many tailings sites in Australia, the USA and Asia. We’ve been invited by site owners to access their sites for condition and products. First we test the soil to work out what needs to be cleaned and then we make a plan with the owner for the clean-up. Following successful independent tests, Cleantech is currently finalizing our first commercial contract for the rehabilitation of a toxic site in Queensland, Australia. This is a relatively small site with 32,000 tonnes of toxic waste in a tailings dam and is an ideal first project for Cleantech.

What we’ll do with your investment

Your contributions will enable us to take this tested, proven process into full production. The first $150,000 will see the first processing plant completed and the remaining $650,000 will fund a further expansion that will allow us to process waste material at 30 tonnes per hour. These plants will be based on a modular design that can be easily taken apart and moved to other sites once the clean-up is completed. This modular design and plant will apply to all future plants used by Cleantech, meaning we can expand our approach to an international solution for toxic site clean-up. The modular design of the production plants has already been completed, and all that remains to be done is building them.

More than mines

We’re not a mining company and we’re not in competition with mines. We are an environmental clean-up company that can also generate revenue through recovery of otherwise lost precious metals.

Our process can also be used to clean up contamination caused by other industries. Although this doesn’t recover precious metals we hope that as the value of our process becomes recognized, governments and industries will contract us to clean up such sites.

Our team

Significant and varied skills are required for this type of work and the assembled team includes the following roles and responsibilities:

  • Project Manager

  • Industrial Chemist

  • Process Engineer

  • Mining Contractor

  • NATA Accredited Laboratories

  • Environmental Management

story:
We are a small church in Riverside, California, and a large part of our city's cultural heritage. Our building, made of red Arizona sandstone, was built in 1891. Now the church needs your help to preserve and protect its historic beauty and dignity.


Our "elegant little stone church," as historian E. W. Holmes described it, was declared Riverside Cultural Heritage Landmark No. 3 in 1969, and officially so designated in 1973. The building was placed on the National Register of Historic Sites in 1978. Major seismic strengthening and restoration of the building was completed in 1988, and rededication of the building took place on April 10, 1988. The congregation is very proud of our beautiful little church and hopes our visitors, guests, and friends enjoy it as much as we do. Our doors have been open for many cultural, social, and educational events of benefit to our community and our city. We also sponsor and provide public films, concerts, and discussions, as well as weddings and memorial services.

Your assistance with urgently needed repairs could allow this landmark church to continue to be a beacon of hope and joy by which many generations over the past 130 years have been guided.

We thank you in advance for your help, and please know that you are welcome to visit us! To inquire about using our facility, please contact Universalist Unitarian Church of Riverside <uuchurchriverside@gmail.com>.

For more info on the history of our church, please visit:

http://www.uuchurchofriverside.org/uucr-history

story:
English version down page.

"Entre restaurant, take away et pâtisserie LaTarte est le lieu à découvrir prochainement. C’est au cœur du 2ème arrondissement de Paris qu’oscillant entre tradition et innovation nous allons vous faire retrouver des plaisirs d’enfants et aiguiser votre curiosité gourmande. Le plaisir de gouter le croquant d’une pâte sablée, le croustillant d’une pâte feuilletée faite maison.

 Gouter une garniture sélectionnée avec attention et goût pour que chaque bouchée éveille le palais.

LaTarte est aussi le lieu où l’on peut venir satisfaire son envie d’apprendre en participant aux cours collectifs ou particuliers sur  ce qui a fait la pâtisserie française."


Cette idée plutôt simple au départ de construire un concept de restauration autour d'un mono produit, m'est venue en observant autour de moi le nombre d'endroit où il possible de "mal se nourrir". Pouvoir profiter d'un repas simple mais de qualité, pouvoir se poser dans un cadre chaleureux est devenu un luxe dans nos vies urbaines. Une envie de proposer quelque chose de différent, une sorte de back to basic.
J'ai toujours aimé recevoir des amis et préparer des repas  pour les ravir.On peut dire que c'est ma manière de donner le sourire autour de moi. C'est mon père qui a été l'initiateur de cette passion.
Ancien directeur artistique dans le milieu de la mode, j'ai laissé mes 25 années de carrière de côté afin de pouvoir vivre ma passion et aujourd'hui je me forme dans l'une des plus grandes écoles culinaires "Ferrandi".
LaTarte est un projet de vie, et avant tout une manière de partager ma passion avec d'autres personnes. Je souhaite pouvoir les accueillir comme s'ils entraient chez-moi, et loin du style de nombreux autres endroits parisiens bien trop froids à mon goût et servant des produits sous vide ou industriels. Je veux aussi en faire un lieu d'échange et proposer des cours de pâtisserie autour de réalisations traditionnelles.
Je dispose d'une partie du financement, et j'ai la chance d'avoir des bec fins autour de moi qui croient en mon projet et me soutiennent. Toutefois il manque encore quelques fonds afin de pouvoir louer un local et le transformer en "home sweet food". 
Je vous remercie d'avoir pris le temps de me lire et peut-être de m'aider, en espérant que prochainement je pourrai à mon tour aider. 

" Somewhere between a restaurant, a take away and bakery shop... LaTarte is the place to be. It's in the heart of the 2nd district of Paris oscillating between tradition and innovation that you will remember your childhood pleasures  and sharpen your greedy curiosity. The pleasure of enjoying a crisp, sugar crust pastry and the crunch of a home-made puff pastry.

Enjoy a wide selection of pastries chosen with delicate attention and taste so that every mouthful awakens your tastebuds.

LaTarte is also the place where you can come to satisfy your desire to learn by participating in our collective or individual classes to learn what makes the French 'pâtisserie' so special. 

This rather simple idea to build a concept of catering around an individual product, came to me by observing several places around me, where it's only possible to "eat badly". Being able to take enjoy a simple, high quality meal, in friendly,  comfortable surroundings has become a luxury in our urban lives. My desire is to propose something different, a kind of back to basics.

I have always loved inviting friends to my home and preparing meals to delight them. I would say that it is my way of having smiling faces around me . It was my father who was the initiator of my passion.

Former art director in the fashion world, I left my career of 25 years  aside to be able to live my passion and today I am training in one most renowned culinary schools  

" Ferrandi ".

LaTarte is a life plan, and above all,  a way of sharing my passion with other people. I want to welcome the customers as if they were at my home, a far cry from the many cold hearted  Parisian places where they serve industrial, vacuum packed products. I would like it to become a meeting place and to propose bakery classes to teach our traditional dishes. 

I already have part of the financing, and I am lucky enough to have gourmet friends around me who believe in my project and will financally help me. However I am still missing some funds to be able to rent my premises and transform it into " home sweet food ". 

Thank you to have taken time to read my story and hopefully you can help me in my venture, I hope that soon I can help others in turn.
story_txt:
English version down page."Entre
restaurant, take away et pâtisserie LaTarte est le lieu à découvrir
prochainement. C’est au cœur du 2ème arrondissement de Paris
qu’oscillant entre tradition et innovation nous allons vous faire retrouver des
plaisirs d’enfants et aiguiser votre curiosité gourmande. Le plaisir de gouter le croquant d’une pâte sablée, le croustillant d’une pâte feuilletée faite
maison.
 Gouter une garniture sélectionnée avec
attention et goût pour que chaque bouchée éveille le palais. 

LaTarte est aussi le lieu où l’on peut venir
satisfaire son envie d’apprendre en participant aux cours collectifs ou
particuliers sur  ce qui a fait la
pâtisserie française."Cette idée plutôt simple au départ de construire un concept de restauration autour d'un mono produit, m'est venue en observant autour de moi le nombre d'endroit où il possible de "mal se nourrir". Pouvoir profiter d'un repas simple mais de qualité, pouvoir se poser dans un cadre chaleureux est devenu un luxe dans nos vies urbaines. Une envie de proposer quelque chose de différent, une sorte de back to basic.J'ai toujours aimé recevoir des amis et préparer des repas  pour les ravir.On peut dire que c'est ma manière de donner le sourire autour de moi. C'est mon père qui a été l'initiateur de cette passion.Ancien directeur artistique dans le milieu de la mode, j'ai laissé mes 25 années de carrière de côté afin de pouvoir vivre ma passion et aujourd'hui je me forme dans l'une des plus grandes écoles culinaires "Ferrandi".

LaTarte est un projet de vie, et avant tout une manière de partager ma passion avec d'autres personnes. Je souhaite pouvoir les accueillir comme s'ils entraient chez-moi, et loin du style de nombreux autres endroits parisiens bien trop froids à mon goût et servant des produits sous vide ou industriels. Je veux aussi en faire un lieu d'échange et proposer des cours de pâtisserie autour de réalisations traditionnelles.Je dispose d'une partie du financement, et j'ai la chance d'avoir des bec fins autour de moi qui croient en mon projet et me soutiennent. Toutefois il manque encore quelques fonds afin de pouvoir louer un local et le transformer en "home sweet food". Je vous remercie d'avoir pris le temps de me lire et peut-être de m'aider, en espérant que prochainement je pourrai à mon tour aider. 

" Somewhere between a
restaurant, a take away and bakery shop... LaTarte is the place to be. It's in
the heart of the 2nd district of Paris oscillating between tradition and
innovation that you will remember your childhood pleasures  and sharpen
your greedy curiosity. The pleasure of enjoying a crisp, sugar crust pastry and
the crunch of a home-made puff pastry.
Enjoy a wide selection of
pastries chosen with delicate attention and taste so that every mouthful
awakens your tastebuds.
LaTarte is also the place
where you can come to satisfy your desire to learn by participating in our
collective or individual classes to learn what makes the French 'pâtisserie' so
special. 
This rather simple idea to
build a concept of catering around an individual product, came to me by
observing several places around me, where it's only possible to "eat
badly". Being able to take enjoy a simple, high quality meal, in friendly,
 comfortable surroundings has become a luxury in our urban lives. My
desire is to propose something different, a kind of back to basics.
I have always loved
inviting friends to my home and preparing meals to delight them. I would say
that it is my way of having smiling faces around me . It was my father who was
the initiator of my passion.
Former art director in the
fashion world, I left my career of 25 years  aside to be able to live my
passion and today I am training in one most renowned culinary schools  
" Ferrandi ".
LaTarte is a life plan,
and above all,  a way of sharing my passion with other people. I want to
welcome the customers as if they were at my home, a far cry from the many cold
hearted  Parisian places where they serve industrial, vacuum packed
products. I would like it to become a meeting place and to propose bakery
classes to teach our traditional dishes. 
I already have part of the
financing, and I am lucky enough to have gourmet friends around me who believe
in my project and will financally help me. However I am still missing some
funds to be able to rent my premises and transform it into " home sweet
food ". 
Thank you to have taken
time to read my story and hopefully you can help me in my venture, I hope that
soon I can help others in turn.

story:
Because we deserve more than pizza and poutine... 

The LO will offer Vancouver a fresh, affordable, and delicious late-night meal.  Specializing in our own brand of gourmet bao, The LO aims to combine our phenomenal pork, chicken and beef filings with a hot and fresh, locally-sourced steamed bun. We will be using sustainably raised meat and organic produce.  The end result will be a delicious take-out style meal that consumers can eat in house or devour on the road.  

The LO will provide more than just fantastic food. It will be a haven for those seeking cultural refuge from the existing late-night scene. Great music, rustic décor, and a social environment will all be mainstays at the LO’s pop-up space.  Beverage (non-alc) will be provided free of charge and a community vibe will bind everything together.

The LO will be open for dinner and late-night eats on Vancouver’s busiest nights.  We will also provide select catering service to private events.  

Who We Are

We are Lexani Llaguno, J.P Pascual and Matthew Singh, friends, business partners and like-minded individuals who were brought together by Vancouver’s  late-night social circles. The LO has been in the planning stages for over a year now and we are poised to bring all the pieces together. Organic musings, patience thru trial and error and tedious targeted research has led to a business model that we believe fills a void in the city’s existing culinary portfolio.

Lexani brings a strong background in marketing, brand development and small business start-up experience, creating and nurturing his own creative management/public relations agency. JP is an un-rivalled cultural savant and entrepreneur holding key footholds in Vancouver’s art and nightlife community. Matthew brings a strong background in the restaurant and hospitality industries working both a restaurant manager and as a product supplier. Together we have the right blend of passion, insight and originality to create something truly special.


Keys to The LO

We're opening The LO on a small budget, literally building the business ourselves with the help of family, friends and the community. We're launching this pre-sales campaign to help complete our vision of what The LO should be and to generate momentum in the lead up to our grand opening.

With your support, we're aiming to raise $10,000 through pre-sales of Keys to The LO. The money will go a very long way in helping make The LO a reality; everything from supplementing the lease for our location, outfitting additional appliances and equipment for our kitchen and the finishing touches on creating a space that we truly believe to be a breath of fresh air to our customers.

The LO is for the people. So, it’s only appropriate that we give you the chance to purchase keys for the location. We don’t actually mean you can enter at any time BUT here is what our keys do unlock.

When you buy a "Key" to The LO for a given value, you will get a pre-loaded amount to spend at The LO for whatever you fancy. As our thanks to you for purchasing a Key to The LO before we open, we're offering special perks that range from exclusive The LO branded tee-shirts, VIP rewards and treatment, to having us personally cater your own private party, event or company affair.

Thank You

The LO will be a place where people come for food and stay for the experience.  We thank you profusely for taking the time to purchase a key or share this page with your networks.  

We look forward to seeing you in 2015!
