story:
We are improvement engineers.



Before introducing the Urbamobile Transportation System one thing should be noted: however unbelievable or fantastic it may seem, implementing this System on a broad and global level, without exaggeration, opens up a new era in the history of mankind.

Unfortunately, it is exactly the fatally hopeless organization of motor-car traffic in the actual absence of feasible alternatives that predetermined a rather bleak picture until recently.

But now when the urbamobile is invented giving the realistic chance of organizing everything in a fundamentally different way. Implementing the amazing urbamobile ability to easily move around disregarding contact and ensuring good maneuvering in a squeezed space environment due to optimal design and control offered by the Urbamobile Transportation System.


In fact all the benefits of modern transportation systems for which long-term sustainable development is absolutely impossible are achieved now by stronger violation of the person’s peace, distortion of social relations, environmental damage, and are inevitably being destroyed by an increasing number of vehicles.

An increasing number of urbamobiles in the Urbamobile Transportation System, on the contrary, is an obvious, progressionally growing benefit, both environmental and social, which is based not on illusory, ideal good intentions and pipedreams, but on absolutely real, totally objective material properties of urbamobiles and their System.

Such unique features make the Urbamobile Transportation System look like the only real prospect of transport development for individual projects of the future as well as for universal global progress.

Unlike the automotive system, the Urbamobile Transportation System is surely the "smartest" and most environmentally friendly system of logistics and transportation, is completely safe for humans and the environment.

The System provides mobility in a most efficient way.

The System really helps simply eliminate the distances, create completely universal, global and at the same time individual, exceptional opportunities for almost perfect optimization of any vehicle traffic, like mobile communications and the Internet help optimize the information traffic.

For normal driving, the urbamobile with its remarkable universal round shape can get along with just two wheels that do not require any mechanical control. 

Ideal for all digital and Internet technologies.

The urbamobile is protected from damage upon contact; moreover, it ensures control and maneuverability specifically in contact and allows rotation, too.


Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting: “ROADS KILL” 

The global road death toll has already reached 1.24 million per year and is on course to triple to 3.6 million per year by 2030.



The Urbamobile parking is compact, extremely compact. It is performed completely in driverless mode. Almost in any way: in a chain, in a column, etc.



The maintenance is fully automated.

There are endless perspectives for optimization of usage and cheapening of components, like batteries, electric motors, etc.

With the introduction of the Urbamobile Transportation System, the opportunities which are unavailable in the traditional transportation systems open up literally in everything, promising both new ways of economic development and, more generally, positive development in the broadest sense.

The Urbamobile utilizes everything in the most efficient way – solar power, wind power, stopping power, saves acceleration energy, etc.

The universal round shape of the urbamobile is an ideal tool to minimize and optimize all calculations associated with its positioning, which is based on a sole central spot on its surface.


As it saves the scope of computation, the Urbamobile Transportation System ensures such a huge integration potential that it helps systemically incorporate literally everything in the equation, including  optimal distribution of urbamobiles depending on the population density, social environment, specificity of transportation, road capabilities, environment and weather conditions, etc.- and any other unexpected circumstances.

For example, absolute transport accessibility, in areas up to 100 km from the center of modern cities, significantly expands the possibilities for almost equally comfortable living. This makes absolutely impractical extremely expensive multi-storied house construction and should reduce realty prices in downtown areas hopelessly losing their commercial exclusivity, by dozens of percent, and create an ever growing supply of extremely cheap-to-build property in huge areas, equally valuable from all perspectives, at prices that inevitably tend to a very low construction cost.

And this is just one examples of fundamental positive changes that can be brought about by the Urbamobile Transportation System in people’s lives.

Generally speaking, the Urbamobile Transportation System enables a really large number of people to completely, and permanently, forget about traffic jams, parking areas, fines, crashes, car repairs, maintenance, limitations, liability, and other onerous beauties and unpleasant surprises associated with a personal car.

At the same time, the Urbamobile Transportation System helps everybody else forget, fully and forever, about the substantial risk of death or injury under motor car wheels, inevitable difficulties and inconveniences of public transport, other dangers and troubles that people unwilling or unable to use a car of their own simply have to put up with.

In the Urbamobile Transportation System, everything moves so easily and quickly that rest and motion almost cease to differ, and distances stop being a significant factor.


While the Urbamobile Transportation System offers ultimate customization and full automation, it makes the driver’s function in a vehicle completely unnecessary, implements a completely new ideology of transport infrastructure organization, which gives it a lot of new features, completely missing now from all other systems, including:

                                             

We invite everyone to contribute to the development of the Urbamobile Transportation System so that it helps, in the very near future, fundamentally, successfully and definitively to resolve the transport and logistical problems facing all and positively impact the process of tackling numerous global economic, social and even political problems of today.

Certainly, the development of the Urbamobile Transportation System and the introduction of urbamobiles can and should proceed by gradual, evolutionary substitution of other modes of transport, without creating new risks of any economic, social or political tensions and reducing the existing risks.

For more information visit the Website: www.urbamobile.com. Please feel free to contact us via e-mail: info@urbamobile.com.

The team means everyone who knows and realizes that all is not lost. And does business. Our business. Everybody’s business. And willingly shares what he can share. Understanding. Trust. Hope. Assistance. Involvement. Neatness. Intelligence. Skills. Talent.

The first thing that happens when people hear about an urbamobile or the urbamobile transportation system for the first time is failure to understand. First, failure to understand how indeed this works. Followed by failure to understand if it really is that simple. And at the end, failure to understand: if all is so simple and so great, where is it? 


And finally, EVERYONE says: all and everyone will not ever see that good thing happen because things can’t be that good! And everyone starts persuading himself to stop even hoping: nobody is going to believe that, nobody is going to allow that, the bureaucrats will not authorize, the enemies will not approve, the manufacturers will be strongly against, and the consumers do not have a say… YES, THEY DO!!! It’s OUR demand that determines THEIR supply. Hence, everyone who does spend a little time and effort to realize what the Urbamobile and Urbamobile Transportation System are about IS PART OF OUR TEAM.

A lot of people already contribute to our efforts, providing individual services, responding to requests, acting in various areas more or less independently. It would probably be unfair to single out anyone of those who already understands, who is convinced and really involved in work. It may be that we haven’t met some people – literally, the number of those who opts for the URBAMOBILE and the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM grows every single day.

Surprisingly, but we have reasons to believe that nature itself, as well as numerous inhabitants of this planet, agrees with us. The charming Beatrice definitely thinks so:

                                 

And she doesn’t mind either if vehicles do not kill nature, whether literally or figuratively.

  I, the author and organizer, am sure of that, too:

                               

                                  

I realize that -

- firstly, it is the author enforcing and protecting his copyright and patent rights to the maximum extent possible who necessarily must do all he can to make sure the Urbamobile system doers not repeat the sad fate of nearly all complicated technical systems known to mankind where any fundamentally new technical solution imminently attracts an uncountable number of variators parasitically feeding on copyright and patent right protection imperfections. Essentially, under the guise of aspiration for diversity, they create extra complications for consumers, such as various forms, sizes, formats, connectors, protocols, etc., which are hardly compatible, if at all, and then epically and infinitely struggle through them, stealing more and more money from consumers’ wallets for their services;

  - secondly, the sooner and harder an ever growing number of people contribute increasingly to the emergence of the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM, the sooner all of its remarkable benefits stop being a dream and become as natural and common as mobile communication or the Internet. Already now, there are no outward insurmountable obstacles hampering the introduction of URBAMOBILES and the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. Moreover, reality is inevitably pushing us to them.



    

List of PCT contracting States

We thought we could cover the most important regions, from the consumption size perspective, with respective national URBAMOBILE patents on our own, but any assistance under the circumstances would surely be useful. During the national phases of URBAMOBILE patenting, we need your broadest and most comprehensive assistance to make the process as short as possible, involving a maximum number of the most skilled experts within the shortest time frame, striving, within the shortest time and with the biggest synergy effect, to cover as many potential territories as possible, ideally the whole world: the more countries are covered by the author’s systemic patenting of the URBAMOBILE, warranting maximum protection against all sorts of abuse and distortions, the cheaper and more comfortably the URBAMOBILE will be introduced in consumers’ life. And the sooner, too.

To make this happen, a PCT application should also be filed for the invention of the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM AND METHOD OF ITS OPERATION by December 22, 2015.

We need your assistance in preparing the patenting process and the actual patenting of the URBAMOBILE and the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM by means of PСТ to try and make the process as short as possible, involving a maximum number of the most skilled experts within the shortest time frame, striving, within the shortest time and with the biggest synergy effect, to cover as many potential territories as possible, ideally the whole world: the more countries are united by the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM and the author’s systemic patenting of the URBAMOBILE and the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM, thus warranting even more exhaustive protection against all sorts of abuse and distortions, the cheaper and more comfortable the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM services and, generally, all transportation services are for consumers.

The sooner the world begins to really change for the better.

And the sooner this becomes a fact of reality.

Any support from You, any single bit of additional information disseminated, every additional word of support, every additional dollar of donations bring us closer to the ability to replace the transport which is simply enslaving us with URBAMOBILE that sets us really free.

We would be happy to offer contributors the following perks:


Thank you! – Name to be mentioned on urbamobile.com Web site

You get this gift after we receive your name and e-mail at info@urbamobile.com


A black and white picture file for URBAMOBILE model assembly

You get this gift after we receive your e-mail at info@urbamobile.com


Colored picture file for URBAMOBILE model assembly

You get this gift after we receive your e-mail at info@urbamobile.com


Digital certificate for benefits of the URBAMOBILE founder

You get this gift after we receive your name and e-mail at info@urbamobile.com


2 stickers with logo, saying: “I ♥ urbamobile”



2 badges with logo, saying “I ♥ urbamobile”


3 elastic bracelets saying: “I ♥ urbamobile”



Baseball cap with logo




T-shirt (available sizes: S, M, L, XL, XXL) with custom design and logo

You get this gift after we receive your size at info@urbamobile.com if the size is not clear from the chosen perk

S size


M size


L size


XL size


XXL size


Hoodie (available sizes: S, M, L, XL, XXL) with custom design and logo

You get this gift after we receive your size at info@urbamobile.com if the size is not clear from the chosen perk

S size


M size


L size


XL size


XXL size



Thank you! – Autographed author’s picture


Limited-series, numbered URBAMOBILE model made of picture file printout parts with certificate of authenticity


Collectors’ brochure about happiness, love, peace and tranquility (in Russian, with English translation) with author’s autograph


© Alexey F. Khoroshev, 2015, urbamobile

of this planet, agrees with us. The charming Beatrice definitely thinks so:                                  
And she doesn’t mind either if vehicles do not
kill nature, whether literally or figuratively.
  I,
the author and organizer, am sure of that, too:
                                                                 I realize that -
- firstly, it is the author
enforcing and protecting his copyright and patent rights to the maximum extent
possible who necessarily must do all he can to make sure the Urbamobile system
doers not repeat the sad fate of nearly all complicated technical systems known
to mankind where any fundamentally new technical solution imminently attracts
an uncountable number of variators parasitically feeding on copyright and
patent right protection imperfections. Essentially, under the guise of
aspiration for diversity, they create extra complications for consumers, such
as various forms, sizes, formats, connectors, protocols, etc., which are hardly
compatible, if at all, and then epically and infinitely struggle through them,
stealing more and more money from consumers’ wallets for their services;
  -
secondly, the sooner and harder an ever growing number of people contribute
increasingly to the emergence of the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM, the
sooner all of its remarkable benefits stop being a dream and become as natural and common as mobile communication or the
Internet. Already now, there are no outward insurmountable obstacles hampering
the introduction of URBAMOBILES and the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.
Moreover, reality is inevitably pushing us to them.




     


List of PCT contracting States

We thought we could cover the most important
regions, from the consumption size perspective, with respective national
URBAMOBILE patents on our own, but any assistance under the circumstances would
surely be useful. During the national phases of URBAMOBILE patenting, we need
your broadest and most comprehensive assistance to make the process as short as
possible, involving a maximum number of the most skilled experts within the
shortest time frame, striving, within the shortest time and with the biggest
synergy effect, to cover as many potential territories as possible, ideally the
whole world: the more countries are covered by the author’s systemic patenting
of the URBAMOBILE, warranting maximum protection against all sorts of abuse and
distortions, the cheaper and more comfortably the URBAMOBILE will be introduced
in consumers’ life. And the sooner, too. 
To make this happen, a PCT application should also be filed for the invention of the
URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM AND METHOD OF ITS OPERATION by December 22, 2015.
We need your assistance in preparing
the patenting process and the actual patenting of the URBAMOBILE and the
URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM by means of PСТ to try and make the process as short as
possible, involving a maximum number of the most skilled experts within the
shortest time frame, striving, within the shortest time and with the biggest synergy
effect, to cover as many potential territories as possible, ideally the whole
world: the more countries are united by the URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM
and the author’s systemic patenting of the URBAMOBILE and the URBAMOBILE
TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM, thus warranting even more exhaustive protection against
all sorts of abuse and distortions, the cheaper and more comfortable the
URBAMOBILE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM services and, generally, all transportation
services are for consumers. 
The sooner the world begins to
really change for the better.
And the sooner this becomes a fact
of reality.
Any support from You, any single bit
of additional information disseminated, every additional word of support, every
additional dollar of donations bring us closer to the ability to replace the
transport which is simply enslaving us with URBAMOBILE that sets us really free.

story:
The Impact

Our website provides an Online Bidding Platform for Farmers / Dealers and Agents to post used tractors, bid for the vehicles already listed and to ensure that they get the best deal possible in the market. The inbuilt features such as bid intimation to seller, bid intimation to top buyers and freedom to close the bid at any time, on reaching a desired value make it unique. We bring the seller and the buyer together on a single platform for providing a big list of choices for any make or model.



Risks & Challenges

There are a few challenges with making this a success, but keeping that in mind, we have chalked out our expansion plans.

- The farmers do not have internet access in rural villages---- To counter this, we plan to employ team of Feet on Street that reach these villages, conduct meetings with farmers and teach them how to use this simple service. We plan to rope in the Internet Cafe owners in and around villages, as our agents, that help farmers to list vehicles, or bid on their behalf.

- Farmers may not trust us---- The farmers have a "Trust Factor" in the traditional methods of buying or selling their vehicles. We plan to tie-up with various valuation agents across the country to provide good quality photographs and at certain angles with a description of the condition of the vehicle, basis which we certify the vehicle and build the trust in us.

story:
I am writing from a cold back room of our current headquarters.  I feel sad and tired and alone, and yet when my thoughts turn to the subject I want to write about, there is this sudden inkling of warmth and joy, no matter how disheartening the situation we find ourselves in is. The thing I want to write about is love. Of myself, of you, of living in harmony with one and other. 

As a part of Pro Dialog, z.s. a nonprofit that has a history working with domestic violence here in Prague, Czech Republic, we continue doing what we started in 2012, when Mariana and I founded Here be lions, to share what is important for us with other people, among other Nonviolent Communication and Restorative Circles. Some of you who are now reading this are people we met during that time, who expressed interest and gratitude for what we do. 

We need support to continue our work now and I write this text to create an opportunity for those who I think would enjoy doing so. We have a project with the Ministry of Justice to meet with communities where violent acts occurred and support them in finding out how to communicate in a way that has a bigger chance to be understood by the other parties than a blow to someone's face, gun in someone's hand. 


We visit the community members, we listen to them and share our experiences. We learn what it is they are saying, what they want to do and how they want to communicate about it with others. Then we find out what needs to be done for that to happen and what needs to happen for that to keep happening in the future without our help. Then we do it. 

I don't know anyone in Czech Republic who does what we do. It seems to me to be more important the more we do it, the more we learn, the more I see what is going on in the world. What we do is being with people in pain, so they do not feel alone and support them in finding ways how to be safe/free. What we do is we learn from those who have more or different experience with conflict than us. 


For us to be able to do this full time, we need a space to live, food to eat, and other things to take care of our needs. So far our work was sustained by government funding. That doesn't seem no longer viable as an only source of income. Not only that government money comes with various strings attached, making it harder to use money effectively and do what is sensible at the time, it is also very unpredictable how much we will get. 

We apply for various funding options every year. In 2015 we did got smaller amounts than the year before, which in combination with our over all situation lead to a money crisis. As of the time of writing this, Pro Dialog doesn't have any money in its bank account. What more, we owe money. We owe 200000 CZK (7882$) to a company owned by Mariana's father and 100000 CZK  (3941$) to one of our members, who paid for some of our work during the last year using her own savings, working for free herself. Most of us were paid just partly in November. We are not sure how much we will be paid in December.

How did this happen happen? Will it happen again?

For a long time Pro Dialog,z.s. operated on some kind of basic trust that everybody is working on their part of the current project and automatically understands and agrees on what that part is. We often had prolonged conversation about certain events and agreed about our values, which created the illusion that we also agree on the actions we need to take. This became more and more visible over time, when we were repeatately finding ourselfs in situations when we did something we thought is aligned with what we talked about and the other members did not think so (and vice versa). With the repetition, the basic trust was shaken. Which was a good thing in a way, because it highlighted the fact that more understanding is necessary for us to move forward and willingness to change was born. The money crisis was a final straw. The conflict is now loud enough that we decided to take time from working to talk about topics important for us functioning together. Some of them are:

  • What do we do in a conflict - How can we talk and be sure we are heard the way we want to be? How can we all feel safe sharing our truths? What works for us as a group, what doesn't work? We are an interesting mix of people from different backgrounds working with different methods. There is a great potential for us to support one another, but often we also misunderstand what somebody says or feel threaten by it, because what we do is very important to us. We hope that if we create a system that would support our safety and understanding, it would lead to bigger cooperation between us and more support for all involved.
  • Principles we live by and how they manifest in actions we do - We noticed we are in full agreement when talking about principles we aspire to work and live by and we are also sometimes afraid when we see somebody do something we interpret as not aligning with those principles. We want to learn more about one another and know why each of us does what he/she does.
  • Money - We would like to transition from being reliant on government funding which is unpredictable to being financed from the community of people who find our work valuable. We would like to communicate more about money between each other, decide together how we use what we have so we cover needs for everyone involved and no one alone feels responsible for how money is used or for securing enough of it. With this in place we hope we would see next upcoming money crises earlier and had more ways of solving it if not preventing it from happening at all.

Our vision is that by making space for these continuous talks we will replace the illusion of understanding by real understanding and real action plan, which cares for needs of all of us. My hope is that we will shift from acting out of fear of loosing government funding to a place of possible abundance, leaving behind thoughts about what "is not possible to do" and instead think about "what do we need to make this possible". So the answer to the question if crises like this is likely to happen again is: Possibly, and our vision is to have systems in place that would make it possible for us to see it earlier, care for it and make it more of an opportunity to make things better instead of a scary thoughts about not knowing how will we survive next months.


What do we need to continue our work?

Pro Dialog, z.s. has seven members. Four of us work mainly with Nonviolent Communication and Restorative Circles in communities where violent acts occurred, three of us concentrate on supporting parents and children in families in conflict and a form of mediation called family dialog. For us to get paid at full (which includes mandatory payments to our government like taxes and health insurance) we need 200 000 CZK (7882$) a month. 

We also need to pay for the space we are renting and utilities, which is 100 000 CZK (3941$) for 5 months. It needs to be payed beforehand.

We are expecting to get more money in April, as we applied for various forms of funding for the next year. To cover the time from now to April we would need: 

4x 200 000 CZK (7882$) = 800 000 CZK (31 528$) for the seven of us to live on

100 000 CZK (3941$) to rent the space we work in and the services needed

100 000 CZK (3941$) to pay back one of our members

200000 CZK (7882$) to pay back company owned by Mariana's father

Which is in total 1 200 000 CZK (47 292$).

It is a big number. I would like to encourage people to donate even if it is just a few dollars they can spare with joy. Every sum is valuable. See here:

100 CZK (4$) = take out lunch for one of us so we do not have to worry about our rumbling stomach when wanting to concentrate on what is said

1000 CZK (39$) = food for one of us for a full week

20 000 CZK (780$) = stability and space to concentrate on the work for a month for one of us, because their monthly expenses are covered


Other ways to support us:

If you do not have any money to joyfully spare, these are other things we would find supportive: 

  • messages that you value our work (could be send to zdejsoulvi@gmail.com)
  • sharing this text with other people who you know who might be willing and able to support us
  • your time and willingness to help with some tasks without needing money in exchange (write to zdejsoulvi@gmail.com for more details)
  • pictures of pandas, lions or pugs send to zdejsoulvi@gmail.com

More about the principles we aspire to live by:

Nonviolent Communication:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nonviolent_Communication

https://www.cnvc.org/

Restorative Circles:

http://www.restorativecircles.org/

Gratitude

Part of why it is possible for me to write this text is the continous support from my colleagues. 

Anna, who gave me money to buy myself lunch today and with that a renewed hope that we will not go under. 

Honza, with whom I talked about people we work with and for the first time that week I felt the enthusiasm again. 

Michal, with whom I can laugh and who sometimes stays connected to the principles when I am not able to and by doing it he pulls me back in. 

Jindřiška, who bravely said yes to us doing all this in the name of Pro Dialog, z.s. after a life long expirience with how dangerous it might be to be doing something different, something new. 

Daniela, who names things clearly and is interested in uncovering what is going on. 

And Mariana, who opened one door after another, who loves me, who showed me some aspects of the world I want to live in that I would have forggoten about. 

I want them all to have space to concentrate on doing what is meaningful to them too.

Jana

story:
1 - ABOUT US

Our names are Perrine and Frederic, two good friends who had met 5 years ago on a green set. This place became quickly a precious place, we get together every week to become a duo of presenters surfing on internet. Both crazy about nature and organic food, we have decided to bring together our ideals to our job to create an e-business web-site where you can get in one clic boxes offering the best organic ingredients from France. To promote our web site, we'll hit the road pretty often to go meet the farmers and craftsmen. Fred (the Frog) will interview them. Perrine (Lady), from her kitchen will explain how to get your box ready to have a delicious diner. She will also expose the art of living à la française.    

   

EXAMPLE OF A TUTORIAL


2 - OUR CREED 

Recently, the US authorized the market launch of genetically modified salmon. A few years ago, the EU agreed to name Chocolate a product that includes less than 5% cocoa. The good old days may not return, as the rocker would sing. 

If we are what we eat, then the agro-business think we are cattle to raise and feed. Once there was a country which cooking meant good health. Its quality products and aestonishing gastronomy made its high reputation. Their nutritional benefits were known as the French Paradox. 

This is endangered by the industrial practises. Fortunately, there are still people paying respect to Mother Nature, driven by the goal of offering their best through the products they market. They will never access to TV ads. They can’t access to the racks of supermarkets. We’re going to promote them by the means of internet. 

Information is spreading fast through the net. It runs viral. We are going to broadcast our videos on the various plateforms but also on blogs and every media that would accept them. It will then be easier to source the very best of French Food direct on our e-Biz website. 

EXAMPLES OF OUR COMPENSATIONS :-)

              

                   


3 - WHY FUND IT? 


In order to shoot our Web Reports and other videos, we need an appropriate equipment. To keep our project creative and entertaining, we need to choose this light and performing to shoot in fields, wine caves and small operations. 

Please find enclosed the proforma for the equipment we need. Total amount is 10000 euros. Your contribution, however small, will consolidate our own ressources. 

Plus, we have to develop a e-Business Web site adapted to trade on a global scale. This means it has to be multilingual, to handle various currencies… In the matter of web development, the sky is the limit and to reach the sky, the rocket needs fuel. 

We invested our savings in the capital of the company. Our relatives had been kindly invited to reinforce our equity. We’re in the process of receiving a loan from a public bank (France loves public money involvement). Nevertheless, our needs match our ambitions and we surely share them with you : 

“to be a Man is, precisely, to be responsible… It is to feel when setting one’s stone, that one is contributing to the building of the world”. - Antoine de Saint-Exupery in Wind, Sand and Stars.

Our relatives had been kindly invited to reinforce our equity. We’re in the process of receiving a loan from a public bank (France loves public money involvement). Nevertheless, our needs match our ambitions and we surely share them with you : “to be a Man is, precisely, to be responsible… It is to feel when setting one’s stone, that one is contributing to the building of the world”. - Antoine de Saint-Exupery in Wind, Sand and Stars.

story:
Travelling by bike is the most sustainable and empowering way to explore the world. Todos en Bici is an inclusive community that is committed to making bike-based exploration accessible to everyone. In December a group of 20 bikers of all ages and abilities-- young folks, old folks, cyclists with many years of experience, new bikers, people with disabilities, blind riders, and deaf riders​-- will embark on a 1,300 km bicycle journey across the Baja California desert. We will travel from town to town sharing our stories with each other and with the people that we meet. We will film our journey, creating an experimental documentary that inspires others to explore their world through cycling. Our journey takes place December 27, 2015 - January 12, 2016.


Viajar en bicicleta es la forma más sostenible y abierta de explorar el mundo. Todos en Bici es un proyecto incluyente que se ha comprometido en poner la exploración en bici al alcance de todos. En diciembre, un grupo de 20 ciclistas de todas las edades y capacidades--personas jóvenes, ancianos, ciclistas con muchos años de experiencia, nuevos ciclistas, personas con discapacidades, personas ciegas y sordas-- se embarcará en un viaje de 1.300 kilómetros a través del desierto de Baja California. Vamos a viajar de pueblito a pueblito compartiendo nuestras historias en grupo y con las personas que iremos conociendo en el camino. Vamos a filmar nuestro viaje para hacer un documental experimental que inspirará a otros a explorar su mundo a través del ciclismo. Nuestro viaje empieza el 27 de diciembre 2015 y viajaremos hasta el 13 de enero de 2016.





RIDERS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES:  We are an inclusive group of riders, all with unique abilities and perspectives. Our group includes passionate people of all kinds--young folks, old folks, cyclists with many years of experience, new bikers, people with disabilities, blind riders, and deaf riders.

CICLISTAS DE TODAS EDADES Y CAPACIDADES: Somos un grupo incluyente, compuesto de participantes con habilidades y perspectivas distintas. Nuestro grupo incluye gente apasionada de todo tipo--personas jóvenes, ancianos, ciclistas con muchos años de experiencia, nuevos ciclistas, personas con discapacidades, personas ciegas y sordas.

RIDING IN PAIRS: Because of our varying abilities and levels of experience, we ride in pairs to create supportive partnerships within our group. Each partnership consists of an experienced cyclist with someone who is new to this type of adventure. Some pairs ride on individual bikes, others on tandems and specially adapted bicycles.

RODANDO EN PAREJAS: Debido a nuestras diferentes capacidades y niveles de experiencia, nos organizamos en parejas para crear asociaciones de apoyo dentro de nuestro grupo. Cada asociación se compone de un ciclista con experiencia con alguien quien es nuevo en este tipo de aventura y necesita el apoyo para cumplirla. Algunas parejas se moverán en bicicletas individuales, otros en tándems y bicicletas adaptadas para necesidades especiales.

THE JOURNEY: Our journey begins in Ensenada, Mexico and follows Highway 1 as it travels south from ocean to sea, cutting across hundreds of kilometers of desert valley and mountains. The route is home to dozens of small fishing and farming towns separated by many kilometers of vast desert. We will camp in towns, beaches, and desert wilderness, every night making home in a new place. Our journey ends on the sea of Cortez in the city of La Paz. 

LA RUTA: Nuestro viaje comienza en Ensenada, México y sigue la Carretera 1 desde el océano al mar, cortando a través de cientos de kilómetros de valles y montañas. La ruta es el hogar de decenas de pueblitos pesqueros y agrícolas separados por muchos kilómetros de desierto extenso. Vamos a acampar en las ciudades, playas, y el desierto. Cada noche hacemos nuestra casa en un nuevo lugar. Nuestro viaje termina en el mar de Cortés en la ciudad de La Paz .

BIKING FROM TOWN TO TOWN: We will spend our days biking between towns. Winter weather in Baja is perfect for biking: dry, cool and sunny. In the mornings we will have breakfast at camp. After packing up our camp we will hit road. Daily rides will range from 50 km to 140 km. While on the road we will ride as a group, occasionally stopping rest and gaze out into the desert and ocean. Before sunset, we will arrive at our destination for the evening and set up camp once again.

RODANDO DE PUEBLITO A PUEBLITO: Vamos a pasar nuestros días andando en bicicleta entre los destinos. El clima de invierno en Baja es perfecto para el ciclismo: seco, fresco, y soleado. Por la mañana desayunamos en el campamento. Después de empacar, vamos a salir por la carretera. Los paseos diarios son de 50 km a 140 km. En el camino vamos a andar como un grupo, parándonos de vez en cuando para descansar, comer, y apreciar el desierto y el océano. Antes del atardecer, llegaremos a nuestro destino para hacer nuestro campamento, una vez más.​​

CAMPING IN THE TOWNS: COMMUNITY NIGHTS: Most days we will end our daily journey in a small town or city. We will set up our camp at community centers, schools, churches, parks, and other places depending on the town. During these community nights, we will host cultural sharing events and meals. We will have the opportunity to share our stories and perspectives with the people of the town. We will introduce people to the joy of bicycle travel.

ACAMPANDO EN PUEBLITOS: NOCHES COMUNITARIAS: La mayoría de los días vamos a terminar nuestra jornada diaria en un pequeño pueblito o ciudad. Vamos a establecer nuestro campamento en centros comunitarios, escuelas, iglesias, parques y otros lugares dependiendo de la localidad. Durante estas noches en las comunidades, vamos a organizar eventos de intercambio cultural. Tendremos la oportunidad de compartir nuestras historias y perspectivas con la gente de la ciudad. Vamos a introducir a la gente a la alegría de los viajes en bicicleta.​​​

CAMPING IN THE WILDERNESS: RETREAT NIGHTS: Several nights we will camp outside of towns in the mountains, valleys, or on beaches. There we will have the opportunity to share more intimately among each other. During these retreat nights pairs will host different activities, and we will cook and eat together under the stars. 

ACAMPANDO EN EL DESIERTO: NOCHES DE RETIRO: ​Varias noches acamparemos fuera de las ciudades en las montañas, valles, o en las playas. Asi, vamos a tener la oportunidad de compartir más íntimamente entre nosotros. Durante estas noches de retiro pares guiarán diferentes actividades. Vamos a cocinar y comer juntos bajo las estrellas.

FILMING OUR STORY: We will share our story with people across the world. Our documentary is a rich and intimate research experiment in storytelling whose ultimate goal is to inspire empathy and imagination. The goal is to expose people to the transformative nature of bicycle travel and to explore the ways in which the bicycle can be made accessible to everyone. In addition to our main camera, we will have a collective camera. Each pair will have the opportunity to film for a day, sharing their perspective of their personal journey. 

FILMANDO LA HISTORIA: Vamos a compartir nuestra historia con gente de todo el mundo. Nuestro documental es un íntimo experimento de investigación narrativa cuyo objetivo final es inspirar la empatía y la imaginación . El objetivo es exponer el poder transformador de los viajes en bicicleta y explorar las formas en que la bicicleta puede hacer accesible para todos. Además de nuestra cámara principal, tendremos una cámara colectiva. Cada pareja tendrá la oportunidad de filmar durante un día, compartiendo la perspectiva de su viaje.​

Putting together all of our individual kilometers, participants in Todos En Bici will ride a combined 27,000 km in 15 days. Help us by sponsoring kilometers. Every kilometer counts! Check out the ways to give and what we in turn give back to you!

La suma de todos nuestros kilómetros individuales es un total combinado de 27.000 km en 15 días. Ayúdanos patrocinando kilómetros. Cada kilómetro es importante! Echa un vistazo a las formas de contribución y tus posibles recompensas!

(Hand-made journals from Mexico City)
(Diarios hecho a mano en la Ciudad de México )

 Todos en Bici mini journal / Un  mini diario de Todos en Bici

 Todos en Bici journal / Un  diario de Todos en Bici

 Your logo in the documentary / Tu logo en el documental

 Your logo or message on the jersey /  Tu logo o mensaje en la playera

  Viewing party for the documentary / Fiesta para ver el documental


DONATE: We are a community-funded organization. Through crowdfunding, we connect with friends from across the country and the world that choose to support our mission of making bicycle-based exploration accessible to everyone. Donate to Todos en Bici to help support our food and travel costs. As creative folks, we offer various ways to graciously thank you for your support. 

DONAR: Somos una organización financiada por la comunidad. A través de crowdfunding, nos conectamos con amigos de todo el país y el mundo que eligen apoyar nuestra misión de hacer la exploración en bicicleta al alcance de todos. Donar a Todos en Bici nos ayuda a asumir nuestros costos de alimentos y de viaje. Como personas creativas, te ofrecemos diversas maneras de darte las gracias por tu apoyo. 


RIDE: We are looking for people of all ages, abilities, and levels of experience that have the desire to join us on the journey. All interested are encouraged to apply. Once we have established our group, we will pair riders together to form supportive partnerships. We will work with local bike shops and organizations to develop the best bicycle or pairing of bikes for each pair.  Riders do not pay to participate but must help with our fundraising efforts to cover our daily costs.

RODAR: Estamos buscando a gente de todas las edades, capacidades y niveles de experiencia que tienen el deseo de unirse a nosotros en el viaje. Se alienta a todos los interesados ​​a aplicar. Una vez que hemos establecido nuestro grupo, vamos a formar parejas que serán las asociaciones de apoyo. Vamos a trabajar con varios talleres y organizaciones de bicicletas locales para desarrollar los mejores equipos de bicicletas para cada par. Los participantes no pagan para participar, pero es muy importante que deben ayudar con nuestros esfuerzos de recaudación de fondos para cubrir nuestros gastos diarios.



SHARE: There are many ways to help support Todos en Bici. We are looking to borrow equipment. Sharing your resources with us for three weeks will help make our journey possible. After we are done, we will gratefully return it to you. If you have any of the following and would like to lend it to Todos En Bici, please let us know:
  • Camping gear (tents, stove, cooking gear, sleeping bags, flashlights)
  • Bike gear (pumps, basic tools, tires)

COMPARTIR: Hay muchas maneras de ayudar a Todos en Bici. Estamos buscando préstamos de equipo. Compartir tus recursos con nosotros durante tres semanas ayudará a que nuestro viaje sea posible. Después de que hayamos terminado, te devolveremos todo con gratitud. Si tienes cualquiera de los siguientes y deseas prestarlo a Todos en Bici, por favor déjanoslo saber :
  • Equipo de acampar (carpas, estufa, utensilios de cocina, bolsas de dormir, linternas)
  • Equipo de ciclismo (bombas de aire, herramientas básicas, llantas, cámaras)

Visit us at http://www.en-bici.com/todos.html

Visitanos a http://www.en-bici.com/todos.html

story:
Restoration of Rocky Ridge Trail:  We are seeking funds to help restore and create trails on Rocky Ridge Farm.  These trails will offer visitors a walk through history, experiencing the "Pathways to the Past" that Laura, Almanzo, and Rose used to walk from the Farm House to the Rock House and NOW including the new museum.  
    Now a few words from our Director:

    You may have noticed that we are in the process of building a new Museum that is set to open March of 2016.

    Many of our visitors inquire about walking the path to the Rock House, as you may remember, this path has been closed due to a much needed restoration.  There is also a need for a walking path from the new museum to the Historic Farm House.  The funds raised here would also cover the cost of paving the parking area.

    We have undertaken a Fund Raising effort to make "Laura's Paths" a reality.  Please feel free to forward this to anyone interested in helping us with the  fund raising project.

    Sincerely,

    Jean Coday

    Director of the Laura Ingalls Wilder Home and Museum

    Mansfield, MO
story_txt:
Restoration of Rocky Ridge Trail:  We are seeking funds to help restore and create trails on Rocky Ridge Farm.  These trails will offer visitors a walk through history, experiencing the "Pathways to the Past" that Laura, Almanzo, and Rose used to walk from the Farm House to the Rock House and NOW including the new museum.  
Now a few words from our Director:

You may have noticed that we are in the process of building a new Museum that is set to open March of 2016.
Many of our visitors inquire about walking the path to the Rock House, as you may remember, this path has been closed due to a much needed restoration.  There is also a need for a walking path from the new museum to the Historic Farm House.  The funds raised here would also cover the cost of paving the parking area.
We have undertaken a Fund Raising effort to make "Laura's Paths" a reality.  Please feel free to forward this to anyone interested in helping us with the  fund raising project.
Sincerely,
Jean Coday
Director of the Laura Ingalls Wilder Home and Museum
Mansfield, MO

story:
smALBANY Businesses Need Your Help!

Nestled between the corners of Emeryville and Berkeley, you’ll find Albany, the Urban Village by the Bay. Home to over 18,500 people, this bustling little town, endearingly called “smALBANY,” has over the course of it’s 112 year history has stimulated it’s local economy with many independently owned and operated businesses, providing not just exceptional and diverse goods and services but also providing it’s immediate Bay Area communities with job opportunities that promote the growth of the area. 

Within Albany’s 5 mile radius, you will find every industry from retail spaces, cultural centers, food and beverage establishments, the heart and soul of these businesses residing on Solano Ave and San Pablo Avenue. Unfortunately, as with many communities nationwide, Albany small businesses are in need of a financial support system to sustain themselves while they have been encouraged to close their businesses to prevent the spread of the novel COVID-19 virus. 

While there are some relief loans and funds becoming available for small businesses throughout the country to help them along while we all do our part to derail this pandemic, all of these and other forms of aid are being sought after in unparalleled numbers. Not only are these relief efforts going to be exhausted to their fullest potential, the businesses receiving these aids may not have access to this aid for months, ultimately forcing a lot of beloved small businesses to shutter and causing an onslaught of hardships to the folks who work there. To combat this fate for their community, Scott and Vonnie Davidson of local brewery Ocean View Brew Works have organized this fundraising campaign to protect their vibrant business district and those who are employed at these establishments; they are calling upon our communities near and far to help in this endeavor with monetary donations and sharing this campaign to our networks, all proceeds going to Albany businesses needing immediate support. Using an application process for businesses to receive aid designed and managed by Working Solutions, they are hoping the funds raised will support the livelihoods of those with varying needs working in the community, the total sum of what will be raised being the determining factor in how aid can be distributed. 

Collaborating with other businesses, Scott and Vonnie have rounded up a group of their business neighbors to offer amazing rewards for your contributions and efforts. Every little bit helps– every donation or shared link is no small a gesture to preserve the spirit of Albany. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are not just asking for contributions we are offering some AMAZING incentives. 

  • Surprise gifts from local businesses: flowers, coffee, toys, all things ALBANY!
  • Limited barrel-aged bottle voucher of Buffalo Dreams Imperial Stout collaboration with Ledger's Liquors 
  • Beer for Life Membership from Ocean View Brew Works
  • A sense of Albany pride! 

 

Businesses Contributing Perks to this Cause

Ocean View Brew Works, Highwire Coffee, Armada Swim, Umami Interiors, Momo’s Flowers, Sam’s Log Cabin, Andra Weber, The Ivy Room, Abrams Claghorn Gallery, Fonda, Raven & Rose Hair Salon, Oaktown Spice Shop, Morningtide Shop, Opalene Skin Care, Albany Sauna

 

The Impact

The ability to help our neighborhood businesses is in your hands:

  • Government assistance takes time
  • Small businesses are doing everything they can to adjust and try to stay afloat
  • Many businesses will still owe back rent upon re-opening and make purchases to restart.
  • "Business Interruption Insurance" currently does not cover mandated closures 
  • Remember all of the generous donations local businesses give without a question when fundraisers are in need. Now, those same businesses need your generosity. 

Risks & Challenges

We are all facing new hardships with an uncertain future:

  • Please give what you are able to keep your local businesses afloat during these difficult times.
  • We are new to doing something at this level, but we know that this will help our community if we are able to meet or exceed our goal.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give financially:

  • Share this campaign on social media, through email, phone a friend, yell it from 6 feet away!

story:
4th Annual Fresh Jamz on the Lake 

What’s more fun than an Oakland day party in the summer? With sun rays beaming, cool drinks flowing, fresh sounds bumpin’, and the Fresh Jamz flavor, we don’t think anything is better! So, we’re bringing you the 4th annual Fresh Jamz on the Lake on Saturday, July 29 from 1-5pm.

 

We need the community partnership and spirit to make to this family-friendly party dope. So we’re asking folks to chip in (even if it’s a few bucks) to support our djs, help cover the cost of permits, and get some food and drank to share.

 

We are humbly grateful. See you July 29th!

DJ Odiaka and the Fresh Jamz crew

Here are the hot new summer Fresh Jamz t-shirts

story:
Hi, I'm Christina.

I received my Doctorate of Naturopathy (ND) from the accredited National University of Natural Medicine in Portland, Oregon in 2013.  After studying tropical medicine at Johns Hopkins' School of Public Health, I backpacked through Latin America, completed Yoga Alliance teacher certification, and graduated the Maui School of Therapeutic Massage.  It felt good to return to my home and plant roots in the Lone Star State two years ago.  

A month ago, I had tea with a dear friend and fabulous artist at a quaint bistro in central Austin.  No longer nomads, yet not quite fitting in, we voiced wishes for a place to call home and manifest lifelong visions.  Like a dream come true, we noticed a perfectly beautiful cottage exactly across the street with a small sign reading "For Rent."  

Of course, we scheduled an appointment to see the space that evening, and immediately fell in love!  I wrote a 30-day notice to the medical office building where I was struggling to carve out a practice, gathered every imaginable resource, built a website, and have found an incredible team of contributing artists and teachers to co-create and heal together, as a community.

With your help, this will become an outstanding interdisciplinary wellness center and gallery space where Austin artisans will be showcased, healing bodywork available daily, and a portion of all incoming funds donated to local charity every month.  

The magnitude of what your financial contribution will help us achieve is undeniable.  

 

What We Need 

Right now, we've signed on the deal and are in the process of purchasing all necessary equipment and services.  This can be overwhelming for a brand new small business with zero start-up funds (*That's where you come in!).  These are a few expenses to be expected this month:

  • Security Deposit + Commercial Monthly Lease
  • Utilities + Deposit (gas, electric, water, trash, recycling, etc)
  • Renter's Insurance Coverage
  • Internet/WiFi Installation
  • Security/Alarm System Activation
  • Business Registration with the State + City
  • Professional Eco-Friendly + Non-Toxic Cleaning Service
  • House Cleaning Supplies (for kitchen, bathroom, wooden floors, etc)
  • Curtains + Blinds Throughout
  • Art Gallery Tracklights + Hanging Support
  • Energy Star Super Efficient Compact Refrigerator
  • Trash Cans, Recycle Bins + Bags 
  • Recycled Paper Towels + TP
  • Massage Table + Linens
  • Yoga Supplies (mats, blocks, cleaners)
  • Essential Oils + Diffusers
  • Bulletin Board + Markers
  • Bookshelf
  • Fire Extinguishers
  • Equipment for Teaching Kitchen (blender, burner, juicer)
  • Tea Kettle + Tea for Visitors
  • Doormats + Rugs
  • Tablecloths
  • Co-Working Desk
  • Filing Cabinet
  • Printer
  • Garden Supplies
  • Rainwater Catchment Barrel 

If we don't reach our entire goal, that's okay.  We'll still receive some funding (every little bit counts!) and promise to allocate the designated portion to a local charitable organization, to be announced at the Grand Opening on 22 September. 

 

A butterfly's wings can be felt across the Universe... 

This project is not only valuable to us here at Kerbey Lane Healing Arts, it will have a positive impact on the local community, which will in turn create a wave of wellness extending throughout our nation and across the globe.  People who feel better tend to be more kind, compassionate, and productive.  Be the Change.  

 

Your Unique Perks

Read ahead to the next section for more details about exciting perks (like personalized art or therapeutic massage) we offer as a way to say THANK YOU, from the bottom of our hearts. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Join our mailing list for updates on exclusive specials and events!   :o)

 

With Sincere Gratitude,  

NAMASTE.

story:
ABOUT

Pearl Trek Adventures is the first mobile extreme sporting company in Uganda. We deliver a family-friendly outdoor recreational experience to those in the Greater Kampala Metropolitan Area. Some of the action-packed activities we offer include Inline skating, Extreme pogo, Mobile rock climbing, Bungee trampolines, Hoverboarding, and Zorbing.

 

The Campaign and its Significance

While communication devices such as cell phones, tablets, and computers have helped Ugandans interact with people all over the world, some of the downsides of an increasing amount of screen time include sedentary indoor lifestyles and lack of personal connections.

Pearl Trek Adventures answers these deficiencies by providing a wholesome, invigorating new way for families and youth to get outside and reconnect with each other face-to-face. Innovative recreational fitness not only strengthens bodies, it builds healthier communities and provide jobs, reducing boredom-based petty crimes among the youth.

With its mobile approach, Pearl Trek Adventures can be easily set up in open areas such as fields and parking lots. This facilitates access to a myriad of demographics from business executives looking for a team building experience, to families desiring something fun to do on a weekend, to an enhanced field day opportunity to help schools or institutions celebrate the end of the school year or semester.

 

 

What Contributions Will Enable Us To Accomplish

Pearl Trek Adventures is the first provider of mobile extreme sporting activities in Uganda. We are seeking to raise $25000 in start up funding to enable us to;

  • secure equipment for our four flagship sporting activities which will cost approximately $12000,
  • acquire permits and licenses which will cost approximately $4000 for the year,
  • carry out an extensive advertising and marketing campaign to grow brand awareness which will cost approximately $3000,
  • train more personnel that will help us in running the activities and all this will set us up to launch by April 2018.

Some of the equipment we are looking to purchase include; inline skates, extreme pogo sticks, hoverboards, zorb balls, power jumps' shoes, bungee trampolines among others. We intend to target shopping centres with ample parking space and play area for children, churches, schools, resorts and hotels, beaches, camping sites and local events.

 

Our marketing will feature social media campaigns, printed material placed with partner businesses, and branded materials such as wrist bands, t-shirts, calendars with images from activities, water bottles among others.

 

Our long term goal is to become a destination venue in about 3 years after we launch, as we desire to scale from simple basic ground activities to more extreme sporting activities and water sports.

What You Get For Helping Us

These are our offerings

$15      - Thank you

$50   - Wrist band & T-Shirt (PTA i helped fund this place……...)

$100   - Customized video

$300 -Calendar collection of photos of events and updates + Customized PTA water bottles & skype call with the Team at Pearl Trek

$ 500 -Listed on Pearl Trek Website as funder and also have your name inscribed on a plaque when we finally launch in 2018

$1000 -Customized African print apparel and bag with PTA logo

When We Hit The Target

When we reach our financial goals the funds raised will go into purchasing equipment (Inline skates, Hoverboards, Zorb Balls, and Pogo Sticks), securing operation permits, licenses, and insurance,  and meeting the operation costs.

Exceeding our funding target means we can scale better by increasing the number of sporting equipment and activities. It also means we are able to reach our market faster and wider by partnering with more businesses for locations.

What Motivates Us ?. . . The Impact!

"It takes a whole village to raise a child." -West African Proverb. This culture does not happen anymore in this text, tweet, twerk gadget era!

Currently in Uganda, there are limited outdoor sporting activities for families to engage in which partly explains;

  • the growing crime rate,
  • drug abuse,
  • gambling,
  • alcoholism and
  • antisocial behaviour between the youth and their peers as well as their families.

In addition the available places for families to enjoy outdoor activities are out of the city. Therefore in addition to the monotonous activities provided at these three places and exorbitant prices charged, people have to factor in travel expenses to get to these places.

Pearl Trek Adventures exists to provide a variety of new healthy, wholesome and constructive entertainment for these young people to enable them to bond with their families and peers. Instead of spending their time on gadgets or indulging in activities that might get them  into trouble, we will engage them in team-building fun activities with family and peers to help them grow in individual strengths and communication among other aspects, which will cater to their mental, social and spiritual growth into responsible and productive citizens.

Many of these children cannot even afford their own individual skates, so you find two children owning one pair of skates and they use that one shoe to make a living. We want to also change that.

In so doing we'll be able to restore and instill the long forgotten village culture in the youth which is partly attributed to the improvement in and ease of access to technology.

Risks & Challenges

Because we are a start up company,  the nature of our company will raise a few concerns with regards to safety of participants in the activities. How can we vouch for the safety of what we want to provide compared to our competitors who have been around and running for sometime and have therefore built that trust in their brand?

Another challenge is the strong need to secure enough funds to enable us to start up, carry out an extensive marketing campaign and all the costs attached to these activities. Should this happen, we might not see profits within the first year but we believe we will break even within the second year of operation.

We have created a strategy that counters this problem by starting with four activities that require fewer equipment while providing four revenue streams.

Thirdly, when we become profitable, we will meet fierce competition. Many businesses in Uganda tend to straddle ideas from other businesses. Even our first-mover advantage will not help if we do not start big and fast.

WE Believe We Can. Why?

Among our highest expenses is the aspect of insurance. Companies that run the nature of our activities invest a lot in insurance premiums because of the risks associated with these activities.

We will be hiring trained and skilled personnel for the first three months who are familiar with these activities and have run them before. This will help us to minimise or, even better, eradicate risk of injury or litigation that might arise from people partaking in these activities.

We have also been blessed with a strong formidable team to oversee the leadership and management of the company.

 

And therefore all team members bring with them a vast amount of knowledge and experience to help the company overcome its many challenges. Along with strategic partnerships with key resorts and hotels and shopping centers, this will help us put the word out there regarding the company.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate everyone who has taken the time off to read our story and fund its realization. However, you can also;

*spread the word with as many of your contacts and help us achieve our goal to bring this village culture back to our increasingly socially disconnected youth by investing in and building Pearl Trek Adventures with us. Outdoor recreation is indeed the 21st Century Global Village culture

*If you know someone who knows someone who can help us find and/or fund some equipment, we would be very grateful.

*Above all, pray for the leadership and management of Pearl Trek Adventures as we steward and uphold the vision and mission God has placed in our hearts as a company.

Follow us on our social media pages and help us tell the story.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pearltrekadventures/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ptaextremexp

Website: https://www.pearltrekadventures.com

TEAM

Again we have seven members on our team.

Lucy Isoke Marunga,  the CEO/MD, is a trained lawyer and currently pursuing a Postgraduate Diploma in Business Administration at the African Business Institute, the birthplace of Pearl Trek Adventures.

We also have Joshua Agonya, the Deputy MD and Chief Finance Officer (CFO) who is also a student at African Business Institute and working closely with Lucy to establish the company.

The other four members of the team are;

Jun Shiomitsu, President and Founder African Business Institute and Ideologie International who also doubles as Chief Strategy Officer (CSO) and consultant for Pearl Trek. 

Manzi Junior who will be Director Operations and also in charge of Marketing and Sales, and finally Marcelo Vieira, who is a Consultant for Pearl Trek. 

We also have two trainers Nathan Wambuga and Laugie Eddie working behind the scenes as part of the team.

This will help us to minimise or, even better, eradicate risk of injury or litigation that might arise from people partaking in these activities.We have also been blessed with a strong formidable team to oversee the leadership and management of the company. And therefore all team members bring with them a vast amount of knowledge and experience to help the company overcome its many challenges. Along with strategic partnerships with key resorts and hotels and shopping centers, this will help us put the word out there regarding the company.Other Ways You Can HelpWe appreciate everyone who has taken the time off to read our story and fund its realization. However, you can also;*spread the word with as many of your contacts and help us achieve our goal to bring this village culture back to our increasingly socially disconnected youth by investing in and building Pearl Trek Adventures with us. Outdoor recreation is indeed the 21st Century Global Village culture*If you know someone who knows someone who can help us find and/or fund some equipment, we would be very grateful.*Above all, pray for the leadership and management of Pearl Trek Adventures as we steward and uphold the vision and mission God has placed in our hearts as a company.Follow us on our social media pages and help us tell the story.Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pearltrekadventures/Twitter: https://twitter.com/ptaextremexpWebsite: https://www.pearltrekadventures.comTEAMAgain we have seven members on our team.Lucy Isoke Marunga,  the CEO/MD, is a trained lawyer and currently pursuing a Postgraduate Diploma in Business Administration at the African Business Institute, the birthplace of Pearl Trek Adventures.We also have Joshua Agonya, the Deputy MD and Chief Finance Officer (CFO) who is also a student at African Business Institute and working closely with Lucy to establish the company.The other four members of the team are;Jun Shiomitsu, President and Founder African Business Institute and Ideologie International who also doubles as Chief Strategy Officer (CSO) and consultant for Pearl Trek. Manzi Junior who will be Director Operations and also in charge of Marketing and Sales, and finally Marcelo Vieira, who is a Consultant for Pearl Trek. We also have two trainers Nathan Wambuga and Laugie Eddie working behind the scenes as part of the team.

story:
Our Story

Hey, y’all! I'm Krystal Casey and I have a BIG vision! I'm on a mission to connect and empower women in our local communities through music, movement and meditation by introducing a new Dance & Wellness Center for Women - The ADM Studios! 

Why We Need The ADM Studios

How many times have you been wanting to get out of the house, but find yourself with nowhere to go? Let’s face it: life gets rough for all of us at times. Between caring for your spouse and/or your kids, work, school, balancing the household and the 243 other things on your list every day, it can feel downright impossible at times. Too many women are lonely, unhappy, and looking for answers in all the wrong places: social media, local gossip, addiction, extramarital affairs, politics, perfectionism, busyness... Yet, we often neglect ourselves - the one thing we need most to keep everything else going! (How ironic.)

But how can we do better if we didn’t live better? Learn better? If we, ourselves, were victims of a harmful cycle and never learned how to love and care for ourselves? Many women suffer with anxiety, depression or PTSD from childhood and are put on strong prescription medications, often with uncomfortable or harmful side effects. But they aren't told that the bottle of pills and weekly therapy appointments aren't enough, nor are they offered additional resources for wellness.

We know that human connection is essential to optimal wellness and that people who practice regular self-care live happier, healthier lives. But where do we make these friends?

Where do we go when we live in a constant swirl of bottles and diapers and runny noses and skinned knees and busy schedules…? Who can we turn to if we have little to no family or friends available and we just need someone to hold the baby for an hour... Or to talk with someone about anything above preschool level...  Or to take 30 minutes of quiet to just breathe or read a book or dance our hearts out to our favorite song!?

How do we get and stay healthy when we can’t justify the cost of babysitting, combined with the price of gyms (and the fact that we just don’t enjoy traditional workouts)? Or if we don’t even realize just how much food and exercise impact our feelings? Or if we never learned healthy ways to release unhealthy emotions?

What We Do at The ADM Studios

My vision (and the goal of this project) is to create a comfortable and inviting space where women can come to fulfill all of these needs and more! A place where ladies can drop by for a fun fitness class at their convenience, hold a family event they can actually afford, or spend time regularly practicing self care with a community of women just like themselves. A community where women are empowered to see the best in themselves, break the destructive cycles of their past, and build the lives of their dreams.

No treadmills. No scales. No judgment.

The American Dream Makers (aka The ADM Studios) will include:

  • Dance/Fitness Classes
    • Fit Club
    • Aerial Yoga, Trauma Yoga, Mom & Me Yoga
    • Fun & Flirty Fitness for Women
    • Guided Meditation & Reiki 
    • Couple’s Dance
    • Zumbini
    • Beachbody LIVE! Classes: Country Heat / CIZE / PiYo
  • Workshops
    • Self-help/Life Planning and Inspiration
    • Women’s Empowerment/Marriage/Parenting
    • Motivational speakers with Q&A Session
    • Hands-on activities and social hours
    • Resources to take home
  • Special Events
    • Vendor fairs
    • Creative competitions
    • Arts Festival
    • Moms/Couples Nights Out
    • Swap Meets
    • Small business marketing events
    • Fundraisers
  • Private Events & Custom Event Planning
    • Birthday/Anniversary/Graduation parties
    • Bachelorette parties
    • Bridal/baby showers
    • Wedding party package*
    • Team meetings
    • Company events
    • Fundraisers
    • Retreats
  • Optional Club Membership (monthly/annual)
    • A set # of discounted classes per month – any class, any time
    • Discounted or free weekly classes (select class times)
    • Free drop-in access & refreshments during lounge open hours
    • Free use of KidSpace
    • Access to online community
    • “First dibs” on ticket sales/best seating at special events
    • Discount on private events
    • Free event tickets for annual members

And more! ....

  • Gift Shop
  • Book/Lunch Club
  • Home of Thrive Mom Local – Oregon, IL
  • Meditation/Meeting Space
  • KidSpace
  • Website, Community Resources & Advocacy Center

You Can Make A Difference

Today we are pre-selling Club Memberships to help raise capital to open The ADM Studios in Oregon, Illinois. With your contribution to this campaign, not only will you get to be part of an incredible movement to inspire positive change in our community, but you'll also help a local family’s dream come true. We are on a mission to empower women to lead healthy, healed and happy lives and The ADM Studios gives us a place to do just that.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for The ADM Studios to open for business, we need $2,500-$5,500 to help cover start-up costs and operating expenses for the first 6 months, such as:

  • Security Deposit, Rent & Utilities
  • Business Insurance
  • Annual License, Certification & Registration Fees
  • Studio/Office Management, & Accounting Software
  • Website & Marketing Expenses
  • Professional Services (i.e. accountant, attorney, etc)
  • Business/Office Supplies
  • Studio Equipment
  • Miscellaneous Business Expenses

For each Pledge of Support, our Backers will receive a special "Perk" from The ADM Studios. Perks describe which Membership or other benefit you are purchasing today and when you can expect to receive it. {Check out what comes in each membership by clicking here. Then, head back to the Home page to Select a Perk or click the pink button below to back our campaign.}

Our Campaign goal of $2,500-$5,000 will help us to get the business up and running. Any funds over this amount will be applied to initial operating costs. In the event that we do not reach this goal by our deadline, we will work to attain funding another way (i.e. traditional lending) so that we may still open the studio as planned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? We've been there; we understand. But we can still use your help!

If you love our idea and want to see The ADM Studios set roots in Oregon, Illinois, please help us get the word out and make some noise about our business!

  • Email or text our campaign link to your family and friends
  • Like and Share our Facebook page 
  • Find and Follow us on Pinterest, Google and YouTube
  • Share our Campaign on Facebook, Twitter & other Social Media
  • Recommend local businesses that may be interested in working together
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for supporting our dream of owning and operating a local small business! The ADM Studios has been in the Planning & Development stages for a number of years now and it is incredibly exciting to be moving ahead! We are looking forward to serving our clients and making a positive difference in our community. Thank you again for being a part of this journey. Please check back often to watch our progress!

“No act of kindness - no matter how small - is ever wasted.” Aesop
