story:
Our story doesn’t begin with a dream to build a brewery. It begins in the 50’s, with a few families that started a community church in south Oak Cliff, and a handful of kids that sprouted out of that experience in the 70’s.

I’m a third-generation Oak Cliff native. My grandfather founded a small church near the corner of Hampton and Illinois, a pretty happening place at the time. El Fenix, Polar Bear Ice Cream, and the old Austin’s Barbeque were all within one block, and I still remember how, as a kid, I’d pass by the Astro Drive-in every day, trying to sneak a peek of the big screen. After college, I moved back to an Oak Cliff that had begun to change. It was a time of transition – the old community spots were closing down, and the heady revitalization of Bishop Arts and resurgence of interest in Oak Cliff had yet to gather momentum. Around that time, I met my lovely wife, another Oak Cliff native. We were married at Kessler Park United Methodist Church in the late 90’s and went off to start our family.

Through various transitions, no matter where we found ourselves living, we never strayed far from our Oak Cliff roots. With the growing development around Bishop Arts, we found ourselves crossing the Trinity less and less often… except when it came to craft breweries. So, in 2015, after about six years of brewing as a hobby, I got together with a few of those kids from the old church, and we decided to launch this brewery. There was never a question of what it would be called, or where it would go. It was always meant to be Oak Cliff Brewing Co.

 

My father and uncles had followed in their father’s footsteps and became pastors, a path some thought I might take as well, but I opened a brewery instead. I didn’t set out or intend to go against the family grain, and I’m still active in my grandfather’s church, but, in searching for my calling, I found myself traversing a surprising and unconventional path.

I’ve spent the past 22 years building a career in software engineering, but I’ve instinctively known that my real calling was in a craft, something that could be shared with others. I dabbled in photography, built a woodworking shop, and in 2009, gave brewing beer a shot. I started sharing what I made with family and friends, and was inspired by the positive feedback. I began entering competitions like Brew Riot and Brewhaha to reach a wider audience and share my craft with more people; when we started picking up awards, I knew that this was what it was all about. I loved the process of brewing beer, but what I loved more than that was bringing people together to enjoy it. 

 

We’re not brewing beer to start a new story. We’re brewing beer to rekindle an old story. Coming home to our roots in Oak Cliff.

This is why an integral part of our company’s mission is to support other missions and organizations working in South Dallas to uplift our community. Our weekly Pint Nights will dedicate $1 of every pint sold in the taproom to a local organization that we’ve partnered with. For our first partnership, we’ve chosen Bonton Farms. In addition to weekly Pint Night proceeds, 10% of the proceeds for this campaign will go directly to Bonton Farms.

Our passion to connect with the community is infused into all that we do. We want to help promote what we think is the best part of Dallas: Dallas’ Left Bank – Blue Collar Dallas – where the heart of the city truly beats. We want to show the world what a hidden gem Oak Cliff is, and bring jobs, events, interest, and a new gathering place for the community. Resisting the tide of big block development, we want to work with you and local entrepreneurs to bring Tyler Station to life as an icon of our history and symbol of our collective future.

 

Beer isn’t something constructed. Beer is the result of what happens when you create the right conditions for the right ingredients to come together, mingle, and flourish. The magic potential is all built into that single grain of barley. Community operates in much the same way. There’s an art to getting those conditions just right, and that’s what we hope to do with the brewery and taproom here at Tyler Station.

The majority of the money raised by this campaign will go into revitalizing this building and opening up the brick walls as much as possible to let light wash through our space, and to visually connect with the DART rail passengers coming and going all day. In keeping with our values to stay true to the historic nature of this industrial site, we will work with our neighbors, Stash Design, to repurpose and upcycle as much of the old equipment and materials as possible to build out the taproom. We believe in the vision and our community, but we're asking for your help to make this vision a reality. We can’t do this alone – and truth be told, we don’t want to. We want to work together with you.

That’s what this campaign is all about. Investing not just in beer, not just in craft, but in a community. In a way of giving back to Oak Cliff, in connecting with our neighbors, in creating memories and shaping a new gathering place for generations to come. In dreaming of the future, and celebrating the history that made us who we are.

We wouldn’t be here without Oak Cliff.

 

We thought of all sorts of cool OCBC apparel and swag we could offer for perks, but when it comes down to it, this campaign is about sharing our craft and our community. We can't imagine a better way of doing that than by offering free beer in our taproom, right in the heart of Oak Cliff. It's a win-win deal, we get funds up front to finish out the taproom, and you get a free beer with every visit for a year or 99 to enjoy in this amazing space once we're open. 

Ok, we couldn't resist, so we went ahead and made this cool 99 Years OCBC Founders tee.  Wear it proudly, and represent as one of the Oak Cliff Brewing Society 99ers!

 

 

Q: What about the beer?

Of course! That's the whole reason we're here! We'll be brewing on two different brewhouses, one is a 30 barrel (7,440 pints) production system, and the other is 3.5 barrel (868 pints) pilot system.  We'll use the production system for the year-round beers that you'll find in bars, restaurants, and stores around DFW – beers like our award-winning Black Lager, our crisp and bright Export Lager, and our assertive Red IPA.

The pilot system will feed the taproom with a constantly rotating set of taps.  It's our playground, where we'll brew everything from a Grapefruit Gose to an Imperial Stout. Maybe we'll do a Neighborhood IPA Series, where we feature a different variety of hop for different OC neighborhoods. We'll definitely brew the seasonals, like Saisons, Hefeweizens, Oktoberfests and Winter Warmers – some in the traditional style, and some with a twist. Our goal with the pilot system is that every time you visit, there'll be something new to try.

Q: But is the beer going to be any good?

Great question! We think you're going to love it, but for some more objective feedback, here are a few awards we've recently won at homebrewing festivals and competitions:

Brew Riot - May 2016

  • Best Overall - Lager - Black Lager
  • 1st Place - English Style ESB - Dogcatcher ESB
  • 3rd Place - European Pilsner - Export Lager

Bluebonnet Brew-Off - February 2017

  • 2nd Place - Fruit Beer - Grapefruit Gose

Brewhaha - May 2017

  • Peoples Choice (crowd favorite team)
  • Best Overall - Lager - Black Lager
  • 2nd Place - Lager - Export Lager
  • 2nd Place - IPA - Red IPA
  • 3rd Place - Ale - Imperial Stout

We don't take our entry into the DFW craft beer market lightly. There are some amazing beers being brewed in the area, and we want to ensure that the beers we're bringing to market will only strengthen the reputation of craft brewing in North Texas.

Q: Can you tell me more about Bonton Farms?

Bonton Farms works in a South Dallas community just a little ways east of us that’s classified as a food desert. Their work in strengthening community bonds, growing healthy food, providing jobs and job training, and so much more is best summed in their mission to restore lives and ignite hope. If you'd like to dig further into the great work they're doing here in South Dallas, or even get your own hands dirty helping out, be sure to look them up at bontonfarms.org. 

Q: What's with the one-per-day limit on my free beer?

Texas law explicitly forbids any deals or promotions that encourage excessive consumption, so to steer far clear of that we'll only be able to pour one free pint per day.  Always drink responsibly!

Q: Is the free beer always a pint?

Taproom pints will be 16-ounce pours, though the 99-year tankards hold closer to 20 ounces. For most beers, that'll be your daily free pour. For higher gravity, barrel aged, or specialty beers that we serve in smaller portions, you'll have the option to exchange one of your free pint or tankard fills for one of these smaller portion beers.

Q: When does my membership begin and the free beer start flowing?

Memberships in the Oak Cliff Brewing Society will begin the day of our public grand opening. We're shooting for March on that, but it's subject to change by a month or so.

Q: Is the membership transferrable, either the annual or the 99-year one?

We can do a one-time transfer of your membership to someone else, but you'll need to contact us to get that approved and done.

Q: Can I bequeath my 99-year membership to someone else in my will?

Beer in your will? What a brilliant idea! Yes, that could count as your one-time transfer.

Q: How will you track my membership?

We'll provide you an Oak Cliff Brewing Society membership card. Show it every time you're in the taproom for your free beer. It's that easy!

Q: Can I take my free beer with me?

As the saying goes... you can't take it with you. All free beers must be consumed on premise in our Oak Cliff taproom.

Q: What does the 99 Year tankard look like?

Here it is from start to finish; in the raw, glazed and waiting to be fired at 2350 F, and the final product.

There's supposedly a short video clip of the pot being formed on the wheel.  We haven't found it yet, but we're pretty sure it plays like the pottery scene from Ghost. 

Q: Can I tank my tankard home with me?

We'd like to keep these all lined up at the brewery, eagerly awaiting your next visit and drawing envious admiration from everyone else, but we'll let you take it home if you like.

Q: What if my one-of-a-kind 99 Year tankard breaks or is lost?

No fear! Our pottery artist, Oak Cliff Pottery, is just down the street from the brewery, so he'll be able to craft you another one.  You'll just need to help with the replacement cost, which is around $50 in current day value... no telling how much it'll be in 99 years with inflation!

Q: What happens on my 99th anniversary in the 99 Year club?

On your 99th anniversary with us, we'll shut down the taproom and throw a massive party for you and 99 of your closest friends!  Then your free beer will expire.

 

While we certainly hope you'll be able to help us out and take advantage of this offering, we know money doesn't grow on trees! If you can't contribute right now, we'd still love your support in getting the word out. Some of the ways you can help us:

  • Tell your family and friends about our campaign.
  • Give our 99 Years of Free Beer a shout out on social media.  You can use the links at the top of the page to share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
  • If you know people, businesses or groups that are interested in Oak Cliff, please reach out and let them know about us.

There’s an art to getting those conditions just right, and that’s what we hope to do with the brewery and taproom here at Tyler Station.
The majority of the money raised by this campaign will go into revitalizing this building and opening up the brick walls as much as possible to let light wash through our space, and to visually connect with the DART rail passengers coming and going all day. In keeping with our values to stay true to the historic nature of this industrial site, we will work with our neighbors, Stash Design, to repurpose and upcycle as much of the old equipment and materials as possible to build out the taproom. We believe in the vision and our community, but we're asking for your help to make this vision a reality. We can’t do this alone – and truth be told, we don’t want to. We want to work together with you.
That’s what this campaign is all about. Investing not just in beer, not just in craft, but in a community. In a way of giving back to Oak Cliff, in connecting with our neighbors, in creating memories and shaping a new gathering place for generations to come. In dreaming of the future, and celebrating the history that made us who we are.
We wouldn’t be here without Oak Cliff.
 

We thought of all sorts of cool OCBC apparel and swag we could offer for perks, but when it comes down to it, this campaign is about sharing our craft and our community. We can't imagine a better way of doing that than by offering free beer in our taproom, right in the heart of Oak Cliff. It's a win-win deal, we get funds up front to finish out the taproom, and you get a free beer with every visit for a year or 99 to enjoy in this amazing space once we're open. 
Ok, we couldn't resist, so we went ahead and made this cool 99 Years OCBC Founders tee.  Wear it proudly, and represent as one of the Oak Cliff Brewing Society 99ers!

 

 

Q: What about the beer?
Of course! That's the whole reason we're here! We'll be brewing on two different brewhouses, one is a 30 barrel (7,440 pints) production system, and the other is 3.5 barrel (868 pints) pilot system.  We'll use the production system for the year-round beers that you'll find in bars, restaurants, and stores around DFW – beers like our award-winning Black Lager, our crisp and bright Export Lager, and our assertive Red IPA.
The pilot system will feed the taproom with a constantly rotating set of taps.  It's our playground, where we'll brew everything from a Grapefruit Gose to an Imperial Stout. Maybe we'll do a Neighborhood IPA Series, where we feature a different variety of hop for different OC neighborhoods. We'll definitely brew the seasonals, like Saisons, Hefeweizens, Oktoberfests and Winter Warmers – some in the traditional style, and some with a twist. Our goal with the pilot system is that every time you visit, there'll be something new to try.
Q: But is the beer going to be any good?
Great question! We think you're going to love it, but for some more objective feedback, here are a few awards we've recently won at homebrewing festivals and competitions:
Brew Riot - May 2016

Best Overall - Lager - Black Lager

1st Place - English Style ESB - Dogcatcher ESB

3rd Place - European Pilsner - Export Lager


Bluebonnet Brew-Off - February 2017
2nd Place - Fruit Beer - Grapefruit Gose

Brewhaha - May 2017

Peoples Choice (crowd favorite team)
Best Overall - Lager - Black Lager

2nd Place - Lager - Export Lager

2nd Place - IPA - Red IPA

3rd Place - Ale - Imperial Stout


We don't take our entry into the DFW craft beer market lightly. There are some amazing beers being brewed in the area, and we want to ensure that the beers we're bringing to market will only strengthen the reputation of craft brewing in North Texas.
Q: Can you tell me more about Bonton Farms?
Bonton Farms works in a South Dallas community just a little ways east of us that’s classified as a food desert. Their work in strengthening community bonds, growing healthy food, providing jobs and job training, and so much more is best summed in their mission to restore lives and ignite hope. If you'd like to dig further into the great work they're doing here in South Dallas, or even get your own hands dirty helping out, be sure to look them up at bontonfarms.org. 
Q: What's with the one-per-day limit on my free beer?
Texas law explicitly forbids any deals or promotions that encourage excessive consumption, so to steer far clear of that we'll only be able to pour one free pint per day.  Always drink responsibly!
Q: Is the free beer always a pint?
Taproom pints will be 16-ounce pours, though the 99-year tankards hold closer to 20 ounces. For most beers, that'll be your daily free pour. For higher gravity, barrel aged, or specialty beers that we serve in smaller portions, you'll have the option to exchange one of your free pint or tankard fills for one of these smaller portion beers.
Q: When does my membership begin and the free beer start flowing?
Memberships in the Oak Cliff Brewing Society will begin the day of our public grand opening. We're shooting for March on that, but it's subject to change by a month or so.
Q: Is the membership transferrable, either the annual or the 99-year one?
We can do a one-time transfer of your membership to someone else, but you'll need to contact us to get that approved and done.
Q: Can I bequeath my 99-year membership to someone else in my will?
Beer in your will? What a brilliant idea! Yes, that could count as your one-time transfer.
Q: How will you track my membership?
We'll provide you an Oak Cliff Brewing Society membership card. Show it every time you're in the taproom for your free beer. It's that easy!
Q: Can I take my free beer with me?
As the saying goes... you can't take it with you. All free beers must be consumed on premise in our Oak Cliff taproom.
Q: What does the 99 Year tankard look like?
Here it is from start to finish; in the raw, glazed and waiting to be fired at 2350 F, and the final product.

There's supposedly a short video clip of the pot being formed on the wheel.  We haven't found it yet, but we're pretty sure it plays like the pottery scene from Ghost. 
Q: Can I tank my tankard home with me?
We'd like to keep these all lined up at the brewery, eagerly awaiting your next visit and drawing envious admiration from everyone else, but we'll let you take it home if you like.
Q: What if my one-of-a-kind 99 Year tankard breaks or is lost?
No fear! Our pottery artist, Oak Cliff Pottery, is just down the street from the brewery, so he'll be able to craft you another one.  You'll just need to help with the replacement cost, which is around $50 in current day value... no telling how much it'll be in 99 years with inflation!
Q: What happens on my 99th anniversary in the 99 Year club?
On your 99th anniversary with us, we'll shut down the taproom and throw a massive party for you and 99 of your closest friends!  Then your free beer will expire.
 

While we certainly hope you'll be able to help us out and take advantage of this offering, we know money doesn't grow on trees! If you can't contribute right now, we'd still love your support in getting the word out. Some of the ways you can help us:


Tell your family and friends about our campaign.

Give our 99 Years of Free Beer a shout out on social media.  You can use the links at the top of the page to share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
If you know people, businesses or groups that are interested in Oak Cliff, please reach out and let them know about us.

story:
Summary

We met and became friends at Luther College in Decorah, IA. That’s where we first started imagining a place where you could go to sip on a beer while you work, study, or read a good book. When we returned to the Twin Cities after graduation and couldn’t find a place like this that already existed, we decided to create it ourselves

Quite simply, Cream & Amber will be a place for those who share our passion for books and beer - that’s why we are so excited to involve all of you in our crowdfunding campaign. Your contributions will help us bring to life a space that blends your favorite coffee shop/bookstore vibes with the community of the craft beer scene. As we bring our vision to life, our commitment to you is to listen, build relationships, and create the space that you want to experience.

Join us and give now to help make Cream & Amber the best space it can possibly be  - cheers to reading, craft beer, and you!

#booksbeerhappiness #creamandamber #bringingpeopletogether #supportlocalbeer #supportlocalbookstores

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our most significant expense in opening Cream & Amber is the design and construction cost associated with building our kitchen and bar space. Our goal with this crowdfunding campaign is to raise $20,000 in order to help cover a portion of these costs. The money you contribute to this campaign will go toward:

  • Architect costs (design and creation of construction documents) - $9,000
  • Kitchen and bar equipment/construction - $8,000
  • Furniture and bookshelves - $3,000

We have several wonderful rewards to share with you when you contribute to our campaign! You can be among the first to use a Cream & Amber pint glass (which comes with a free fill upon opening) or the first to sport a Cream & Amber t-shirt or sweatshirt.

For those that are looking for more than SWAG, we also want to share experiences with you! Our higher level contributors will be invited to an exclusive launch party, get special use of our community room after opening, or become members of our Cream & Amber Collective (free coffee for life!).

That’s not all - keep your eyes peeled for a few surprises as our campaign progresses!

 

The Impact

We want you to feel like you belong when you come into Cream and Amber, whether you are there to socialize or tuck yourself away in the corner with a good book. We plan to make the space inviting, relaxing, and comfortable. Your contributions will help us make this vision a reality, and it will also help ensure that we are meeting all the necessary city, county, and department of health regulations.

We are looking forward to Cream & Amber being a part of the community in Hopkins. We love the people, we love Mainstreet, and we love the feel of the city! We are pretty excited about the potential events and partnerships with other local businesses, and your contributions to our campaign will help ensure that we can build a lasting space and be part of the community for many years to come.

 

Risks & Challenges

You may think we are a little crazy for trying to open a bookstore in this day and age. However, not only are independent bookstores on the rise (Google it if you don’t believe us), but we firmly believe that bookstores are creative spaces that encourage imagination, ingenuity, and learning, and that they will always be an indispensable part of the community.

In addition to selling books, we plan to host events such as author readings, tap takeovers, craft/DIY workshops, and more. Plus, our community room will be the perfect place for you to gather your book club! Although selling books is one of our main focuses, we also envision ourselves as a gathering place, which will help us remain financially viable. And of course, we plan to keep rotating craft beers on tap so that you can come back and try new beers from local breweries!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, or sign up to receive our newsletter.
  • Spread the word! Share our video, Indiegogo page, and social media posts with your friends - convenient sharing links are located in the top right of this page.
  • Look for specific giveaway posts on social media for a chance to win a free book or other prize!
  • Visit us in Hopkins once we’re open.
  • Give us your feedback! What kind of books and beers do you hope to see available at Cream & Amber? We would love to get your input as we work on getting up and running.

Give us your feedback! What kind of books and beers do you hope to see available at Cream & Amber? We would love to get your input as we work on getting up and running.

story:
About Smart Start

Smart Start began as a small company with the intent to help single mothers and low income families afford quality programs that provide practical life education and real world experience. Through the work of several quality educators we have successfully helped children and adults embrace cultural diversity and learn social and life skills. We want to continue to provide these opportunities while we expand our focus into early childhood education. The courses and support of this facility will enable us to help students of all ages develop foundational skills that will empower them to navigate through whatever changes and circumstances life brings.

Our mission:

  • To connect with the community and enrich the lives of the children and families who live there. 
  • To foster an individual connection to a challenging education in all children and families in our care.
  • To establish an all-inclusive education program with extensive special education programs.

These are the current programs we plan to offer:

  • Early childhood education 6 weeks to 12 years of age.
  • Elementary and Middle schools tutoring programs in STEAM areas along with social and life skills.
  • Special education courses - Development, social, physical, and emotional
  • Parent connection classes - Resources to help foster quality family life.
  • We will continue to serve the community with adult classes as well.

After construction of the new location is finished we will once again offer our online classes. We are excited for this opportunity and look forward to the grand opening scheduled for September 2019! This location will support current education programs and the expansion of future community projects.

Join us in this this exciting opportunity to expand education opportunities in Hillsboro Oregon as our first step to better education for all children!

Funding for a physical location and moving from online to brick and mortar. Details you need to know:

  • All funding goes directly to setting up the new location! We are setting up our website for progress reports with pictures and videos for each step of the way!
  • We have donation tiers and thank you gifts for all our investors!
  • Local companies are helping Smart Start with donations of goods and services.
  • When the goal is met a board of our highest donors/contributors will be setup to develop scholarship and community programs to give back.

Smart Start’s Impact

We extend our philosophy to online education, touching and enriching as many children's lives as we can.  We do this here at our new location by providing quality education at affordable prices.  Our online classes allow us to ripple that effect. 

To date we have over 15,000 hours in community and small company development in our community education projects domestically, and 5,000 hours internationally and counting!

Challenges

Smart Start has been non-profit community based for the past ten years. Without steady proven income as a business, funding to expand our programs has proved to be a challenge. This funding will allow us to change our company structure into a for-profit based care program to build funds and opportunities to grow and expand quality education programs. This is where your contribution helps! With this funding we will be able to establish a center that provides early childhood education, creating funding opportunities to support our non-profit community programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who sees this campaign will be able to support us financially. We have many parts to this project and we need talented people who can volunteer their time or talent!

 

Here are ways you can help:

  • Spread the word!
  • Marketing - Advertisement - Flyers - Signs etc.
  • Our logo needs a fresh makeover. Design help would be fantastic!
  • Transportation - Minibuses for after school pick up and community project trips.
  • Childcare furniture donations and set up.
  • General educational supplies.
  • Website design and maintenance.

 

If you do not see your skill set here, but want to be of help please contact us through our FB page.

Please note that we have set up our perks and tiers with location in mind.

LPP = Local Parent Perk    PP= Non-local Parent Perks   SD= Smart Donors (no school aged children)

story:
A Short History

Local Bend resident, Cassie Clemans, opened Roundabout Books in the fall of 2016.  Our first year was a whirlwind of learning and growing as we settled into the Northwest Crossing Community. We're proud to say that in our second year we grew sales by 12%, hosted over 160 events attended by over 1,500 people, welcomed dozens of community groups and clubs to use our space, and donated to more than 24 school groups, community fundraisers, and non-profit organizations. Today we support ten monthly book clubs that are open to the entire community. None of this would be possible without your support. Thank you.

Though Roundabout Books has had a wonderful start, the upfront costs of opening a new bookstore and cafe are considerable, and we're determined to pay off our Small Business Association (SBA) Loan this year.  In order to open the store in 2016, Cassie contributed 50% of the total funding, and obtained an SBA Loan for the other 50%. The loan served it's purpose by helping us finance the bookcases and opening inventory. However, last year 14% of our gross margin earnings were spent on loan repayments, making it one of our three largest expenses. In an industry of razor-thin margins, these payments stifle our ability to grow.

By paying off the loan in 2019, we save over $60K in interest though the term of the loan, we free up much needed monthly cash flow for inventory growth, and we give the store an opportunity to become self-supporting by the end of Year Three.

Breaking it Down

We hope to raise the funds needed to pay off the loan in 2019 through three avenues:

  • 1/3 from an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign running 2/1/19-3/20/19
  • 1/3 from a corporate sponsor who is matching all Indiegogo donations
  • 1/3 from additional principal loan payments in 2019

What You Get

There is a perk for every campaign contribution level, ranging from a free coffee to a lifetime discount at our store, and every donation of $50 or more receives a 25% OFF Purchase coupon. We are also giving away our exclusive Roundabout Books Hydro Flask reusable bottles. In January 2019, we launched a #treadlightly campaign with the goal of eliminating all single use materials from our cafe.  

The Impact

The early years of any small business are critical, and it's incredibly important that we break even this year. We are working on other ways to reduce expenses and grow our sales, but paying off this loan will have an immediate and permanent effect on the future of our bookshop.

Books have small margins, and it takes a lot of book sales each month to meet the expenses of a new brick and mortar shop.  We understand that many people love having our shop in the community but don't normally buy books for their households. We hope that this is an opportunity for you to support our store in a way that is meaningful for you. I cannot think of a more effective way for you to be part of Roundabout's future, and our legacy.  

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in opening a new business, but we've had two years to demonstrate what we can offer this community and how much we are committed to growing here.

We understand that we've set a very big goal, but we believe in it, and one way or another, we will reach it. No matter how much we raise through this Indiegogo campaign, you can feel confident that 100% of your contribution will go towards the SBA loan.  No dollar is wasted. In fact, with our match program every dollar is tripled.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and we completely understand that, but it doesn't mean that you can't help.  Here are some other ways you can support our goal:

  • Introducing our store to new customers is one of the most important ways you can help. It means so much to us when you bring new friends and family by that have never seen our shop.  Word of mouth is the number one way for Roundabout to serve more people.
  • Consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign through your social media channels, with your co-workers, with your family, and any other route open to you. We have 45 Days to raise $40K, and we know that together we can get the information out there and reach our goal.

story:
Colorado Springs is a city that invokes the imagination. With mountains that beckon exploration, weather that changes in the blink of an eye, and a community comprised of people from all over, we think this place is pretty spectacular. And Sasquatch Cookies has something special to offer.

Let’s imagine together: It’s a cold, blustery day in Colorado Springs. The majestic mountains are lightly dusted in snow and the city is quiet as people snuggle up at home, gathering around fires and each other. Suddenly, your doorbell rings. It’s here! The wait is over! You open the door and find… SASQUATCH! He’s standing there, waving and offering you a box of warm, freshly baked cookies made from wholesome, delicious ingredients. It does, indeed, seem that dreams do come true.  

Cookies Delivered

Since 2017, Sasquatch Cookies has connected people through cookies. Whether you're hosting a crowd or having a late-night party for one (who doesn't need a late-night snack sometimes?), we bring cookies to your doorstep, and with them comes surprise and excitement when our big, furry buddy - Sasquatch himself - rings the doorbell. 

For many, Sasquatch is just a myth, but our Colorado community knows he's real. They love him and the cookies he brings. Because of the success and support Sasquatch Cookies has tasted, we're convinced Colorado Springs wants even more of our cookies. A storefront would allow us to increase cookie availability and offer pick-up options in addition to our one-of-a-kind delivery service (which is not going away). 

Sasquatch Needs a Home

We’ve consistently been asked, “Where are you located?” and sadly have had to answer that we don’t have a storefront. We rent a commercial kitchen from another bakery, and thus are only able to offer delivery on limited nights with no option for pick-up.  While our roaming friend, Sasquatch, hasn’t been too discouraged with this natural fact of his life, it has constrained our hours of operation and ability to provide warm, wonderful, deliciousness outside our limited baking hours and delivery radius.

Our Storefront

Sasquatch has for some time now been thinking it’s time to settle down and get his own place. We’ve been scoping retail spaces out in the area and have a found a place to call our own! We're thrilled to announce that we are going to be located in the central part of Colorado Springs near, the Patty Jewett area. We desire to be more than just another bakery or shop, but rather, we will offer a unique atmosphere that unites family and friends around delicious cookies, gives back to the community, and brings a little humor to the world as a  local, Colorado Springs treasure.

The Plans

We will need to install our own kitchen in our new commercial space. This includes a hood vent, ovens, mixers, sinks... all the bakery things. Commercial bakery equipment is very expensive, as you know or may guess, and we have a projected cost of around $73,000 to get up and running, to make the delicious, warm cookies! 

Having a storefront will open many possibilities for more cookie goodness. With more hours for baking and delivering, we plan to expand our menu to include more flavors that are in high demand (can you say helloooo peanut butter??), offer deliveries during the day to businesses, schools and “sick” friends at home, or ‘just cuz you’re in the mood for cookies’  and, of course, more Sasquatch sightings.

But, why should you give?

We can’t do any of this without you! We don’t have the option to increase hours at our current kitchen, nor the space needed for expansion. We’re now in that tricky place of needing to grow, but not yet having the capital to make it happen by ourselves.

Would you consider making a gift to establish Sasquatch Cookies in a new home and give the people of Colorado Springs a new local treasure- and more amazing cookies?

In addition, when you give to Sasquatch Cookies you are not just giving to another business, but you're also giving back to the community. Since our conception in August 2017, we have partnered with local food banks and charities, giving back 10% of our profits and hosting volunteer opportunities. We currently partner with Springs Rescue Mission, a fantastic local organization that specializes in helping those trapped in homelessness to regain their sense of worth and get back on their feet. And we are open to more possibilities for giving back!

About the Owners

Brooke Orist

Brooke is a Colorado Springs native, but spent many years in Atlanta. After moving around quite a bit, and working all over the world, she came to her senses and moved back home to beautiful Colorado. She had always dreamed of owning her own bakery and felt the natural next step was to just do it! This decision was influenced by her lifelong love and obsession for cookies, and her family of entrepreneurs: Her mother owned a tea room when she was growing up, her father owns a real estate office and her sister and brother-in-law own a fundraising company. 

Kate Zweber 
Kate is from Minnesota originally, and has always had a passion for social justice. She earned a degree in social work and taught English in Turkey for a couple of years. Upon returning to the U.S., she started working at a non-profit as administrative HR and personnel work but felt the magnitude of need and how hard it can be to make an impact as one individual. She has always loved baking and has an obsession with cookies (both making and eating them), but as a creative it never occurred to her to open a business that could both serve delicious cookies and still make an impact in the community... until she met Brooke! Kate's friends and family were not surprised that now an even larger part of her life revolves around chocolate and sugar.

When Brooke and Kate met, Brooke asked if Kate wanted to join her in opening a cookie company. They put their heads together, and two months later launched Sasquatch Cookies!

Advisory Board

Mike Rodgers – Business Development Advisor

Director of Strategic Initiatives and Partnerships for Navigators World Missions, Colorado Springs, CO

With over 30 years of International Experience in both For-Profit and Non-Profit Enterprises, Mike is an innovative, collaborative problem solver skilled in leading teams focused on Training, Ethnic Diversity, Entrepreneurship, Education and Business and professional development.  Mike has worked with nationals in over 25 countries including eight years in Brazil.

Ken Christie – Business Development Advisor

Director of the Missional Enterprise Initiative with The Navigators

Ken has more than 15 years’ experience coaching and consulting entrepreneurs in business startups both in the USA and in Central and Eastern Europe.  With an MBA in entrepreneurship and qualified to facilitate a Disciplined Entrepreneurship course, he is well prepared to come alongside budding entrepreneurs to help them get their businesses off on the right footing.  Additionally, Ken is focused on helping businesses develop multiple bottom lines beyond profit, including positive social and environmental impact.

story:
What is Precycle?

We are a hybrid between a farmer’s market and an old school bulk shop – under one roof – year round – designed to help customers to reduce their environmental impact.

 

OUR STORE IS PACKAGE-FREE

At Precycle, customers will find fresh local produce, bulk food, household and beauty products available in a package-free format. Customers can bring their own container or purchase one from us. We will offer a selection of jars, re-useable cotton bags or recycled paper bags.

 

 

HOW IT WORKS

 

Why Do We Do This?

As many of you, we are concerned about the future of our planet. Convenient disposables such as plastic packaging have become a major threat to our environment, ecosystem, and ultimately to our own health. We believe that each individual voice counts and that the choice of using reusable instead of disposable should be accessible!

 

The Plastic Problem

40 % of plastic produced is used only once and then thrown away. Only a fraction of plastic that has been ever produced is recycled. The majority of plastic ends up in landfills. Toxic chemicals that form plastic leach into our groundwater.

Plastic finds its way to our oceans where it poisons our ecosystems. Plastic in the ocean breaks down into microplastic that is ingested by ocean wildlife. According to statistics, plastic debris in our oceans outweighs zooplankton by a ratio of 36 to 1.

Eventually, these toxins from chemicals end up on your plate. By being so reliant on plastic, we are poisoning our planet and all of its inhabitants.

 

The Food Waste Problem

Food takes a lot of resources to grow. Land, water, energy, human labor are just a few of those resources. Industrial agriculture consumes a vast amount of resources to pursue its profits, leaving many hard-working farmers struggling for survival.

Deforestation gives way to the need for more farmland; more soil is being killed by excessive use of chemicals; freshwater resources are being depleted at an alarming pace.

30% of food grown never makes it to the table. Some is left in the fields to rot. Some is disqualified as not meeting food industry’s “standards”. Supermarkets create a notion of “abundance” by having extra inventory. Much of this inventory ends up in the landfill.

Finally, the food that makes it to consumer’s home is often wasted because of excessive quantities that are imposed upon the consumer.

All these resources and food that is left to rot in landfills creates a tremendous amount of greenhouse emissions, almost equivalent (87%) to that of the transportation industry.

 

Our Solution

At Precycle, you have a convenient option of reducing your environmental impact.

Customers buy exactly the amount they need (and nothing extra) – a concept that is impossible in a prepackaged format. This will help customers reduce or eliminate food waste. 

We value transparency – our customers will know exactly where their food comes from. Our suppliers work directly with farmers in North East region of the United States and the food will not travel more than 250 miles before it reaches our customers.

You pay for the product and not packaging (8 cents of every dollar customer pays for – is packaging cost – hence 8% of your shopping basket goes into the trash immediately)

 

We Need Your Help!

We can't wait to open our doors but we can't do it without you! Your contributions will go a long way in completing our store and furthering our mission.

This money will help us:

  • Complete construction
  • Cover furnishings 
  • Buy opening inventory

Katerina has invested her heart, soul, and savings into this project because she truly wants Brooklyn (and the world) to rethink their plastic use and realize that it is possible to live without it. 

If you can't make a contribution today, please share our campaign with your friends, family, neighbors, and anyone else who will listen! Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world by using their voice. Share us on social media and follow us at @PrecycleNYC for updates on the campaign, opening, and zero waste movement! 
 

REWARD ITEMS
 





 

Risks and Challenges
 

New York City is a difficult, yet exciting place to live and work. Despite the challenges in opening a small business- the red tape, overpriced real estate, and more, we have been diligently breaking down barriers and pushing the boundaries for 3+ years.

Our location in Bushwick is set and our contractors are finalizing the space before opening but we are still navigating the many aspects of opening up our first storefront. We have been tediously choosing our suppliers and can proudly say that we have been working with them to rethink their packaging standards.

We know it will be an ongoing process to change consumer behavior and industry standards. We are prepared to fight for the values we believe in every day and impact the way our communities shop for their groceries.  Our long term goal is to bring Precycle to YOUR neighborhood and we won’t stop until we achieve this goal.

Along this journey, we have met so many incredible individuals and businesses that strive to do better by the planet and humanity – this is the driving force for us to inspire and be inspired.

 

Our Story
 

Katerina is a passionate follower of the “zero-waste” movement and she is on a mission to inspire the whole of Brooklyn to become proactive about waste-free shopping - for the benefit of the planet and the entire ecosystem. The best way of reducing the impact of disposable plastic is not from recycling it, but from PREcycling it and not using it in the first place. Katerina is on a mission to provide consumers with a convenient way of incorporating these shopping habits into Brooklyn consumers through her zero-waste grocery store, Precycle. 

To read a full story, click here

story:
Enchantée !

I’m Kay, 49, British, born in Hong Kong to an Irish father and Macanese mother, raised between Asia and the UK and living in Paris since 1990.

The advantage of having such an disjointed childhood and mixed heritage is that (i) its easier to pick up languages (ii) you don’t feel tied to any particular place, which is why I probably found it so easy to move somewhere completely unfamiliar when I reached adulthood.

I set up my first company in 1993 at the age of 23. Pachyderme started off by representing British lighting designers in France and French lighting designers in Britain. It has grown over the years to representing lighting manufacturers from different countries, clients throughout the world (shops, department stores, interior architects) and its own showroom in Paris.

I love my job and am still passionate about lighting and decoration as a whole, however, after 25 years of Pachyderme I feel like a new challenge.

About 2 years ago I started renting a weekend house in a part of Normandy known as the Pays de Caux : a glorious region which boasts cliffs and beaches, as well as lush countryside, not to mention Neuchâtel cheese and calvados.

It was there that I contracted a strange and apparently incurable disease known in the local vernacular as ‘le syndrome du chineur compulsif’. Symptoms include rising at the crack of dawn to scout the innumerable boot and house clearance sales that mushroom on weekends and during summer. Or having to enter every single thrift and charity shop on your way to ANYWHERE. Sufferers experiencing an acute form of the illness tend to spend hours on the internet, after the sales have closed, in a never-ending quest for treasures whether they be furniture, art, tableware, clothing, curiosities or collectibles.

Fortunately I have been able to turn my affliction into a money-making venture. However, I have been using Pachyderme to trade my vintage finds up to now, which is not ideal and the time has come for Treasures & Old Tat to leave the nest and fly with its own wings.

 

The Project :

To begin with, I really need a dedicated website which will include the following features

  • The possibility of ordering any piece of vintage furniture on sale in a range of finishes and seeing the result online at a click. I work with an artist who uses Annie Sloan’s chalk paints which are GREAT for revamping and breathing new life into old pieces.


​

  • A ‘Pimp my Piece’ section which enables clients to send us photos of their OWN furniture that they would like to have renovated and receive a quote for the makeover including collection and delivery.

There is a real demand for this type of service as it is customary in France for older generations to pass on furniture and heirlooms to the younger generation who then find themselves in the dilemma of not knowing how to fit a carved-oak Gothic cabinet into their white designer living room, yet unable to throw the thing out owing to sentimental attachment.

  • A subscription which will entitle you to a monthly goody bag of vintage finds
     
  • English, Chinese and Japanese versions to reach a truly global market

The best quote I have received for a developing and online store and visual identity is 5000 E (this does not include translation which I can have done later on, launching in French and English which I can do myself)

Secondly, or rather, simultaneously I would like to open a store in Paris where clients can come and browse vintage, chat vintage and even drink tea (or wine, depending on the time of day) in vintage cups and glasses.

Over 50 % of my enquiries are from the Parisian region. Actually the beauty of my set up is that Normandy where I spend half my time provides me with up to 80 % of my inventory and I then deliver this to my clients when I go back to Paris.

However, there are still the hesitant and the indecisive who will always prefer to see and touch before buying. And, truth be told, I actually enjoy the human contact and meeting new people, and am certain that having a physical space would boost my business considerably. It’s incredible how many lovely people I have encountered and become friends with through my vintage addiction. It’s not just the object that attracts us per se, but the whole history it tells about how people used to live, and the tastes and technology of the time.

After a long and winding search, I have found the store of my dreams (and budget !) :

 

a 60 m2 (700 ft2) space at the foot of a beautiful mid-20th Century residential brick building in an upwardly-mobile yet still authentic part of Paris (20th arrondissement).

The property features 3m-high ceilings (10 ft) and great light. The rear entrance leads onto the courtyard where there is a small but well kept garden (I can already see the cocktail glasses hovering amongst the plants …).

The premises have great potential and great energy but it is not going to be cheap (hence the great deal) ….

  • The plumbing is non-existent. The toilet is in the courtyard, which is fine as I will be the only person using it. But it is a Turkish ‘squat’ model that needs to be adapted to the 21st Century. I also want to set up a small kitchen so as to be able to show some hospitality to my visitors and organise the occasional cocktail party.
     
  • The electricity needs a complete makeover and I also need to install a special ceiling system to exhibit chandeliers.
     

I know exactly how I would like to decorate the interior : bespoke cement tiles from Chettinad in Southern India (famous for its splendid 19th Century mansions), which I will also be proposing on sale,  and light grey tadelak on the walls to create an overall neutral-mineral background in contrast to my often baroque and colourful vintage wonders.
​

I am extremely fortunate in knowing some gifted craftsmen who have offered their services to me at rock-bottom prices as, not only do they wish to support my project, they hope to gain business through the shop which will function as a showcase for their work.

The whole makeover is going to cost in the region of 25 000 Euros :

  • 5000 Euros for electricity, ceiling rails and electric heaters
  • 14 000 Euros for walls, floor and ceiling
  • 2000 Euros for plumbing
  • 3000 Euros for woodwork (building a large cupboard,  laying floorboards in the cellar, repairing existing doors and windows)
  • 1000 Euros for just in case !

I have 10 000 Euros in savings to put towards the website and renovation of the store, so am short of 20 000 Euros, hence my campaign on Indiegogo.

My ultimate goal is to be able to finance both projects as they really go hand in hand.

I realise it is a large amount to ask, and would never have dared to do so without putting a significant amount of my own money into this campaign.

I will also make sure that any investment you choose to make is worth your while (see PERKS below).

 

How Can you Help ?

Before I launched my own campaign, I must have read over 50 others to get an idea of how the system works and how to present myself. There are SO MANY interesting projects on this site, so many creative people and impressive (and sometimes hilarious) presentations. I wanted to invest in them ALL, myself ! But first I have to concentrate on my own …

So why choose to support Treasures and Old Tat ?

Well, firstly maybe because you are a vintage junkie like myself and can totally identify with my adventure.

Or, maybe you are a Francophile and interested in all things French.

Whatever your motivation, please know that I will put your contribution to the best possible use. I am no stranger to hard work and the fact that Pachyderme is still running after 25 years is testimony itself to the fact that I must be doing something right.

As for the challenges ahead, I do not underestimate them in the least, however, my 2 mottos in life are : (i) what does not kill you makes you stronger (ii) the Chinese ideogram for disaster is the same for opportunity.

In funding my campaign, you will not only be helping me, but ultimately providing jobs for all the people involved in getting the project off the ground and, hopefully, as I expand, for a shop assistant and community manager.

You will also be contributing to a business that recycles products and breathes new life into what may very well have ended up in the dumpster otherwise !

 

What Will You Receive in Return

If you have read this far then you already deserve a perk, honestly ! If you still have some patience in you, then please read (and hopefully click) ahead :

5 $ - MERCI

You will receive a handwritten thank you note on an authentic vintage French post card.

10 $ - MERCI BEAUCOUP

Start your own collection of vintage French Camembert labels – use them in scrapbooks, on greeting cards or as wall decorations. Don’t worry, they are odourless !

15 $ - MERCI INFINIMENT

Discover French pop singers from the 60s, 70s and 80s with these vinyls ! If you don’t have a record player they make great decorative items.

20 $ - IL NE FALLAIT PAS !

You will receive a small goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (3 or more items)

30 $ - IL NE FALLAIT VRAIMENT PAS !

You will receive a medium goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (4 or more items)

50 $ - MAIS VOUS ETES FOU ?

You will receive a large goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (5 or more items)

100 $ - JE N'Y CROIS PAS !

100 $ donated will give you 120 $ credit to spend on the website once it is up and running (or before that on my existing store).

200 $ - VOUS ALLEZ ME FAIRE PLEURER

200 $ donated will give you 240 $ credit to spend on the Treasures & Old Tat website once it is up and running (or before that on my existing store).

This sum can be changed to any amount you care to choose. I will add an extra 20 % spending power on each dollar you donate.

500 $ - JE T’AIME

Spend a weekend as my guest in my flat in Paris situated 15 minutes walk from Montmartre.  

You will have the whole place to yourself and a bottle of champagne awaiting you.

It will be my pleasure to take you treasure hunting or show you my favourite places in Paris one afternoon if you so wish !

This offer is limited to 1 couple and 2 nights maximum. Please consult me for available dates.

1000 $ - JE VEUX T’EPOUSER

Spend 3 days in my my flat in Paris and 2 days in my place in Normandy. 

You will have the whole flat to yourself in Paris and a bottle of champagne awaiting you. You will have your own spacious room in Normandy and will be welcomed with a home cooked dinner including wine.

I will offer my language and bartering skills to you one whole day should you want to go on a vintage shopping spree or simply discover the sites.

This offer is limited to 1 couple and 5 nights maximum. Please consult me for available dates.

100 $ - A TABLE !

Ok, so you already have your Paris trip planned, and could not care the least about vintage or shopping. In that case come round for a home cooked 3-course gourmet dinner including a great wine bottle of wine. Lucky you, my second love after vintage is cooking !

 

If you cannot help out financially, but would like to support my project nonetheless, that is also great :

  • share my campaign on social media with your family and friends
  • if you are a graphic designer or web designer and can help make the online store, this would be amazing
  • if you have a vintage/antiques store or know someone who has one, please share my campaign with them. I would be delighted to take wholesale enquiries and source for them here.
story_txt:
Enchantée !
I’m Kay, 49, British, born in Hong Kong to an Irish father and Macanese mother, raised between Asia and the UK and living in Paris since 1990.
The advantage of having such an disjointed childhood and mixed heritage is that (i) its easier to pick up languages (ii) you don’t feel tied to any particular place, which is why I probably found it so easy to move somewhere completely unfamiliar when I reached adulthood.
I set up my first company in 1993 at the age of 23. Pachyderme started off by representing British lighting designers in France and French lighting designers in Britain. It has grown over the years to representing lighting manufacturers from different countries, clients throughout the world (shops, department stores, interior architects) and its own showroom in Paris.

I love my job and am still passionate about lighting and decoration as a whole, however, after 25 years of Pachyderme I feel like a new challenge.
About 2 years ago I started renting a weekend house in a part of Normandy known as the Pays de Caux : a glorious region which boasts cliffs and beaches, as well as lush countryside, not to mention Neuchâtel cheese and calvados.

It was there that I contracted a strange and apparently incurable disease known in the local vernacular as ‘le syndrome du chineur compulsif’. Symptoms include rising at the crack of dawn to scout the innumerable boot and house clearance sales that mushroom on weekends and during summer. Or having to enter every single thrift and charity shop on your way to ANYWHERE. Sufferers experiencing an acute form of the illness tend to spend hours on the internet, after the sales have closed, in a never-ending quest for treasures whether they be furniture, art, tableware, clothing, curiosities or collectibles.

Fortunately I have been able to turn my affliction into a money-making venture. However, I have been using Pachyderme to trade my vintage finds up to now, which is not ideal and the time has come for Treasures & Old Tat to leave the nest and fly with its own wings.
 
The Project :
To begin with, I really need a dedicated website which will include the following features
The possibility of ordering any piece of vintage furniture on sale in a range of finishes and seeing the result online at a click. I work with an artist who uses Annie Sloan’s chalk paints which are GREAT for revamping and breathing new life into old pieces.
​

A ‘Pimp my Piece’ section which enables clients to send us photos of their OWN furniture that they would like to have renovated and receive a quote for the makeover including collection and delivery.
There is a real demand for this type of service as it is customary in France for older generations to pass on furniture and heirlooms to the younger generation who then find themselves in the dilemma of not knowing how to fit a carved-oak Gothic cabinet into their white designer living room, yet unable to throw the thing out owing to sentimental attachment.

A subscription which will entitle you to a monthly goody bag of vintage finds 
English, Chinese and Japanese versions to reach a truly global market

The best quote I have received for a developing and online store and visual identity is 5000 E (this does not include translation which I can have done later on, launching in French and English which I can do myself)
Secondly, or rather, simultaneously I would like to open a store in Paris where clients can come and browse vintage, chat vintage and even drink tea (or wine, depending on the time of day) in vintage cups and glasses.
Over 50 % of my enquiries are from the Parisian region. Actually the beauty of my set up is that Normandy where I spend half my time provides me with up to 80 % of my inventory and I then deliver this to my clients when I go back to Paris.
However, there are still the hesitant and the indecisive who will always prefer to see and touch before buying. And, truth be told, I actually enjoy the human contact and meeting new people, and am certain that having a physical space would boost my business considerably. It’s incredible how many lovely people I have encountered and become friends with through my vintage addiction. It’s not just the object that attracts us per se, but the whole history it tells about how people used to live, and the tastes and technology of the time.
After a long and winding search, I have found the store of my dreams (and budget !) :
 

a 60 m2 (700 ft2) space at the foot of a beautiful mid-20th Century residential brick building in an upwardly-mobile yet still authentic part of Paris (20th arrondissement).
The property features 3m-high ceilings (10 ft) and great light. The rear entrance leads onto the courtyard where there is a small but well kept garden (I can already see the cocktail glasses hovering amongst the plants …).
The premises have great potential and great energy but it is not going to be cheap (hence the great deal) ….

The plumbing is non-existent. The toilet is in the courtyard, which is fine as I will be the only person using it. But it is a Turkish ‘squat’ model that needs to be adapted to the 21st Century. I also want to set up a small kitchen so as to be able to show some hospitality to my visitors and organise the occasional cocktail party. 
The electricity needs a complete makeover and I also need to install a special ceiling system to exhibit chandeliers. 

I know exactly how I would like to decorate the interior : bespoke cement tiles from Chettinad in Southern India (famous for its splendid 19th Century mansions), which I will also be proposing on sale,  and light grey tadelak on the walls to create an overall neutral-mineral background in contrast to my often baroque and colourful vintage wonders.​

I am extremely fortunate in knowing some gifted craftsmen who have offered their services to me at rock-bottom prices as, not only do they wish to support my project, they hope to gain business through the shop which will function as a showcase for their work.
The whole makeover is going to cost in the region of 25 000 Euros :


5000 Euros for electricity, ceiling rails and electric heaters

14 000 Euros for walls, floor and ceiling

2000 Euros for plumbing

3000 Euros for woodwork (building a large cupboard,  laying floorboards in the cellar, repairing existing doors and windows)

1000 Euros for just in case !

I have 10 000 Euros in savings to put towards the website and renovation of the store, so am short of 20 000 Euros, hence my campaign on Indiegogo.
My ultimate goal is to be able to finance both projects as they really go hand in hand.
I realise it is a large amount to ask, and would never have dared to do so without putting a significant amount of my own money into this campaign.
I will also make sure that any investment you choose to make is worth your while (see PERKS below).
 
How Can you Help ?
Before I launched my own campaign, I must have read over 50 others to get an idea of how the system works and how to present myself. There are SO MANY interesting projects on this site, so many creative people and impressive (and sometimes hilarious) presentations. I wanted to invest in them ALL, myself ! But first I have to concentrate on my own …
So why choose to support Treasures and Old Tat ?
Well, firstly maybe because you are a vintage junkie like myself and can totally identify with my adventure.
Or, maybe you are a Francophile and interested in all things French.
Whatever your motivation, please know that I will put your contribution to the best possible use. I am no stranger to hard work and the fact that Pachyderme is still running after 25 years is testimony itself to the fact that I must be doing something right.
As for the challenges ahead, I do not underestimate them in the least, however, my 2 mottos in life are : (i) what does not kill you makes you stronger (ii) the Chinese ideogram for disaster is the same for opportunity.
In funding my campaign, you will not only be helping me, but ultimately providing jobs for all the people involved in getting the project off the ground and, hopefully, as I expand, for a shop assistant and community manager.
You will also be contributing to a business that recycles products and breathes new life into what may very well have ended up in the dumpster otherwise !
 
What Will You Receive in Return
If you have read this far then you already deserve a perk, honestly ! If you still have some patience in you, then please read (and hopefully click) ahead :
5 $ - MERCI
You will receive a handwritten thank you note on an authentic vintage French post card.
10 $ - MERCI BEAUCOUP
Start your own collection of vintage French Camembert labels – use them in scrapbooks, on greeting cards or as wall decorations. Don’t worry, they are odourless !
15 $ - MERCI INFINIMENT
Discover French pop singers from the 60s, 70s and 80s with these vinyls ! If you don’t have a record player they make great decorative items.
20 $ - IL NE FALLAIT PAS !
You will receive a small goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (3 or more items)
30 $ - IL NE FALLAIT VRAIMENT PAS !
You will receive a medium goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (4 or more items)
50 $ - MAIS VOUS ETES FOU ?
You will receive a large goody bag with a mix of vintage French memorabilia (5 or more items)
100 $ - JE N'Y CROIS PAS !
100 $ donated will give you 120 $ credit to spend on the website once it is up and running (or before that on my existing store).
200 $ - VOUS ALLEZ ME FAIRE PLEURER
200 $ donated will give you 240 $ credit to spend on the Treasures & Old Tat website once it is up and running (or before that on my existing store).
This sum can be changed to any amount you care to choose. I will add an extra 20 % spending power on each dollar you donate.
500 $ - JE T’AIME
Spend a weekend as my guest in my flat in Paris situated 15 minutes walk from Montmartre.  
You will have the whole place to yourself and a bottle of champagne awaiting you.
It will be my pleasure to take you treasure hunting or show you my favourite places in Paris one afternoon if you so wish !
This offer is limited to 1 couple and 2 nights maximum. Please consult me for available dates.
1000 $ - JE VEUX T’EPOUSER
Spend 3 days in my my flat in Paris and 2 days in my place in Normandy. 
You will have the whole flat to yourself in Paris and a bottle of champagne awaiting you. You will have your own spacious room in Normandy and will be welcomed with a home cooked dinner including wine.
I will offer my language and bartering skills to you one whole day should you want to go on a vintage shopping spree or simply discover the sites.
This offer is limited to 1 couple and 5 nights maximum. Please consult me for available dates.
100 $ - A TABLE !
Ok, so you already have your Paris trip planned, and could not care the least about vintage or shopping. In that case come round for a home cooked 3-course gourmet dinner including a great wine bottle of wine. Lucky you, my second love after vintage is cooking !
 
If you cannot help out financially, but would like to support my project nonetheless, that is also great :

share my campaign on social media with your family and friends
if you are a graphic designer or web designer and can help make the online store, this would be amazing
if you have a vintage/antiques store or know someone who has one, please share my campaign with them. I would be delighted to take wholesale enquiries and source for them here.

story:
Short Summary

Invisible Majority was launched in January 2015 by Mia Loving and Blaqstarr. Our vision was to provide space and services that connected Baltimore's very silo'ed artist community while increasing access and visibility to the most underrepresented artists.

In this 5 years we've produced 3 festivals, produced and sponsored dozens of events, provided opportunities for hundreds of micro-businesses and worked with a wide array of artists to help move closer to their goals.

What We Need & What You Get

Over the last 5 years we've expressed the importance of space. In addition to establishing our own spaces, we partnered with prominent spaces. We're excited for the next leg of our journey and that is launching a retail store that carries the unique work of independent artists of Baltimore and beyond. 

Invisible Majority has always been about forging new paths and providing space for those that usually don't have it which isn't an easy path.  We are looking for community investors to help support and sustainability of the Invisible Majority Store. We plan to officially launch on our 5th anniversary January 15, 2020. 

We need funds for: 

* More retail equipment and furniture

* Store signage & decorations

* Invisible Majority specific merchandise

* First few months of rent, utilities and insurance

* PR support

What you get in return: 

* Supporting a business that you will have multiple ways to benefit from

* Access to discounts on space, products, events and services

* Public acknowledgement and promotion of your work

*Entry to upcoming fundraising events

* Return on investment for contributions above $1500

The Impact

November 2019 we worked with Books by Nikiea, Aaron Maybin Art and Vision2Life Services to curate the Invisible Majority Stage at Brilliant Baltimore. We were the 1st Black-owned business to curate a programming stage at the Baltimore Book Festival. We hosted panels, performances, and signings featuring Black self published authors and writers. We had retail space that sold the books of dozens of authors.

Many of the featured authors and patrons alike expressed the need for a space like this and a desire to support something like that on an ongoing basis. Many asked if we  had a physical location they could visit. It's that and years of working with micro-businesses that gave the final push to make this a reality. 

Imagine a space that consistently supports underrepresented artists and creators with retail space, events, workshops, office rental and mailbox availability. A true incubator that helps these businesses  level up in their process. 

Why are we committed to this? Because supporting creative entrepreneurs and micro-businesses contributes to economic equity and in a city like Baltimore with high poverty rates directly linked to systematic racism, this is even more important. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute funds?

Share!

Become a vendor!

Like and follow us on social media!

Leave an encouraging word!

Leave a positive review on Google or Facebook!

Volunteer!

story:
Who Are We & What are We Up To

Echo Bravo will be the sister bar to Kilo Bravo which is located at 180 North 10th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11211.  Kilo Bravo opened in September 2014.  It features food by Wing Jawn and shows all major sporting events for the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLB, World Cup, MMA, and Boxing.  In order to book more events, Kilo Bravo works in conjunction with multiple community based social leagues  such as NYC Social, S3, Williamsburg Softball, McCarren Softball, Brooklyn Kickball, and more!  Its drink menu features such popular items as the Moonshine Frosty and the Road Trip 50 State Cocktails.  

Echo Bravo will offer similar popular events and drinks that are currently featured at Kilo Bravo and will add a larger weekend brunch menu and karaoke parties to the schedule.  The new location is located in Bushwick, BK  at 445 Troutman Street and features a great front patio for prime outdoor seating fun.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $10,000 to get us started!  These funds will kick off our liquor license application and legal fees for our new business structure and small investor opportunity kits.

By purchasing any one of our unique perks you will be helping us with our first round of funding as well as helping shape our Echo Bravo community.

Should we not reach our funding goal in time or fail to open Echo Bravo at this location, we will honor the perks through our original Bravo Bar, Kilo Bravo, and reserve whatever funds we raised for a second Bravo location in the future.

The Impact

By starting our new company with contributions from you we are off to a great start!  The Bravo brand is aimed at both neighborhood enjoyment as well as social community building.  Kilo Bravo proudly offers discounts to all U.S. Military and Civil Servants.  With the expansion of our Bravo brand, we will be able to not only strengthen our support, but we will also be able to widen our reach.

Risks & Challenges

As a fledgling bar, Kilo Bravo quickly recognized the need to be flexible and was able to navigate the struggles new businesses face by quickly adapting to the neighborhood's wants and needs.  We plan to enter into Echo Bravo having learned from the formidable years of Kilo Bravo.   We will operate with open ears for what the Echo Bravo customer might further enjoy and willingly adapt!

Echo Bravo will be sharing the best-of-the-best in staff and management with Kilo Bravo as well as expanding our service family with even more talented members of our community.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Perks not for you?  Still want to help?  Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Perks NOT ENOUGH for you?  Message us about our investment kits.

Whether it's sharing our campaign info,  purchasing a perk, or buying-in as an investor to Echo and/or Kilo Bravo, we thank you for your time from the bottoms of our frozen Moonshine Frostys!!!!

story:
Help Dairy Farmers and Families in Northern California

Covid-19 has caused widespread disruption to agricultural businesses and family farms. 50% of the US food supply is consumed in restaurants and with so many restaurants closed, the impact on artisan dairy production is substantial—Bellwether Farms' food service customers have not ordered since the end of March. Simply put, our network of family sheep dairies is now producing a lot more milk than we can effectively sell.

Simultaneously, the massive unemployment throughout our economy is putting unbelievable strain on our essential hunger relief organizations. Here at Bellwether Farms, we find ourselves in a unique position to help both farmers and those in need of high-quality nutrition. That’s why we are starting Project Spilled Milk.

Project Spilled Milk aims to make the best out of a bad situation—that our farmers are supported, and that food gets to people who need it. All funds raised from this campaign will be used to purchase sheep milk from our local farmers, which we’ll use to make delicious yogurt to donate to Bay Area food banks. We will pledge to dedicate one production shift each week to this effort. If we are successful in raising our goal of $50,000, we will be able to buy the milk, ingredients, and packaging necessary to deliver 25,000 16oz containers of yogurt to food banks in Northern California.

The Need

Restaurants, schools, and universities represent the largest bulk purchasers of dairy across the United States. Since their doors have been largely closed due to the global pandemic, many dairy farmers are finding themselves with excess milk and no one to buy it.

The graph above shows the steep decline in dairy prices related to COVID-19. Class iii milk is used to make cheese and class iv is used for butter and dried dairy products. Source.

At the same time, people across the country are losing their jobs and finding themselves in need of financial and food security. Food banks are bridging the gap caused by the increasing unemployment rate and many are struggling to meet the rising demand.

The Impact

With your help, we can reach our goal of raising $50,000 to produce and donate 25,000 tubs of yogurt to feed families in need.

We’ve been long-time supporters of the Redwood Empire food bank. Help us spread the love to this and other Bay Area food banks in need.

Participation Perks

For every $2 raised, we’ll be able to send food to a family in need. To thank you for supporting this effort, check out our cool perks. We're offering social media shout-outs, Instagram story thank yous, and t-shirts to our donors.

Who We Are

Bellwether Farms is a family-run farm in Northern California that produces fine cheeses and yogurts from locally-sourced cow and sheep milk. Our artisanal products can be found at fine markets in the Bay Area and across the country such as Whole Foods, Oliver's Market, Nugget Markets and Berkeley Bowl.

Other Ways to Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially to this project. But, you can still help by sharing this campaign with your social networks. We’re using #ProjectSpilledMilk on Instagram. You can also find us on Facebook.
