story:
We were concerned about the low turnout in the 2014 election,  and and seeing empty places on ballots where no one was running for open offices. There are major problems in Nebraska that are effected by regressive politics in local and state government.  We talked about where we go from here, how we can bridge the gap that exists between the electorate and legislators, and how we can help transform public opinion into policy change. That's when Nebraska ROOTS was formed.

As progressives who care about the future of our communities, we believe that work begins by giving our neighbors the tools and skills they need to successfully affect the change they desire in their own communities. 

Based in Broken Bow, on the southern edge of the sandhills, Nebraska ROOTS is focused on identifying, developing, and training community leaders, groups, and organizations to affect change in our rural and small town communities. Our team has a wealth of experience in every aspect of social, community, and political advocacy, including: campaign strategy, fundraising and compliance, technology and communications, and grassroots organizing. 

We believe that through progressive growth, collaboration, and organization, we can build vibrant communities with strong economies.  And that by investing in trainings and organizing our neighbors and communities, we will effectively bring 100 or more niche sectors from across the state together, and motivate Nebraskans to get active, join progressive causes, vote, and run for office. 

The possibility for growth is tremendous. We have a 93-county customer base and a team that understands the culture, values, and social environment of the area. Our relationships are based on shared attitudes, beliefs, customs, and written and unwritten rules that have been developed over decades.

We see our employees, clients, and the wider community as equally important in the vision, goals and outcomes of ROOTS.  Embracing the diversity of our state will positively affect our performance and productivity.

We have seen great social and political change over the last decade. But there is a large sector of Nebraskans that is being left behind in public policy, further marginalized by a system that they see as corrupt. Through training and outreach, we can connect them with others and show those who want to how they can serve their communities.

Our goal of $32,000 will allow us to train and consult with 8 legislative candidates and 75 local candidates and assist 36 organizations with outreach , finance and technology.

Falling short of our goal will give us a slower start and limit the number of organizations and candidates that we can help in 2015 and 2016.

story:
BISA is in the final step of hosting the Bay Area's largest Indonesian cultural festival - Nusantara 2015. 



The Story



Nusantara is an Indonesian term for the Indonesian archipelago. 

We are the Berkeley Indonesian Student Association which is comprised of 120 Indonesian students and counting. To celebrate our 30th anniversary, we will be holding Nusantara 2015: Experience Indonesia, the Bay Area's largest Indonesian cultural night. 

The Indonesian community at Berkeley is not just those who are Indonesian by birth, but it consists of anyone interested in Indonesia. That is why we are hosting Nusantara - to bring a piece of our home to Berkeley.  

Nusantara will also be a collective effort within the Bay Area. We will be joining forces with other colleges and universities across the Bay Area. Besides uniting the Indonesian community in the Bay Area, our purpose of holding this event is to introduce Indonesian culture. 

With your help, we can make this event the biggest Indonesian cultural festival in the Bay Area.


Our Efforts


Throughout the past six months, we've participated in events like the East Asian Union Night Market to fundraise for Nusantara. Our students have volunteered their weekends and weekdays to flyer and table on Sproul, make Indomie, sate (chicken skewers) and es campur (mixed-fruit ice), amongst others.


These are some of our favourite highlights:


East Asian Union Night Market 

BISA Futsal Cup

Calapalooza 2015

Nasi Gila Fundraiser

The Numbers


While we have done some fundraising over the past 8 months, we still need some more in order to put on a grand event. 

Here is what your contribution will support:


  • Event staging and sound design for the performances
  • Food vendor area tents
  • Marketing and advertising
  • Administrative costs (electricity, cleaning and maintenance, sound operator)


Our projected costs for the event is a little over $15,000. We have an initial fundraising goal of $1,500; however, additional donations that take us past our goal will be used for the event and to maximize the potential of Nusantara. If we hit that goal, we can achieve the final step of reaching our ultimate goal of $15,000, which would allow us to make Nusantara the best it can be in April of this year.  


The Impact


BISA is a student organization and your contribution will lift the level of Nusantara's success.  Even without attending the festival, your contribution will allow you to participate in community it creates by way of a t-shirt, or special thank you message from the Nusantara committee, or even a copy of the Nusantara documentary! 



How You Can Help


Come to our event and experience Indonesia!

Contribute. Share this link on Facebook, Twitter, etc. Show us some love! 

We understand that not everyone is in a financial position to contribute.  The next best way to support is help us get the word out! 

Please share our campaign with friends and family via Facebook and Twitter.


Thank you for supporting us!



    Visit our website:    http://bisa.berkeley.edu


If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact any of our officers:

Gian Putra Wirjawan
BISA President
Mobile: +1 (510) 590-0219
Email: gwirjawan@berkeley.edu

Felix Saputra Pranoto 
NUSANTARA 2015 Head of Treasury 
Contact: +1 (206) 375-8778 
Email: felix.pranoto@berkeley.edu

Caitlin Bahari
NUSANTARA 2015 Head of Sponsorship
Contact: +1 (510) 277-2574
Email: cbahari@berkeley.edu

story:
As a swimmer for over 35 years, and a coach of the sport for nearly 20, I’ve seen my share of swimming-related injuries. But it wasn’t until my own near concussion from a collision with the pool wall that I realized the very real danger hidden lurking at the water's edge.

My injury inspired a quest for pool safety, both as a swimmer and coach. With the safety of children entrusted to my care while in the pool, I felt something had to be developed to help protect swimmers- particularly those most likely to encounter accidental collisions with a pool wall, including children, the elderly, the inexperienced and swimmers with special needs like sight impairment.

After years of research, design and development, I am pleased to announce the arrival of SAFE LANE-a unique safety system to help protect swimmers from the harm of wall collisions.  You can learn more about SAFE LANE, and see plenty of pictures and videos of SAFE LANE in action here: www.safelaneswimming.com

I look forward to working with you to keep children and all swimmers everywhere safe with every stroke they take.

- Keith McKnett - inventor of SAFE LANE


What is SAFE LANE?

Presenting a unique safety system that cushions the impact of wall collisions, lessening injury without impeding stroke, flip turns or race times. The patented design is:

· Easy to install, simply attaching to the lane lines

· Unnoticeable to swimmers, except in the instance of wall collision where it helps prevent injury

· Lightweight and portable when not in use

Who Does SAFE LANE Help?

SAFE LANE was designed to help children swimmers in particular, but the benefits do not stop there.  SAFE LANE provides injury protection for EVERY swimmer in the water. It is especially helpful for pools with swimmers who are:

·  Young or inexperienced

·  Sight-impaired

·  Elderly

·  Swimming with special needs

·  Unable to detect warning flags or prone to miscalculating distance while swimming


What does SAFE LANE do?

Within lap swimming and general pool use, wall collision is a very real issue for a number of reasons. SAFE LANE is a unique and easy system that helps prevent injury from such impacts, providing protection against:

·  Concussions

·  Compression injuries to the neck and back

·  Broken noses, teeth and bones

·  Severe lacerations


USA Swimming and American Red Cross Recognize the Problem We're Solving:

USA Swimming, the National Governing Body for the sport of swimming, has officially acknowledged the danger of concussions to swimmers hitting their heads on pool walls.

American Red Cross has written that "the ends of the pool are common accident areas, where swimmers may injure themselves during turns or finishes . . . situations for injury may occur when swimmers misjudge the distance and get hurt by swimming into the wall

What Do You Do to Help?
You can help in two ways:
1. Donations - In order to get SAFE LANE into pools to start protecting children and all other swimmers, we need some critical items:
- Insurance.  Consumer products are expensive to insure, and safety products are particularly expensive to insure.  Before putting the first SAFE LANE in the pool, we'll need to purchase $12,000 of insurance.
- Inventory.  We will be offering SAFE LANE to school districts  and other multi-pool entities, so a single order may entail the purchase of many SAFE LANE systems.  We will need to spend $5,446 up front to have the right amount of inventory on hand when we go to market. 
- Marketing. We know that word of mouth will be a key marketing tactic for SAFE LANE'S success, but we need some initial buzz to get the first SAFE LANE systems in pools and in use. $1,943 will go towards well-placed advertisements to get the attention of the swimming community and building a network through our website and emarketing. 
Every penny helps, and every penny will be spent working toward getting SAFE LANE into pools and protecting people from injury.
2. Help us spread the word
- Please take part in our mission to help protect children and other swimmers from injury.  Help us share information about SAFE LANE with swimmers and pool officials/managers near you.  Our innovative system will make a difference for all swimmers- from the well-seasoned water aficionados to the inexperienced, and all levels and capabilities in between.  Ways you can help us get the word out:
     - Email the link to this Indiegogo campaign to anyone you think might be interested in helping protect swimmers from injury. Especially swimmers who may need additional safety precautions in the pool, like those who are young, sight-impaired, are elderly or have special needs.  
     - Use the Indiegogo share tools to post about the SAFE LANE on Facebook or Twitter.  Let people know that you are helping make pools safer for swimmers of every level.


The Impact

We've uncovered data from hospitals around the country that illustrate just how numerous and dangerous pool wall collisions can be. Swimmers of all levels can benefit from additional measures taken to ensure their safety. Like extra padding around an end-zone goal post, SAFE LANE will help protect swimmers from potentially damaging collisions. Your contribution can help put SAFE LANE in pools, and all swimmers will be able to swim confidently, knowing they have a serious layer of protection between them and the wall.
story_txt:
As a swimmer
for over 35 years, and a coach of the sport for nearly 20, I’ve seen my
share of swimming-related injuries. But it wasn’t until my own near
concussion from a collision with the pool wall that I realized the very real
danger hidden lurking at the water's edge. 
My injury inspired a quest for pool safety, both as a swimmer and coach. With the safety of children entrusted to my care while in the pool, I felt something had to be
developed to help protect swimmers- particularly those most likely to encounter accidental collisions with a pool wall, including children, the elderly, the inexperienced and swimmers with special needs like sight impairment.
After years
of research, design and development, I am pleased to announce the arrival of SAFE LANE-a unique safety system to help protect swimmers from the harm of wall collisions.  You can learn more about SAFE LANE, and see plenty of pictures and videos of SAFE LANE in action here: www.safelaneswimming.com
I look
forward to working with you to keep children and all swimmers everywhere safe with every stroke they
take.
- Keith McKnett - inventor of SAFE LANE


What is SAFE LANE?
Presenting a unique safety system that cushions the impact of wall collisions, lessening injury without impeding stroke, flip turns or race times. The patented design is:
· Easy to install, simply attaching to the lane lines
· Unnoticeable to swimmers, except in the instance of wall collision where it helps prevent injury· Lightweight and portable when not in use

story:
BnB Global Services

Like many of us...I didn't choose my career my career chose me.  My name is S. Black and I started out my life studying forensic psychology with a desire to work in a Crime Scene Investigation (CSI) field.  My goal was to eventually secure a position with the FBI or CIA however, after graduating from college I spent just one week on a job working with individuals with developmental disabilities and my life was changed forever.  I have spent over 20 years helping to build quality lives for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD).  I am a 2016 candidate for a PhD in Industrial and Organizational Psychology.  Throughout my years of service to the I/DD and other underserved communities I have focused my energies on ensuring that underserved communities are offered the same opportunities in life as everyone.   Throughout my career I have transitioned start-up companies into successful organizations while securing government funding in excess of 15 million dollars for new development.  Over the last 10 years I have focused my efforts on training staff to empower them to be greater providers of services to these underserved communities. 

BnB Global Services is a research, development and training corporation whose consultant and training team use statistically reliable psychological methods and analytical tools to establish measurable outcomes for individuals and corporations alike.  BnB's reach will be to Individuals of an underserved population first, entry level staff second and corporations third.  It is our goal to enhance the lives of not only the underserved populations but to improve the emotional intelligence of direct support professionals in their roles as caretakers.  BnB will also work closely with corporations in strategic planning, training, quality improvement and quality of life management to improve their overall bottom line and services offered to the community.  

BnB is extremely excited about this endeavor and the affect that it will have on families and the community.  Families that have wanted more for their loved ones, will have access to services that will build a quality lifestyle that will bring joy to their loved one.  BnB will work with organizations and families alike to build a strong infrastructure and secure services to build a quality life plan for individuals within an underserved community.  Your donations will help to finance this infrastructure for this start-up corporation.  If you have ever wished you could help underserved communities, now is your time to effect a change in their lives.   

What We Need & What You Get

To launch this business BnB will need start-up funds in the amount of $48,429.

These funds will support the first fiscal year of this corporation as BnB secure contracts with existing organizations and develop staff and consultants through intense trainings and oversight.  These funds will broken down in the following manner over the first fiscal year (FY15) 5.4.15-9.30.15.

Salaries/Wages 45%; Accounting and Legal 13%; Staff Training 11%;Office Supplies 9%;  Equipment 8% and Other 14% (which includes marketing, travel, licenses, insurance, postage, rentals and other incidentals).  It should be noted that an office space will not be rented within the first fiscal year to maintain low overhead costs. Operations will occur locally.  All overhead costs will be kept at a bare minimum with free community resources being used as much as possible.   

BnB Global services will offer all donors recognition on the BnBGlobalServices.com website which will state "Your name/organization" cares about an underserved community. Each donor will have the opportunity to link your website/social page through the notoriety on the BnB Global services website.  We do reserve the right to be selective regarding contents which may contradict the mission/core values of BnB Global Services.  If there are any concerns you will be notified directly.  Dependent upon the contribution amount, you or your organization's name will be included on all promotional materials, banners, flyers etc. as donors that care about an underserved community for the first year of service 5.4.15-4.29.16.  Donation amounts will never be included but names will be listed from the highest donor to the least.  

If the goal of $48,429 is not reached then monies will be acquired through start-up bank loans, venture capitalist and additional fund raising ideas.  Funds collected will be used to fund expenses on a month by month basis so that services can begin as scheduled on May 4, 2015.  

The Impact

BnB Global Services mission is to help organizations to become better providers of services and goods and to improve the lives of those that are served.  Our Business is improving your Business..., Your need, our know how, lets make it happen... is the foundation in which BnB Global Services was birthed.  Helping organizations to become better organizations.  Support provided to this company will allow BnB to develop grants/scholarships for smaller businesses in the I/DD community that have a desire to improve services to our individuals however, do not have the capital  to develop an enhance quality improvement, training department or quality of life coordination for their individuals.  
All monies received over the asking goal will be used as grants for Quality of Life Coordination Services for individuals that live in the community. There are many families in our communities that struggle to get the support that they need for their loved ones.  They would like to provide a better quality of life but do not have the means in which to develop this quality of life plan.  BnB will use any additional funds to provide grants to families that apply for the quality of life services so that trained BnB consultants will work closely with these families to develop a quality of life plan and retain resources to build new meaning into the lives of their loved ones.  
If significant donations are received above the campaign funding amount then BnB will extend similar grants to organizations that are struggling to meet the needs of underserved communities.  BnB will provide grants in the area of Strategic Planning, Quality of Life Coordination, Quality Improvement Services, Training and Development and Administrative Supports and Services.  Parents, employees, individuals and stakeholders will have the opportunity to apply for these funds and BnB will provide equal opportunities to work with each organization dependent upon financial need.  State and government officials will also be given the opportunity to recommend organizations that could use assistance. BnB is looking to make a difference in organizations in how they serve their populations one program at a time.  Any assistance provided will aid in that mission.   
Over my 20+ year career I have worked at many organizations providing both clinical and administrative services alike.  My specialty however was in strategic planning, staff motivation, training and development of services.  Throughout my career I have assisted in the development of almost 40 new programs/services.  I have transitioned dozens of programs that were in jeopardy of loosing their funding into stellar model programs and enhanced the lives of individuals served through training and development of staff and services.  As new agencies were struggling, members of the governing body and other provider agencies have often provided my contact information as a resource for assistance.  I have also received notoriety for the work that I have done in the underserved communities. 

Although BnB has been established to assist any business, its foundation will always be helping the I/DD community because that is where my greatest passion lies.  

Risks & Challenges

There will be risks associated with gaining the most appropriate consultants that will be as passionate about their work as the founder and CEO, however with intense training and clear guidelines as to the expectations, BnB is confident that it will be able to develop a well rounded clinical and administrative staff to meet the needs of the communities served.  
There may be many of you that may read this and say I would like to help but I don't have the finances right now to help. There is always something that you can do...get the word out about this organization, send a link to your friends and organizational associates.  Tell someone to tell someone; and we thank you sincerely for your support.  
BnB Global Services Team

story:
Mission:

Mourning Glory Publishing puts out books and zines by writers of color and writers from other marginalized communities. We believe that society cannot be equitable or just when the voices of marginalized peoples are not shared, and our mission is to bring those voices from margin to centre, uplifting the words of people of color, trans and queer people, disabled people, neurodiverse people, and others.

History:

Hi, I'm Tessara, founder and lead editor for Mourning Glory Publishing. As a disabled Black queer woman living with PTSD and chronic illness, I struggled to find a press that seemed a good fit for the kind of poetry I write: explosive, painful, messy, radical. I just didn't see publishing houses taking a gamble on me, and I know many folks in the same boat. I started this press to share the stories that aren't being given a platform in the mainstream publishing industry.

In January 2015, we released our first book: Fallen/Forever Rising, my book of poetry, which is about being Black and poor in America. We have two forthcoming books planned. The first is After Ferguson: In Solidarity, a collection of art, poetry, and essays by creators of color in support of protestors in Ferguson and beyond. (The profits from this book are to be donated to community organizations supporting Black communities that face poverty and violence.) The second is My Body Asunder, the quarter-life memoir of a queer femme survivor of violence.

Goal:

The goal for this campaign is $10,000. It takes a lot to get established as a small press. With $10,000, we can establish ourselves and operate for at least a couple of years. Here's a breakdown of costs:

- $35 per book to register the author's copyright
- $125 to buy a single ISBN, to cover a single edition of a single book in a single format; $295 to buy 10 ISBNs, to each cover a single edition of a single book in a single format; $575 to buy 100 ISBNS, to each... you get the idea
- $25 each to buy up to 5 barcodes, to each use with a single ISBN; $23 each to buy 6-10 barcodes; $21 each to buy 11-100 barcodes
- $150 per hour (starting) for cover and other graphic design from an independent contractor (Note: MGP will seek to hire designers from marginalized communities as part of our mission to benefit these communities)
- $144 per year for accounting software and assistance
- $218 per year for assistance filing taxes
- $232 to pay for a year of a P.O. Box for business purposes (currently, the press is based out of the founder's house)
- $912 to pay for a small storage unit for one year to hold books awaiting sale; $1,812 for a mid-size storage unit
- $99 per year for 1 Tb of storage with Dropbox, to facilitate team collaboration
- $840 per year for the entire Adobe creative suite, including apps that are used for producing audiobooks, designing book interiors, creating book trailers, editing photos and other materials, and more
- $893 for a small (500 books) print-on-demand or POD run of a short book (50 pages); $2,711 for an offset run (2000 books) of the same
- $1,149 for a small (500 books) POD run of a mid-length book (150 pages); $3,386 for an offset run (2000 books) of the same
- $1,992 for a small (500 books) POD run of a long book (300 pages); $5,800 for an offset run of the same (Note: offset printing costs less in the long run, as long as you sell all the books, and often produces higher quality books)

The funds raised here will allow MGP to buy some necessary things and establish long-term goals and plans to help us grow. Our eventual goal is to become a 501(c)3 non-profit, so we can get grants and receive tax-deductible donations to help us do this important work. But it's early days, which means we need your support to make it happen.

Perks!

There are a bunch of perks to giving, beyond the satisfaction of supporting our dreams, including: being listed on our website ($5), receiving a signed copy of the first book ($35), and subscribing to receive the first 4 books ($100). There's even more in the sidebar--check them out!

If you can't give money (and we completely understand), you can still support the press by spreading the word. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr--wherever you are on the web. We appreciate your support!

story:
I've always enjoyed the feeling of gratitude after helping someone who needs it. Since I was a little boy, helping others has always been one of my major priorities, especially after witnessing a family of four on the street trying to scramble up a dollar. I was also in love with traveling, particularly long distances that required air travel. At the airport, the excitement of going to my destination  was enough for me. However, I frequently noticed kids didn't share my enthusiasm. In frustration and boredom, they  kick the backs of seats , complain, and even throw temper tantrums. That's when it hit me!  I decided to create a solution that not only aids kids and parents on family vacations but can also help my efforts to give financial support to organizations that help homeless families  gain shelter and  hope.

My goal is to get this products into highway stops, train and bus stations, airports and souvenir shops.  The funds that I raise will not only help me to help others.  I will also use this money to refine my products package, cover shipping costs and expand the kits content selection.
story_txt: I've always enjoyed the feeling of gratitude after helping someone who needs it. Since I was a little boy, helping others has always been one of my major priorities, especially after witnessing a family of four on the street trying to scramble up a dollar. I was also in love with traveling, particularly long distances that required air travel. At the airport, the excitement of going to my destination  was enough for me. However, I frequently noticed kids didn't share my enthusiasm. In frustration and boredom, they  kick the backs of seats , complain, and even throw temper tantrums. That's when it hit me!  I decided to create a solution that not only aids kids and parents on family vacations but can also help my efforts to give financial support to organizations that help homeless families  gain shelter and  hope.My goal is to get this products into highway stops, train and bus stations, airports and souvenir shops.  The funds that I raise will not only help me to help others.  I will also use this money to refine my products package, cover shipping costs and expand the kits content selection.

story:
Support us in Non-Monetary Terms
We know that not everyone can contribute monetarily, however you can barter your support instead of money.
  • Leave comment on what you think about Wepware: Worth 1$
  • Sign-up on http://wepware.com & download chrome extension : Worth 10$
  • Use extension and grab interesting content for community:  Worth 25$
  • Make Friends, Create Group and share content on Wepware: Worth 50$
=======================================
What is Wepware?

Save what matters:

"Getting information off the internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant."

Wepware is a next generation, award winning, smart web tool built on Web 3.0 principles that allows you to capture any part of the webpage and create a live- auto updating web scrapbook of your favorite internet content.  You simply GRAB the content, PLACE it on a page or SHARE it directly with your friends.

In today's world of information overload, Wepware allows you to save what really matters to you on the internet through multiple channels and platforms. You can capture content through browser, desktop and mobile applications.  You can save entire webpage or any particular part of your interest. It allows you to capture Images and Videos with a single click. 

Personalize your Web:

Unlike other grab tools, Wepware’s patented technology allows you to use captured contents to create your own mashup on any webpage. It allows you to create personalized dashboards with which you can access all the information at single place.

World's First True Web 3.0 platform:


As Mr. Einstein rightly said, information is not knowledge, but knowledge can be derived when information is curated. Curated Web is an emerging trend and fundamental of Web 3.0 philosophy. 

Future is Web 3.0 and the transition has already begun. Nova Spivack defines Web 3.0 as connective intelligence; connecting data, concepts, applications and ultimately people. 


Amazing Feature List:

Feature List: 
Unique Web 3.0 features:

  • Create quick dashboards and share content on the go.
  • View Realtime version without leaving your dashboard 
  • Create live self-updating mashup on any webpage using your content. Wepware remembers the content that has been added to any page and automatically loads them in your future visits.
  • "Bind" feature to combine and share multiple contents together. This can be useful in quick research and blog article writing.

Show grabs in Real-Time:

You can view dynamic content by just clicking "show in realtime" button while you are browsing your grabs.



Personalize Web:

You can drag and drop captured contents from your Wepware tray to any webpage and create dynamic personalized dashboard.



Other noteworthy features:

  • Capture entire webpage or just a section.
  • Grab images and Videos on single click.
  • Edit Image in inbuilt image editor
  • Create quick text notes.
  • Create group, invite people and share grabs with them.
  • Enhanced Privacy settings - Provision for private folder and grabs


How to use?

Following is the quick introduction to get you started.

 




Who should use Wepware? Why?

Wepware is a truly multi-purpose versatile platform with wide range of applications. 

Benefits:

  • Practicality: You can grab and place all types of content—websites, files, images, text, links, games, videos or flash file

  • Convenience: Grabbed content will stay wherever you placed it for as long as you need it

  • Privacy: All of your grabs are only for your eyes to see—unless you want to share it

  • Sharing: You can easily share content through existing social networks (as a snapshot), with the internal Wepware community (as real-time content), and to other external contacts (with a public URL)

  • Accessibility:  All of your content will be accessible through desktop and mobile devices

  • Curated Content: Benefit from efforts already put by thousands of users and get access to curated content in any diverse areas. 


Who are we?

We are a team of 12 people: programmers, designers, planners, web experts and marketers who dream to grow Wepware from a productivity tool to an open source social platform for service and content mash up.


Why do we need your help?

We want Indiegogo community's help and support for:

(1) Launching further new awesome features and products.

(2) Getting feedback on existing product and making it even better.

(3) Growing Wepware community so that even more people can benefit from content curation

We have already spent many years in Research & Development of technology behind Wepware and we also have related patents. During that time Wepware community has been growing and we have received feedback that they would love to see Wepware on multiple platforms and browsers. Since currently Wepware is completely free we require your help and support to take this product to the next level and to grow the Wepware community even further.

What we already have:

(1) We have a fully functional website at http://www.wepware.com

(2) Chrome Extension

(3) Windows Desktop Application

(4) Android Application 

(5) iOS Application

You can download the above mentioned products from our Download page.


Funds Usage:

Today, Wepware is available for Google Chrome, but we want Wepware to be a truly universal tool that supports all major browsers and platforms.   We’re in the process of improving our “real-time grab” feature to optimize the grabbing of real-time content from even more websites.  

  • Improve our social platform to make network collaborations even more effective.
  • Currently content grabbing is possible from Google chrome, Desktop and mobile apps. We want to extend Wepware to all major web browsers like Firefox, IE and Safari.
  • Add more robust algorithms and features like adding keywords digest from captured page and autoclassification.
  • Improve Desktop version and introduce Mac version.
  • Add content marketplace. 


What's in Perk?

If we reach USD 2,000 goal we will launch VIP account.

Wepware Premium VIP Account:

  • Additional 5 GB of storage space
  • Access to market place
  • Access to Collaboration Tools
  • Increased Personalization Tools
  • Many advanced features
check out perk section for other perks and early bird offers.

Stretch Goals:

$10,000 : Versions for other leading browsers
$20,000 : Free Content library subscription for everyone
$100,000 : Option to Autosave grabs to major online storage services like Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDirve etc. providing you with virtually unlimited storage place. Plus many advanced features like offline storage, page update alerts and additional capture tools.


Risks & Challenges

Since Wepware is a digital product, there is not much risk in terms of manufacturing and delivery of the product. Since we have total control of the development process, we are reasonably sure that we will be able to deliver the said features and functionalities in time. In fact we already have working beta product so there is nothing to worry from product feasibility point of view.

However there is a risk that we may not be able to deliver all the features as promised and beta phase may get extended.


Other Ways You Can Help:

We know that not everyone can contribute monetarily, but you can still help us by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to your friends and family members. You can also register today on Wepware.com and contribute content to Wepware community.

story:
Our company is estimated to feed 30,000 Children this year, but we know that it's entirely realistic to feed more. Help us Inspyre the world. #InspyreTheMovement

Inspyre is a west coast driven clothing brand out of Indianapolis, Indiana. We sell unique clothing and accessories to raise awareness on the growing issue of world hunger. Every shirt we sell feeds SIX hungry children, every bracelet feeds one, and we have a growing line of new products all feeding children per unit sold. In this world, 805 million people don't have enough food to lead and live a healthy lifestyle. Thats 1 in 9 people on the globe! Hunger is real, but swept under the rug by so many people. If we want to solve this problem, we can, but we need to start somewhere! So why not here and now?! Hunger takes a devastating toll on the mind and body, especially at a young age, so a child that doesn't get the proper nourishment is not getting an equal opportunity at life!


 Stop Hunger Now is a successful non-profit Organization that has been feeding children since 1998. This 350 million dollar non-profit company has signed a partnership with Inspyre Wear LLP. Partnership details include Marketing, and logo exposure from both parties. We have a goal to raise fifty thousand dollars in the first year. This means 30,000 children fed directly through Inspyre. We want to launch  this partnership with a bang! We will be shooting a creative video showing the  impact Inspyre is making on the world. This video will be viewed by a minimum of our 30,000 followers through social networks on the launch date, April  28, 2015. Our company is being reviewed by the "Vans Warped Tour", and we are forecasted  to feed around 25,000 in just three months. 

 More readily available funds are going to help as follows: 

Inventory - We are hoping to raise $15,000 for more product.

Media - We need $5,000 to hire the production team.

Equipment - We would like to buy a shirt press and dryer and other materials to eliminate the middle man. This could help us feed Nine to Twelve children on select clothing.   $7,000

All of that can be achieved by raising just $27,000!

Staff - We have dedicated a year of our lives and worked seven days a week to insure the feeding goes on! $8,000 will help employees fiscal responsibilities.

Marketing - $15,000 will ensure nationwide exposure creating more Inspyration and throwing us over our goal of feeding 30,000 children.

$50,000 will ensure everything above!!

Web Design/SEO  - Our company will come out with a state-of-the-art website if we had $7,500

Mass media - $5,000 Leading clothing companies post professional photos and videos daily. We need proper equipment to keep all of you and our followers up to speed with our exciting day to day operations.

Sponsorships - $5,000 to $30,000 for a summer festival and clothing show budget where we can travel and spread the word selling product and raising awareness. 

Design - We are in the process of adding designer/mid-design clothing. With the mark-up being so much more substantial we can increase the number of children fed per product. We can hire a team of designers for about $20,000

$100,000 would put Inspyre on the map!

Having the utmost confidence in our company, if we have financial freedom to expand, Inspyre WILL feed well over 30,000 children. Your donation in this company is guaranteed to feed children and to those who donate over $100 will receive an action report explaining exactly where your money went.

story:
Short Summary

We are a family-run business – the 4 Perry Sisters – building the Glebe with our parents since we were old enough to weed the garden. Kez, is our general manager (as well as super-mum to the next generation of Glebers), Tessa, is the head chef (also an accomplished musician), Jo is our productions and events coordinator (also an accomplished musician), and Mia is our administration and public relations writer.  We work with a team including a financial manager, a facilities manager, and a designer, along with many other essential “Glebers.”

This campaign is to start a local bakery built on the same values, passion, and local and sustainable produce that guides the Glebe Café, Shop, and Gardens. The Glebe Bakery will produce high quality, affordable, and downright delicious produce – breads, pastries, cakes, tarts, pies – all year round. The bakery will supply the Glebe café and shop, but also other outlets to ensure accessibility for those who don’t live down the road. The Glebe Bakery will employ new year-round staff, and even invite you in to teach you how to make your own bread at home! Due to the nature of our business, being a small, seasonal, and community-based, the Glebe Bakery will have huge impact – not only to you, our customers and community, but to our local economy, environment, and local cultural and entertainment scene (who said baking was just for mums!?).  

Here’s why:

The Impact

Economy: The Glebe Bakery will directly create four local jobs, will increase the demand on local producers (including dairy, egg, vegetable and meat producers), will begin the export of local produce nationally, and will allow a larger customer base access to local and sustainable food. 

Environment: The Glebe Bakery will be run with the same ethical, environmental, and sustainable standards as the rest of the Glebe activity. As well as sourcing ingredients locally and organically, we will be using our own well-water, our own solar power, and our own composting system. We have long been affiliated with the Slow Food Ireland movement, and those philosophies continue to inform our methods and decisions.

Culture/entertainment: The Glebe Bakery will not stop at damn-good baked goods. We intend to expand the culture of food in west-cork, we intend to experiment with baking, teach baking, and incorporate the bakery into the increasing range of entertainment and events at the Glebe and surrounding areas.


This project is close to our hearts, we believe in its power and potential as members of this community, as environmentalists, as foodies, and as business owners. No matter how we tried to plan and structure the future of the Glebe, we could not make it work without including this new project. It has become an essential bridge to cross for us in terms of fulfilling and maintaining the commitment to quality, enjoyment, inspiration and community that guides our work.


What We Need & What You Get

- We need €20,000 to re-fit an existing building into a professional kitchen. 

 We genuinely, humbly, appreciate any amount of investment and support you can give to this project,

The money raised will go towards the improvements on an existing building to get it up to the standards required by the Food Safety Authority of Ireland (11,000 euro).

We will be buying a bakers oven (5,000 euro)

A 10ltr bakery mixer (1,000 euro)

2 fridges (1,800)

Shelving, sinks, utensils, (1,200)

If we are fortunate enough to raise more money than stated above we will put it towards developing new products and making all products accessible and affordable to our local and national communities. We will also increase the programming of teaching, community and educational events

Risks & Challenges

In planning this project we have been vigilant and realistic about the risks that are involved. In consultation with our team we have determined that there are two risks that require our attention. One is the possibility of insufficient funding to complete the kitchen. The second is the possibility of insufficient demand of the produce to create sustainability of the bakery business. We have prepared to tackle both of these risks.

Firstly, we have contingency plans for developments with partial funding, should we not reach our funding goals. With €5000 raised we will purchase a new commercial oven to accomplish a greater efficiency and output of breads and cakes from our current kitchen. With €10000 raised we will create a basic kitchen space including one oven that is not self sufficient of the existing main kitchen, but serves as an overflow space for specific events or purposes. With €15000 raised, we will re-fit the kitchen with only one oven which will allow for the launching of the Glebe Bakery, but on a slightly smaller scale and with smaller scope than planned. With €20000 raised, we will be able to completely re-fit the new bakery kitchen including all stated equipment. With an excess of €20,000 we will develop new products, packaging and distribution materials, and will increase the accesibility and affordability of the produce and facility.

Secondly, we have planned a wide and innovative series of marketing strategies to launch the bakery and increase people’s awareness of it and access to it. We have planned off-site partnerships for distribution to ensure that the seasonal nature of our location does not become detrimental to the success of the bakery. We have an established reputation for quality and service, which ensures that the Bakery will begin with a huge headstart.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that, although you may share our love of good food, good company, and good decisions, you may not be able to contribute financially this project. Please read on anyway! We would value your help so much in other ways. In fact, if you can help by spreading the word of this campaign and encouraging others to support, please let us know and we’ll send you your very own perk! Your perk will be selected in relation to your support, so please do all you can – it will be gratefully received and gladly reciprocated.

With €15000 raised, we will re-fit the kitchen with only one oven which will allow for the launching of the Glebe Bakery, but on a slightly smaller scale and with smaller scope than planned. With €20000 raised, we will be able to completely re-fit the new bakery kitchen including all stated equipment. With an excess of €20,000 we will develop new products, packaging and distribution materials, and will increase the accesibility and affordability of the produce and facility. Secondly, we have planned a wide and innovative series of marketing strategies to launch the bakery and increase people’s awareness of it and access to it. We have planned off-site partnerships for distribution to ensure that the seasonal nature of our location does not become detrimental to the success of the bakery. We have an established reputation for quality and service, which ensures that the Bakery will begin with a huge headstart.
Other Ways You Can Help 
We understand that, although you may share our love of good food, good company, and good decisions, you may not be able to contribute financially this project. Please read on anyway! We would value your help so much in other ways. In fact, if you can help by spreading the word of this campaign and encouraging others to support, please let us know and we’ll send you your very own perk! Your perk will be selected in relation to your support, so please do all you can – it will be gratefully received and gladly reciprocated.

story:
The Odd story....

2 odd guys + a dream + fantastic support = great beer for the masses! A perfect equation is you ask me….

 

Oddball Brewing Company started one day when two guys (co-workers) got to talking and discovered their mutual love for home brewing and a passion to one day bring great beer to the masses. Mark and Bill have been home brewing collectively for 37 years (that’s a whole lotta beer!) and have been able to hone their brewing skills through trial and error. They have not only traveled various places across the country (and world) in search of odd brews, but also bring their own unique interpretations of favorite beer styles to the mix (which can be a bit odd at times). Breweries, bars, brew fests…you name it…they have been there to taste wide varieties of brews (the dedication and sacrifice is mind-boggling).

The brewery is situated in an 1890's brick building (that’s old) which in previous lives has been a restaurant, pizza parlor, art studio…the list could go on and on. Oddball will be a 7 barrel system carefully, meticulously, lovingly…(you get the point) built by the brewers/ co-owners themselves (no that’s a lot of beer).

 

What We Need & What You Get

 Building a successful brewery takes time, patience,
and most importantly support. We have been overwhelmed with the support through individual interest and kind words we have received during this exciting
adventure, but as with any new adventure and an attempt of making a dream and
passion a reality, there is a financial price. We are looking for further support from individuals through generous donations. These well-appreciated donations come with rewards, of course. Each reward level will come with rewards, so the more financial support you give, the greater the rewards for you (along with our everlasting gratitude). Thank you...thank you...thank you.....
How your financial support will go to good use:
* Construction (brew house, taproom, and general construction)
* Equipment (brewing equipment, packaging, and general equipment)
 

The Impact

Impact?... Well great beer for the masses of course!! Who doesn't want great beer?!?!

The craft beer industry is growing and we want to be a part of the movement. We believe with a solid foundation comprised of unique and flavorful brews and support can place us in an industry that values its customers.

 Beer + money = happiness 
 

Risks & Challenges

 What happens if we don't get your financial support? Well, quite frankly the brewery may take longer to open. A shame, right! We don't want this to happen. Our plan is to open November 2015 and we want to see this happen as much as you do, so please help us make this happen. Think of your family, neighbors....beer lovers unite!!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only are we asking for your generous financial contribution to our fantastic brewery, but we are also asking you to shout it from the rooftops (well get the word out anyways). Tell your family, friends, coworkers, strangers......show your love!! Help us campaign (you know you want to). Facebook, Twitter, email....we'll take whatever we can get!!!

story:
Surfing is Caring has two goals: to provide the joys of surfing to children in rough areas of the world and to sell SiC apparel. The money raised by selling shirts and other products will go to trips to poor countries to teach kids to surf. We will provide surfboards, lessons, and support with the goal of establishing surfing communities in towns and villages. SiC's goal is to spread hope and love through surfing. Our first adventure will target the Ivory Coast. We wish to help the former child-soldiers cope and find peace with their PTSD and other trauma through surfing. The late John Paskowitz once said, "If everyone could share waves together, there would be no fighting in the world." This August, a small group of young, passionate surfers will brave the african coasts spreading what has brought them so much joy in their lives…surfing. If partnered with the right organization, we can also be used as a vehicle to raise awareness for local problems, as well as providing relief. For example, we would be willing to team up with a humanitarian effort that provides clean water like "Waves for Water."


The other part of the project is selling a marketable product. Our first line of product is T-shirts. Our shirts will be simple and classy. Half of our profits raised from our T-shirt sales will go towards our trips to teach children how to surf.
